Tresc_opinii: I recently flew with Swiss Air on the Bucharest to Zurich route in an Airbus A220. Despite the overall comfort of the aircraft and the friendliness of the cabin crew, the cabin temperature was much too low and could not be adjusted, despite our requests. The crew was kind and suggested we wear warmer clothes, assuring us that the situation would improve over time. Unfortunately, the temperature remained consistently low throughout the flight, making the journey less comfortable than we would have liked. Nevertheless, the aircraft was modern and clean, and the staff provided prompt and friendly service. If it weren't for the temperature issue, I would have had a very pleasant experience. If the temperature cannot be adjusted immediately, the company could provide passengers with additional blankets to offer them thermal comfort. Overall, my flight experience with Swiss Air was good, but the temperature issue left a negative impression.

Tytul_opinii: "fallen so far in terms of spirit"
Tresc_opinii: My third long-haul flight in SWISS Business Class this year has left me disappointed. In January, the amenity kit came in a Victorinox aluminum box, albeit with minimal contents inside a plastic bag. By November, the box was gone, and now in December, the situation remains unchanged. The plastic bag still contains instructions referencing the aluminum box. I had to specifically request the box from a kind flight attendant. How has SWISS fallen so far in terms of spirit and thoughtful gestures?
Trasa: Palermo to Sao Paulo via Zurich

Tresc_opinii: Shameful customer service. Flight was ok but my luggage was somehow lost in the process and delivered to final destination after a couple of days. I was on holidays, thus bought the basic necessities on the day of my arrival, so my son and I had something to wear in this lapse of time. The treatment of my refund claim by Swiss Airlines has been mediocre. To start with, it took me 3 attempts to file the claim via their website, although all 3 claims were done in the exact same way, before it was finally acknowledged by email. In the meantime, I also tried to reach Swiss customer service by phone, trying 5 different phone numbers, each person redirecting me to a different internal department, which seems to be the only thing at which Swiss excels. As this led nowhere, I filed a complaint with Lufthansa. This too was unsuccessful, as the company rightly stated that the flight was operated by Swiss Airline and that it was up to them to sort out the problem. Despite my email reminders, there has been no follow-up on my claim (although I do have a claim, reference number 2410-LX-03571). I phoned Swiss customer service, who told me that it was impossible to deal with requests other than buying tickets over the phone, and that they couldn't transfer me internally as there was no competent department able to manage my claim (?!). I'm astounded by the non-existence (and on the rare occasions when I've managed to speak to someone, incompetence) of Swiss Airlines customer service. Until now, I have been unable to take my case any further with them, either by email or by telephone. When given the choice, I strongly encourage anyone to fly with a different airline company.

Stranded by a Swiss Air delay, missed connecting flight and was treated like a criminal. Rude, vile staff at Zurich Airport acted like SS prison guards—no help, no apology. Forced into a prison-like airport hostel with no food or information. For those seeking a truly unforgettable journey, Swiss Air delivers inhumane & unacceptable levels of service.
Trasa: Birmingham to Hong Kong via Zurich

Tresc_opinii: My food onboard was awful but flying Swiss first the food is disappointing, there is not many options. To book a meal in advance over the website is a joke, very simple choices and the same meal that they offer for business they only change the plate and serve in first! There is not a second choice of champagne which for a first class is not ok, It should have a second choice of champagne. The selection of cocktails is very poor. The entertainment system is the worst, you can’t listen to your favorite songs there is not many songs.

The Seat: I sat in seat 15F next to the window, this seat was spacious and much better than other airlines I've flown in this region. There was ample legroom, the width was reasonable and the window on the A220-300 was large as normal. The 2-3 configuration of the cabin is interesting but everything was okay even on the side with the middle seat because I was travelling with my family of three. The Service: The staff were perfectly friendly, kind and polite with us and offered us chocolates and water during the flight. The chocolate was tasty and the water was normal. The Ground Service: The flight was perfectly on time and we landed on schedule. The boarding was normal and bar a bus gate was completely seamless. Overall, the flight was seamless and comfortable. I booked this flight using miles so I can't comment on the price but I would definitely recommend SWISS if you are flying to Switzerland over low-cost airlines like EasyJet in the same region.

Tytul_opinii: “Book this airline at your own risk”
Tresc_opinii: Book this airline at your own risk, their ground staff and customer service is full of human error. Do NOT check in valuable things because if you do and they lost it, you will lose it forever and there is a possibility for you not to be able to track your luggage. They have a way around of addressing problems with customers, instead of giving clear instructions they will rather humiliate you in public. I lost my luggage on my recent flight from LHR to ZRH and to this date I still can’t track where my luggage is nor submit a report, because my data was erased from their system. Swiss air, you can do better than this!

Unfortunately, my recent experience with this airline fell significantly short of expectations from start to finish. The flight was delayed by nearly an hour, with no clear explanation provided to passengers. The boarding process was further marred by unprofessional and discourteous behavior from the gate staff, which left a poor first impression. Onboard, the cabin crew’s inattentiveness compounded the overall disappointment. Regrettably, this experience failed to meet the standards I associate with quality air travel.

Good trip with Helvetic and Swiss, largely on time, service good enough for Economy, last leg ZRH STR delayed by some 90 min due to snowfall in Zurich and late incoming aircraft. Of course flights back from DXB to Europe are no fun in Economy if you are tall, as I am, but my budget is not Swiss' fault.

Completely full flight to London, notable service from cabin crew to make sure overhead luggage could all be accommodated. You don't get much on European flights, but service good, and smiles abundant. Both flight to London and back arrived early which is quite an achievement flying to/from Heathrow!

I bought a refundable ticket for me and my wife and we selected and paid for seats. Nowhere in the booking process does it say that the seats are not refundable and it stands to reason that if you buy a refundable ticket that the entire purchase is refundable. They are clearly taking advantage of customers and they rely on a page outside the booking process to say that its their policy to refund seats in voluntary cancellations. Its a despicable practice

Our experience on Swiss Airlines flight LX 161 from Tokyo to Zurich left us disappointed. Originally, we were booked on a direct KLM flight to Amsterdam, which was canceled, forcing us to reroute through Zurich with Swiss and lose a day of work. The service was notably rude. A specific stewardess (initials G.M.) was dismissive from the start. When my friend politely asked for a snack during this 14-hour flight, she gave him a lecture on why passengers should bring their own food. Eventually, she gave him a sandwich but later insisted he couldn’t have another, even though the same sandwiches were handed out to other passengers with plenty to spare. Further, when I requested tea during a water service, I received a sharp “absolutely not.” Moments later, we saw another passenger receiving Baileys from another steward. This led to a tense exchange where the stewardess scolded her colleague openly in front of all passengers. Throughout the flight, she showed similar disregard for others, lecturing passengers about minor issues and creating an overall uncomfortable atmosphere. A smile was notably absent the entire flight. While we understand the demands on cabin crew, this level of unprofessionalism was surprising. We hope Swiss Airlines addresses this kind of behavior, as it fell short of basic service standards and made the journey unnecessarily tense.

4 of us traveled roundtrip from Boston to Brindisi, Italy with a stopover in Zurich. The seats are so squished together in economy, we barely fit. I'm on the tall side, had to sit sideways. (I've been on much more comfortable seats in the US for much shorter flights.) When the person in front reclines, I had only about 4" of space in front of my nose. Really? I was so miserable that I had an anxiety attack. On our flight to Zurich, we were so late that we had to be rushed through the airport to make our connection. Yes, we made it .. but our luggage did not for 3 days! Imagine being in Puglia with perfect weather and not being able to swim. And when it finally did arrive, mine was destroyed and my husband's luggage was damaged. We finally were transferred to a luggage company who agreed that our brand new luggage was destroyed and agreed to give us credits .. not cash .. but credits only to buy new luggage from THEM. (We are still waiting for 2 new pieces to arrive.) Then on our return flights, another bag from one in our group did not make it to Boston. It took 5 days for it to arrive at their home in Colorado. Needless to say we will not be flying Swiss again. Must say one positive thing though; the food was good and the stewardesses were very nice. Still not enough to make us fly Swiss Air ever again.

Absolutely horrible airline. The catastrophe started in Toronto when we were over an hour delayed leaving the tarmac. Everyone else was departing with no issues. No explanation why. The flight itself was awful. Hard  seats, no leg room for such a long flight.  We finally arrive in Zurich over an hour late only to discover we have 30 mins to run across the entire airport to catch our flight to Naples (this is the day before our wedding!). We make it on board luckily, only to arrive in Naples and be stranded for 6+ hours because they didn’t send our luggage. I tried contacting them while stranded at the airport in Italy. Zero support. They just kept redirecting me to file a lost baggage claim. My packages on Amazon have better tracking! The airlines charge you so much for your luggage and then they don’t care what happens to them after. After waiting almost 7 hours our three suitcases by the grace of God arrived. Only to find out that my daughter’s stroller was lost. It’s still lost. I submitted a claim over two weeks ago, I haven’t heard from anyone just keep getting automated responses that they are very busy right now. It’s been over a month since they lost her stroller, and I guess I just have to go buy one myself now because I don’t think thy will actually do anything about it. Absolute worst airline.

The worst. Flights were cancelled without any reason provided, I was forced to stand in numerous lines (without resolution of my issues) for more than three hours, online management of my booking was not permitted and I was told that to make any changes to my reservation by phone I would incur a $30 fee. To top this off I booked a fully refundable ticket (for a massive upcharge) and when I requested a refund for a segment of the flight in accordance with their rules I was told that for an $800 ticket I was only eligible for a $40 refund. When I asked to speak to a supervisor I was told there was none. As a pilot, when I see an airline performing in this manner, I immediately question all other aspects of their operation including flight safety and maintenance competence. Do not fly.

I recently flew with Swiss Air on a 4-hour flight, and the experience was extremely disappointing. First of all, they only offered water during the entire flight, which is unacceptable for such a duration. The seats were cramped, with very little legroom, and uncomfortable for a 4-hour journey. There were no USB ports available to charge devices, and to make things worse, there was no in-flight entertainment—no touch screens, no programs, nothing.  I will never choose Swiss Air again and would not recommend it to anyone.

Ticketing system malfunctions, communication with customer hotline difficult to impossible, flights operated by air baltic and overworked and incompetent crews. All in all, sky high prices for abyssmal performance. I don’t see how the label Swiss Air Lines will make it through the next five years.

Tytul_opinii: "not wanting me to get the receipt"
Tresc_opinii: Swiss quite simply has the worst customer service of any company I have ever encountered. To get a simple receipt for my changed flight (so I could get reimbursed at work), the following happened: their website doesn't work (error message) and has not for months at this point; I have spent two hours on the phone total with three different people; each person tells me to talk to someone else; someone told me someone else would email me the receipt and they never did; the last person said I would have to email a different address. It would be hard to invent worse customer service. At this point it is just laughable. Either they have some reason for not wanting me to get the receipt, or this is the most incompetent company of all time.

We flew from PDX to PMO w 2 stops, SFO and Zurich. The shorter flights, operated by different airlines, were both fine. The longest leg of the trip was 11hrs from SFO to ZUR and operated by Swiss. It was the most uncomfortable flight I have ever been on in my life. I travel a lot, both domestically in the US and internationally (annual special trips are usually international). It was basically like sitting in wooden folding chairs. There was 0 padding and the angle forced pressure on your tailbone, resulting in pinched sciatic nerves for all 6 in our party. The smallest person in our group wears a mens US medium and is 5ft 6in tall. He filled his seat entirely and had to put his backpack in the overhead storage to have any legroom in the extra legroom seat. My seat had a bar from the seat in front of us right down the middle of where my legs would go, as the seat legs are not lined up evenly, so I had to put my legs in one of my neighbors areas or pull my knees to my chest not to bother them. If I pulled my knees up to my chest, though, I no longer fit in my seat. I had to keep my arms crossed in front of me to pull my shoulders in, which caused pain in my back and neck. We purchased extra legroom at $92 per person. Absolutely a rip off, but also, we are forced to do this again for the return trip because otherwise we won't be able to walk at all when we get home because the economy seating in the back is absolute hell, built for children. The cabin of the plane was a sauna, leaving us and everyone else on the plane dripping with sweat the entire 11hrs. While the staff were nice enough, every time they brought the beverage and food service carts down the super skinny aisles, they bumped them along the seats the entire way up and down. The food was mediocre, at best. They put fruit in the macaroni and cheese!?! There were 2 options for dinner, my husband got the other option, which looked like chunky baby food (some kind of curry chicken?) and he said it tasted like something from a can that say in a pantry for a few years. "Breakfast" was cheap yogurt and leftover dinner rolls. We were forced to check all of our carry on at SFO by Swiss, along w our preplanned checked bags, which has been checked at PDX. The sizes were confirmed in advance and no larger than anyone else's on the flight, so this seemed extremely arbitrary. They said we would receive it at PMO. They then proceeded to lose all of our carry on luggage. We had no clothes or toiletries and have been forced to spend hundreds of what was meant to be souvenir money on these items because we only had the clothes we traveled in and a few pieces from the overflow preplanned checked bags we brought (for souvenirs). There are no live people to speak with on the matter. They force you to go through an online reporting process that's a total nightmare and refuse to compensate the disruption in any way or even offer an insincere apology, for that matter. They claim the luggage handling isn't really their responsibility... basically it's a "you gambled, buddy, not our fault you lost" attitude, even though they force you to take said gamble. We had to sacrifice an entire day of our vacation driving back to PMO to pick up our luggage when it was eventually found. I will never fly this airline again and crushed I have to fly them home. It will cost a small fortune in healthcare to fix our backs and legs with massage therapy and chiropractic care when we do get home. Nightmare.

The flight was delayed for more than 3 hours, the company bumped 15 passengers due to missing seats after they switched to a plane with fewer seats. After more than 2.5 hours of delay, passengers were given information about the possibility of a small snack, which was a Snickers and an espresso. It could not be exchanged for another drink e.g. water or tea. The staff was very unhelpful and completely without understanding e.g. for mothers with children who were not even allowed to board first. After boarding the plane at 19:50 we waited another 50 minutes on the plane. All other planes left the airport without any problem, so we cannot talk about bad weather conditions. Very poor service, I will definitely not use Swiss Air.

I booked business class flights with SWISS International Air Lines for my family's Christmas vacation. We now decided to extend our vacation by one week, so I wanted to change our return flights accordingly. Luckily the flights I had in mind were offered on the SWISS.com website so I made the changes online. The rebooking was confirmed on the site and I got charged 171.08 euros from my credit card, just as offered on the website. Everything fine so far. Later during the day I noticed that the payment was charged twice from my card. I also never received any rebooking confirmation from SWISS via email. I contacted the company through their live chat on the same day. The result was surprising: I spent 6 hours  in this chat to learn that SWISS denied both the rebooking and the charges on my credit card.  I then decided to file a complaint through their contact form on the website and got an automated reply: I shouldn't be worried about the blocked amount on my credit card it would be released shortly. There was no blocked amount - the payment was done and the money was charged to my card and booked from my bank account. SWISS also didn't even mention the missing rebooking confirmation, as if this never happened. Turns out we won't be able to change our Christmas vacation now as SWISS is unable to execute those changes. This is truly unbelievable! Unauthorized charges from credit cards are called fraud.  Reading the negative comments on this site just underlines my impression.

Our flight on 12 September LX 0176 from Zurich to Singapore was suddenly cancelled while passengers were waiting to board at the gate. We were supposed to start boarding the plane around 2140 pm. Nothing happened until around 2230 and the plane was supposed to take off at 2240. Then the announcement came that the flight was cancelled. No explanation was given. The person in charge then announced that passengers in Business Class go to a transfer desk and all others to get their luggage and look for hotel accommodation on their own. And we were told that immigration would be closing soon and we had to act fast and go reclaim our luggage if we want to leave the Airport. My wife and I are in our 70’s and unfamiliar with Zürich, let alone find a hotel at midnight. Nevertheless we managed to find a hotel some distance from the airport with the help of another stranded passenger. The poor handling of the situation by Swissair leaves much to be desired. The staff was curt and unhelpful and was in a hurry to get rid of us. At the very least, they could have given us a list of hotels to accommodate us. Instead, we had to go around in a taxi looking for hotels after midnight. Our taxi fare amounted to Chf 102 and the hotel charged us Chf266. To add insult to injury, we were rebooked to return to Singapore via Narita, a journey of more than 29 hours. Thank goodness we were able to secure a direct flight on Singapore Airlines the next day, which meant an additional day stay in Zurich. Swissair is part of Staralliance but this standard of customer service is absolutely horrendous. It left me wondering how dis Swiss qualify as a member of Star Alliance given such poor service standards. I would not recommend flying Swiss.

Worst Customer Service.  We had a truly terrible experience with Swiss on our return flight from Cancun to Zurich. Due to multiple cancellations and booking errors, we ended up without a flight home and had to book a last-minute, expensive ticket with Air France, which cost us over CHF 2,345. Swiss' customer service was completely unreachable for more than 24 hours, and even the staff at Cancun airport couldn’t offer any assistance. This kind of service from a supposedly reputable airline is unacceptable. We are highly disappointed and expect a full reimbursement of the additional costs we incurred. Such a situation is simply not tolerable for an airline like Swiss, and we will reconsider flying with them in the future.

They cancelled the flight, and lied to passengers about the reason (they claimed it was bad weather at Gatwick - it was a fine day, and other flights were landing there happily enough) in order to avoid their legal obligation to pay compensation. I disputed it and they admitted they owe compensation (thereby admitting they lied) but months later I have not received a penny, no reimbursement of expenses I am owed in getting to my destination. All I get from customer services is lies and stalling tactics telling me my bank account is not valid when it is.  Avoid this airline at all costs. I would give 0/10 if it allowed me to.

Very bad service and unexpected staff , They sent my luggage to another airport even though while luggage check in I have cross checked with the staff and the lady said that I am going to get my luggage at Switzerland but the airport staff at Switzerland informed me that she has sent it to another country airport.

Lounge Service at ORD for Swiss is terrible, shared with SAS and not enough seating. The boarding process was a total free for all, disaster. The seat was outdated, adjustments not working properly and uncomfortable. The amenity kit is very low quality. The catering was terrible, probably one of the worst airline meals I have ever eaten (beef that was so tough, could not be eaten). The crew kept the cabin temperature way too warm, so many other people in the cabin were hot and obviously uncomfortable. NEVER, NEVER AGAIN waste of money. Funny how Swiss only sent me a request for a flight review on their code-share flight Baltic Air?

Smooth boarding process. Seats on the A330 are very outdated, low priced amenity kit. Small and dated in-flight entertainment system. Selected the fish dish that was complete inedible…really Swiss? I would like to see your catering staff eat what I was served. Sent it back and was not even offered another dish or food option by flight attendants. Asked for water 3 times and never received it. Once I did get a glass of water with 2 ice cubes, never refilled by passing staff. Sat empty for 4+ hours. We will never fly Swiss again, poor quality product, no service, many other options.

We've traveled all around the world on numerous different airlines, but Swiss Air takes the crown for the worst Business Class experience. Check in process at LAX was horrible. The counter personnel were not friendly and it was very obvious they did not care about customer experience what so ever. Very inefficient process in checking in customers. We've never waited this long in a business class line ever. Boarding process was another disaster. The most inefficient boarding we've ever witnessed. Of course it's the same crew that checked us in, so go figure. Plane is delayed 1.5 hours. Food on board was average. Possibly the most uncomfortable business class seats we've been on. Arrive in Zurich and 2 out of our 3 luggage's don't arrive. Around 30 people in the same predicament. We are told to file a baggage delay claim on their website and wait until further notice. Luggage arrives in Zurich 3 days later! We are in St. Moritz and have to pay for a taxi ride back to Zurich which is 3 hours away to the tune of 690 chf. Flight back to LAX. Flight is delayed again, but this time for 3 hours! Same again, extremely inefficient boarding process. Never seen such a slow boarding process. Flight crew on board this flight is the worst I have ever seen. Not attentive and too busy socializing with each other. I go to use the restroom and come back to see an extra blanket in front of my seat on the floor. I ask my wife and she says there was someone's blanket in the aisle and the flight attendant came through and just moved it with her feet to in front of my seat. For starters how can a flight attendant kick someone's blanket instead of picking it up? I push the blanket back into the aisle to see how they would address it. Two flight attendants pass by to go socialize with a passenger behind me and just walk over the blanket in the aisle! Wow! They do it again on the way back. I stop them and asked why they put someone else's blanket in my seat and why would they just walk past it like this. Their response? Oh ok, and they just picked it up and left. No apologies whatsoever! I stop a second attendant to address the same issue and responds by saying, did you talk to my colleague? I respond, yes I did and she says ok then. Do you want some chocolate? REALLY? The restrooms? They don't bother cleaning them up during the entire flight! Airlines like Korean Air have flight attendants go inside the restrooms after every customer leaves to tidy things up. Swiss Air? They don't bother the entire 12 hour flight. It's absolutely disgusting. It is very obvious that this was not just a case of a bad flight. This is a corporate culture where the customer experience is not at the forefront of how they conduct business. Processes are there for the employees benefit and not the customer. Needless to say, we will never fly on Swiss Air or it's corporate affiliates like Austria Air or Lufthansa. When we go back to Switzerland (and we will because it's such a beautiful country), we will go back to flying Air France through Paris like our previous visits. The direct flight through Swiss Air is just not worth the torture. Stay away from this airline if you can and save yourself a lot of grief.

It was what it was. Flight under LX-number operated by A220 of Air Baltic (crew and aircraft). Cabin clean and rather new. There is absolutely no free service in form of coffee or tea on morning flights. It's a shame that for a couple of 100 Swiss Francs there is no coffee offered. Otherwise flight more or less on time and about 70% full.

Flight got cancelled, can happen. Technical issue. Rerouting happened quite ok. Delay was 4,5 hours. Now Swiss customer service is the first airline i’ve ever flown trying to lie their way around EC No 261/2004 regulations. Very unprofessional and behaving like a low cost. They get 3 stars cause I was lucky my re-routing was handled quite well. Seat was quite small, not very clean. Service was a bottle of water. Nothing special.

I have experienced this unfriendly airline so far, though I've been flying with different airlines for the past 20 years. Your actual nightmare starts if they cancel your booking for different reasons and then you have to deal with them. Worse airline and I advised my friends, colleagues, and relatives to avoid this airline and use it if they have no choice.
Worst experience ever! Put on waiting list and no reply from customer service. First it was a chatbot, then no one human ever came to the chat! Really bad - avoid at all cost!

All 4 flights- Greece and back to Spain were delayed. On my way back I could not check in to my 2nd leg flight - Zurich to Malaga. I tried and tried, then decided to go and find help as phone lines were off (I started around midnight before my sleep as flight was 15:50), I tried reaching out to live chat agent, who after back and fourth till circa 2am told me and I wish I had a screenshot , go to Corfu airport 3-4 hours prior and they will print it there.  Ok, will have to lose half day and after breakfast linger around hotel and go directly to the airport for 12 to get the ticket due to their fault. I gave my last try and called their customer services as I found the solution absurd, again phone centre staff after 30 min could not provide answer nor ticket and again said go to Corfu airport and manually get checked by Swiss. I arrived at the airport to be told it can only be done at the counter and that it does not open till 2 hours prior the flight - misinformed and lost holiday time. I waited two hours, killed time and finally check in started. Waited in the queue finally get to the counter. Business Counter, lady serving business passengers says she needs my passport and that her supervisor will need to fix it , it will take couple minutes. OK i give my passport, she did not come or took me somewhere, she just kept me and continued with other passengers. I kept standing and waiting for 20min.  After another 5min, I said I am done, get her here  and still no ticket nor passport not even sorry. Supervisor comes and says nobody is picking up the phone you will have to do it Zurich. I lost sleep, half a day of my holiday , came early just to get that?  Rude and unhelpful. So went to the Edelweiss Corfu to Zurich flight, departing in 1 hour at that point. I come thru security and it is gate 6B, shut from public, so everyone business and economy sitting next to the door as airport is packed. The room shut but empty. At that point I was messaging my friend that I was supposed to meet in Zurich during my 4.5 hour layover. Land in Zurich , miss my meeting with a friend who came from Basel to Zurich to show me her newborn, spend 5hr due to delay and fly to Malaga.

Swiss, as well as the group to which it belongs, is deteriorating more and more, especially in the disrespectful way they treat their customers before the flight, even when we travel in business class. In this case, it is a flight for January 2025 with Austrian Airlines but booked through Swiss, so I have to deal with Swiss. I receive a terse message from Swiss informing me that on the return from Thailand with a stopover in Vienna, the last flight from Vienna to Geneva is canceled. I would therefore have to spend the whole night at Vienna airport and take the flight the next morning. On their website, we have the choice to either accept or get a refund, with no other alternatives. (I should remind you that the closer we get to departure, the higher the fares; getting a refund means paying more with another airline than if we had booked on the date of our booking with Swiss). They do not even offer to provide us with a hotel night. I spend two hours with their online chat. I manage to get them to book the return flight on a Swiss flight, passing through Zurich. I see that the flight appears on my account in the app. I am happy and thank them. Four days later, I find that the flight from Bangkok to Zurich has disappeared, and there is the flight forcing me to spend the night in Vienna. I understand that the chat agent did not have the right to transfer me from Austrian to Swiss, even though the ticket had already been paid by Swiss. I write through their form, specifying that the flight via Zurich had been booked during the chat, and that they removed it without even bothering to inform me. They reply by saying that they can do nothing and that I must call a premium rate number to discuss it (an 0848 number). I requested a refund and look for a flight with another airline.

Tytul_opinii: "switched me to the back of the plane"
Tresc_opinii: Paid for seats on my flight and the day before my flight I got a notice that they had switched me to the back of the plane. When I arrived at Naples airport and asked why my seat had been switched since I paid for it, I was told that I didn’t I pulled up my receipt and was told I was lying. That’s just unacceptable. Customer service in any industry, but especially the airline industry. I still have no idea why my seat was changed after I paid for a particular seat

One flight from Zurich to Brussels, which hardly takes one hour, cancelled twice and replaced by a flights the day after. You are reading this right, instead of bringing us on Saturday back home, they arranged to bring us back on Monday. Two overnight stays (one in Zurich, one in Munich), for which absolutely no help was provided, you are completely on your own. And when requesting refund for the made expenses, it is refused with as argument that the flights were delayed because of bad weather conditions and thus not their fault, which is an absolute lie. Even the legally mandatory compensation according to EU law for delayed flights is refused. This company is not only disrespectful for the passengers (deliberately not using the word client, as they don't treat you as a customer), but also for the law.

Swiss is the new German railway company. Constant delays or cancellations with lame excuses of heavy traffic, technical issues, online glitches etc. Of my last 20 flights with them, maybe 1 landed on time. This airline is starting to unravel badly. If you book and pay for a seat reservation in order for people to sit together, you get moved and split apart. They get away with everything with their now standard lame greeting of: „We apologize for the delay but hope that you enjoyed your flight with us“.

The flight from Sofia was very delayed. We had less then 20 min for connecting. An airport guy with signs Chicago, LA, and Washington was waiting us at the gate, got us into a VIP van and drove us thru the security and to the other terminal and all 3 gates. We did catch our flights and got home on time. He told is midway that the luggage was transferred as well. Exceptional, surprising, and unbelievable. We are so grateful! Thank you Swiss Air and Zurich Airport!

My connection flight was missed due to my previous flight had not enough fuel lo land at Zurich airport and we have to land in Basel. On arrival in Zurich in 9am they provide me a ticket to London to next day with connection. I went to connection desk, was waiting in queue for 3,5 hour. A men who worked at desk told me he can give me this day flight with connection. I told where is 2 direct flights ahead. He checked and told yes where is one sit , I asked him so why did you trying to give me with connection one ? He could not explain and after 20 seconds told this ticket gone. But it was showing me tickets for next direct flight With Swiss. He told this tickets not for free. How comes because of this airline I missed a flight and they can not provide me another ticket.

After 3 decades flying all over 60 countries around the world this is the first time I had to sleep in a bench BOTH legs at the airport after Swiss Air left us to our own devices following cancellations. Yes, that is right. I slept in a bench in AND out of my trip to and from Bangkok. Both times in Zúrich. I took a picture of the first bench in case you are curious: This is by far the worst experience flying in my entire career and will make sure never to fly Swiss or to use this airport: They have no respect for their customers and leave them with NO options after cancellation of their flights.

I paid extra for an aisle seat towards the front of the plane and these people changed my seat all the way to the back despite my paying extra. The same thing happened to my friend on the same flight.

Naples to Zurich on June 27th. I would like to congratulate the team on this flight who went out of their way to help a young lady travelling with a new born alone. I mentioned to one member of the staff (Toms) that it would be very comfortable for her to sit in one of the empty business class seats. They agreed and helped her to a new seat with space for her baby and then proceeded without hesitation to serve her food and drinks and great service. This is what good service and the use of discretion is all about. Well done Swissair.

Tytul_opinii: "upgrade was only for the second leg"
Tresc_opinii: During my online check-in, I selected an upgrade for a two leg flight. I got the new boarding pass immediately, only to see that the upgrade was only for the second leg of the flight which was 1 hour - as opposed to the whole travel (the first leg was 8 hrs). I am thinking why even bother offering an upgrade for the 1hr portion and why was it almost invisible to see that this upgrade was only for a tenth of the journey? I called customer service right away - I ended up talking to three different people that gave me the run around, including one hanging up on me. I decided to wait till I got to the airport, the next day, to get a proper response. The next day on check-in, I talk to the manager who makes a call and assures me that the refund would happen in 8-10 business days, my flight was May 17. He tells me what to say on boarding the second leg of the flight etc, assuring me things are on the system. June 10 I decide to call in again to follow-up on the refund as it still hadn't gone through. This time the CSR tells me right away that the request to process it just went to the refund department that day and I need to wait 8-10 business days. Despite it being well over the said wait time, I decide it's OK, I'll wait. Two weeks later, I find myself calling their CS again - only to be told this time that there is no refund on my file and they cannot help me. There is no other number to call - only a form online, which I already filled. I noticed everytime I called in to the CS, all their reps consistently had the following, an attitude, and wouldn't let you finish your sentence. Very unprofessional for a company like SWISS. At this point I am frustrated because how can so many different SWISS airline employees give me different stories. So I take this query to social media. Now I am told that there is no indication of what I speak and they will open an investigation and will get in touch with me. There's no complaint code, time frame, contact or number to follow-up. So just like the last two times, I am a sitting duck and will have to likely start this process ALL over again. It is appalling how backward their service is - including their online marketing which has brought me to this stage. How can you dupe customers into spending money, then provide customer service that just placates you on a false narrative?  I was on the 1 hour flight looking at the so called upgrade - it was the first row of seats and had the tiniest curtain that just covered the head area, and they got water between the time they boarded and got off. Highway robbery.  Not worth the money and the experience they offer ain't worth the effort.

The flights back home from our holiday got cancelled and with no alternative to come back home that day. We had to book a different airline. They said the flight can't be reimbursed until 7 days later. We are 2 months later and I have tried every week to contact them via phone and website with no luck. They are saying that the ticked is expired and my 1000 euro is lost. This is the most disappointing company I have ever dealt with. they do not care for helping the customer. they are sending you to the online form and nobody gets back to you ever. Never using again Swiss airlines. They stole our money.

1 month prior to flight date my flight was cancelled by the airline. I asked for rebooking with Turkish Airlines but Swiss disagreed. Thus I had to book with another airline and pay the ticket by myself (of course more expensive, since "last minute"). I asked for refund of my original ticket price (paid in July 2023) on March 16, 2024. Today, June 18, 2024 haven´t got nothing. In May Swiss told me they received my application for refund on March 16, and they´re gonna refund within 7-14 days. Yesterday I asked again about the refund. They told me they haven´t received an application for a refund yet.

I am writing to express my extreme dissatisfaction with my recent experience on a Swiss flight. A delay of the first leg caused me to miss my connection, resulting in my arrival at my final destination 5 hours later than planned. I applied for EU/261 compensation due to the delay as the captain had informed us that the delay was caused by a technical issue requiring the assistance of a technician. However, my compensation request was denied, with the explanation that the delay was due to "air traffic management for air traffic control." This contradictory information suggests that the airline is misrepresenting the cause of the delay to avoid paying compensation.  It is regrettable that an airline of Swiss's stature has failed to uphold its responsibilities, misled its customers, and doesn’t respect international aviation laws. I am extremely disappointed with the service and conduct of Swiss.

Early morning LX flight operated by airBaltic, which on behalf of LX is doing a decent job. Good crew, modern aircraft, clean cabins. This morning the lounge was not crowded, serving a very good breakfast with omelettes or other style eggs, fresh and warm rolls, croissant, cheese, ham, marmalade, muesli, yoghurt, fruits and the way all was presented, it looked really tasty and inviting. Good job done. Upstairs in the quiet zone, even the air conditioning was turned on and the zone was just about nicely cooled down. Flight was on time. Seat 1F gives a good leg room. Also breakfast on the flight was good with warm rolls, croissants, Bircher muesli.

Highly disappointed. Very old aircraft, they'll be retiring it by next year. Highly uncomfortable seats. The amenity kit doesn't even had all the basic items. When some airlines give free WiFi (WhatsApp, FB Messenger ..etc) to all classes, this airline charges Business class for Wifi.

The flight was delayed. Boarding chaotic, aircraft cabin clean. On ground, they had to start the engines twice until being ready to fly, I felt unsafe on this SWISS flight. During the flight, the seat belt signs were always turned on even though the flight was very smooth, did the cabin crew also feel not safe? Service was very inefficient, serving water and food options on two walks throughout the cabin. Whenever possible, I try to avoid this airline. There ist even no WiFi available. What a shame for Switzerland.

We were very disappointed with the service on Swiss. On our way to Johannesburg the service was good but on the way back to Zürich we found the cabin personnel to be very aloof. The one Steward dropped food on the floor and casually put it back on the tray to serve it again. Another Stewardess was in the middle of serving food but decided to strike up a long conversation with 2 Stewardesses who were seated in front of us (also passengers). We found this to be very rude and had to wait a long time for our food to be served. This is not the first time we have had a bad experience with the airline - in 2018 flew to Johannesburg and found the Stewardesses were ungroomed and not very friendly. It's a shame that Swiss do not compare well to other airlines eg. British Airways or South African airways.

Tytul_opinii: Swiss Intl Air Lines customer review
Tresc_opinii: Our first travel with Swiss Airways and what a lovely experience it was. The gentleman at the check in counter helped us with seats with extra leg room. One of the crew members was a sweet young man, quite friendly and efficient unfortunately couldn't get his name. The lunch and evening snacks served were good. Overall had quite a comfortable journey.

A220-100 with a nice leg room on seat 1F enabling a comfortable flight. Flight was 45min delayed. Crew was friendly and attentive. Food in Business Class tasty but in quantity too small for a Business Class flight. Lounge in BUD was ok, but no warm food available anymore at 1930h. Boarding was smooth, Security Check as well.

Air Baltic A223 operating on behalf of Swiss. Front Seat in Business is best seat in the aircraft and enables relaxed flying. All Business Seats should have this seat pitch. Crew was friendly and very attentive. Swiss Chocolate a highlight and for once even more food, than expected, however still a bit under expectations for Business Class. Check-in and ground staff acted efficiently and professional. Flight was calm and on time. Thank you to BT LX for a relaxed flight.

Having paid £2600 for premium economy plus an additional £106.40 for exit row seats on the Zurich to Singapore leg I found myself in a broken seat. The cabin crew tried the seat and they could not recline it so I spent the 12 hour flight having to sit in the take off position for the whole journey. On my arrival in Australia I complained to Swiss Air who responded with a £100 voucher. I said this wasn't acceptable. They then offered me back the £53.20 additional seat charge. I referred the case to SOP and got this back The airline has now informed us of the following: „The passenger was booked on LX176 29.03.2024 in Premium Economy and booked the seat 20A. The passenger was actually seated on 20A. The passenger reported a malfunction of the seat. We sent a GBP 100 voucher to the passenger in our previous case and oﬀered to refund the seat charges of GBP 53.20. As the passenger was not downgraded, and the described situation is not in the scope of EC261/2004, we do not agree to participate in the conciliation procedure.“  Not impressed and will not fly Swiss again. Premium economy seat on Swiss Air is not worth the extra.
Trasa: London City to Singapore via Zurich

Tresc_opinii: Horrible customer service. Our flight was diverted from Dubai to Muscat and my rebooking was for 3 days later. I had to be in Dubai urgently and took a taxi by road. The baggage handling and customer service is completely useless. I was given the go around multiple times. The customer care line is so cold and were of no help whatsoever. Terrible airline and terrible service. I understand that there are circumstances that are beyond the airline’s control but it’s how you help passengers in those times that really defines an airline. I will never recommend this airline or fly with them ever again.

Airbus 220-300 is a pleasant aircraft to fly. Seat pitch in seat 1A is good. Flight on time. Flight Attendant serving Business Class passengers was terrific. The Swiss Chocolate is always a highlight. However the quantity of food served in Business Class is inacceptable. The re dwine was acceptable The food is the big disappointment if flying Swiss in Business Class on European flights.
On both my flights to Manchester was delayed and both the flights my luggage was delayed. Worst that my luggage was badly damaged with one item missing. I had to wait 2-3 days for my luggage.

My flight from Krakow to Zurich was delayed. I asked the gate staff what will be the impact of the delay on my connection. The Staff told me: "The company should wait for your transfer". When entering the plane from Krakow to Zurich, I notified the crew about my connection and asked them to update me. I received no update from the crew. 20 minutes before arrival, the screens had some messages about the transfer. My connection was written as being rebooked. I asked the plane staff the meaning of the message. They told me that I should try to make the connection. After lending in Zurich, I ran across the terminal to catch the Zurich Boston. When I arrived at the gate: the plane was still there, the ramp was still connected to the plane, and the gate doors were still open but the staff refused my access to the plane because "I was rebooked to another plane". The gate staff had no explanation and told me to go to the assistance desk. -At the assistance desk, the agent told me that:  the rebooking was done by a team somewhere because this is usually the best solution for the customers but not for my specific case.  They do that to find an available seat as early as possible and avoid multi-day issues. There was no Zurich Boston the day after so they rebooked me on Lufthansa via Frankfurt. The agent had no empathy and took no ownership of the issue, she proposed no commercial gesture for making me lose a day. The agent gave me a voucher for a hotel night and a meal with no explanation on how to find the hotel -The hotel was good. I was able to arrive to Boston the day after via Lufthansa, the flight from Frankfurt to Boston had a lot of empty seats. I submitted a complaint form to Swiss. The initial answer was that the delay was due to air traffic control restrictions out of their control and they would not provide any financial compensation. I asked for evidence to support their statement of delay due to air traffic control,why Swiss rebooked me without my approval, why the rebooking option was not presented to me when I presented myself to the gate staff at Krakow,  why the staff of the Krakow-Zurich was not able to give me clear direction. The only answer was "delayed due to safety reasons". What don't accept: - Staff not able to give good answer or to propose rebooking when the delay was known in Krakow - Swiss rebooking without my approval while I'm flying (since my Frankfurt - Boston had a lot of empty seats I don't think there was any urgency to rebook me) - Swiss agent lying to me when telling me there was no Zurich Boston the day after. Paying a very expensive ticket for a specific flight and being rebooked on another flight which was certainly a lot cheaper considering all the empty seats without any compensation.

Swiss used to be my favourite airline but the last couple of years I was under the impression their quality was going down rapidly (despite ticket prices just increased constantly). On European flights I witnessed they were serving a kind of cheap sparkling wine (Baccarat) instead of champagne (if already offered-on a few short flights they just served coffee or tea in business class). The nice and tasteful light meals they used to serve were substituted by sandwiches they previously used to serve in economy! For my recent Bangkok to Brussels flight Swiss was one of the only options left so I gave them one more try. I was pleasantly surprised service improved significantly finally. The crew were nice and friendly while previously Swiss crews often left a cold and disinterested impression. For me, a crew makes or breaks the flight experience. I was seated in a throne seat that offered a lot of space and seating comfort. Meals were really good and they were able to offer me my preferred selections which wasn’t the case on previous flights with them. It was hard for me to choose the best pairing wines but they offered me to do wine tastings of all whites and reds available so I could select my preferred ones (no need to say I really appreciated this). Only downside perhaps was the flight map wasn’t working on this flight so it was guessing how much time we still had left in the air. Having Senator status I had access to the Swiss Alpine lounge at Zürich airport before boarding my connecting flight to Brussels; this lounge is really very nice and never seems to get crowed. It has great views of the airport and the runways. Flight to Brussels was also very good with an on-time departure and arrival with an extremely friendly and professional flight attendant offering a super and impeccable service as it should be. For my next flight I certainly will consider flying Swiss again.
2 hours delay due to technical problem with the aircraft. It was well past dinner time, people were hungry but we were not offered anything to eat without paying.

Not a good experience in terms of cabin crew, food, small seats and luggage delay. Unfriendly sour faces of the crew. It's 3 days and I am still waiting for my Bag. Contacting Swiss Air is a nightmare. They send you on a wild goose chase and they refer you to Global solutions which is the worse people to deal with. The inconvenience is extremely disappointing.

I had to endure a 12hr trip in the most uncomfortable seat. I am by no means tall and I was lucky enough not to have a neighbour. Despite this I got no sleep kit (mask, socks, toothbrush), the toilet was not been cleaned by the staff, the cabin personnel was very lukewarm and were addressing everyone on an intercontinental flight in Swiss German. In flight entertainment was also very limited

Tytul_opinii: “Swiss refused to do the honorable thing”
Tresc_opinii: Swiss Air cancelled our flight 24 hours before we were due to fly to Europe on 24th February 2024. As we had paid transfers and accommodation, the alternative flight they offered would not suffice. The lady in their call center said we can organize alternative flights and be compensated on return. We have submitted all relevant information and Swiss Air have refused to do the honorable thing and compensate us accordingly! Dealing with their call center in South Africa is frustrating and the various reasons why they won't reimburse us, sent from Switzerland, is dishonest and scandalous. I urge all of South Africa to never use Swiss Air as they truly are Star Alliance thieves.

This review covers the flight from Zurich to Bangkok. Was lucky enough to get a so-called throne seat for both my partner and me. As always good product on SWISS 777 and food and seat etc. were ok, except for the entertainment options. However, staff were more than disappointing: while the service on the other aisle was fast, efficient and nice, the staff member on our side was slow, unfriendly, disinterested and, to make matters worse, more or less exclusively occupied with private conversations with other fellow travellers who also belonged to SWISS. No greeting, no farewell - as a status customer and a fully paid business class ticket, I have little understanding for this kind of behaviour. The aircraft was clean, the flight on time - as you would expect from SWISS. However, the travel experience on an 11-hour Business Call flight was clearly below all expectations.

I cannot praise Swiss enough The journey from Zurich to Johannesburg was cancelled. They put on an extra plane the following morning I was in a hotel within an hour in Zurich the team picked us from.the hotel The same happened in Joburg on arrival as we flew the following morning The customer services team paid my expenses and gave me a little compensation with no fuss. This was truly excellent from the whole team. Turning to the journey itself The first class lounge in Zurich is fabulous,great food, and winesshowers and the day room beds are so incredibly comfortable great for sleep,only problem is you have to leave it behind! The transfer was accompanied and the team helped with my hand luggage. On the flight the staff were friendly,the food was good if not spectacular.The seat was comfortable and allowed for good rest We were met on every stage of the journey and helped with passport control and security. It was a memorable journey on all legs
Trasa: Manchester to Cape Town via Zurich

Tresc_opinii: Worst flight ever, served allergens despite requesting no beans I was given beans and foreign objects in food. Broken seat which was tiny and dirty as well. Cabin crew took photos of items in food and didn’t want me to, so I did. No response from Swiss. Won’t use SWISS again. Business class has been made into economy class yet charge 15k one way. Disgusting.

Dublin to Zurich return. Both flights delayed by about 30 minutes, but these were explained & apologies given Water and a chocolate distributed, and a fairly expensive trolley service. Flight attendants efficient and polite. The captain in attendance when passengers are leaving the aircraft is a nice touch. Seats and legroom adequate. Free carriage of ski equipment is an added bonus.

I had originally heard good things about Swiss Air from a friend, but after flying with them twice (connecting flights), I disagree. I flew Swiss Air going from Oslo to Los Angeles. The day we flew out of the Oslo airport it shut down due to a snowstorm so our flight was delayed 8 hours, which the airline had no control over. However, once we were able to board again, the only consolidation prize we got was free coffee/tea, but we still had to pay for all other snacks and services… I’m pretty sure the coffee/tea was already free to start with. Like really, that’s the best you can do? Anyways, once we got to Zurich, we had to rebook a connecting flight back home to LA due to the delay. The flight from Zurich to LA was roughly 12 hours and was probably the worst flight of my life. At the boarding gate, they made us get special stamps on our boarding passes and if we didn’t have them then we couldn’t board. There was a bunch of confusion as to where to get the stamps and long lines started forming around the boarding area. It delayed our flight leaving by roughly 30 minutes. Once my family and I finally got up to board, they grabbed our bags and told us we had to check them. We were row 30 (only 3 rows behind business class) so it’s not like we were the last to board or like we were in the very back of the plane. After they took our bags I pleaded to keep them, and if we couldn’t find room for them overhead then we’d bring them back and they could be checked. I stressed how this would cause a big inconvenience to us because once we landed we still had a 2 hour drive home and baggage claim in LA can take an hour or more since it’s a busy airport. They didn’t seem to care and continued to tell us it was a full flight and they wouldn’t fit. The thing that really annoyed me was that they let people boarding after us walk on with their luggage AND once the boarding process was complete there were 4 completely empty overhead bins by our seats. I was livid. Once we got in the aircraft it was like a swamp, it was uncomfortably warm, humid, and smelled like sweat and feet. The Boeing 777-300 plane we were on didn’t have any overhead fans. I told the flight attendant I was feeling warm (I have a condition where my body overheats very easily) and she told me that air only circulates when the plane is in motion so I had to sit uncomfortably for 30-45 minutes before they turned on the air. Even after it was turned on during the flight, it felt very inconsistent, and would switch between hot and cold throughout the whole flight. I would also like to add that their economy seats are much smaller than an average plane. I fly internationally roughly 5 times a year, and I’ve taken multiple airlines throughout my life and almost always fly economy. I could barely eat the meal they provided us because my elbows would be touching the people next to me when cutting up my food (I was in the middle seat). It was incredibly frustrating, I felt like I was boxed in. Their trash service was also inconsistent, and after every meal service, our trash was was left on our table for roughly 45 minutes to an hour. I counted and trash service only came by four times on a 12 hour flight. There were two times when I had to get up and throw away my own trash, because I wanted to use my tray table but couldn’t. At the end of the flight, I was so frustrated that I literally started crying an hour before we landed. It was the most uncomfortable flight I’ve ever taken.
Trasa: Oslo to Los Angeles via Zürich

Tresc_opinii: Only ticket price is higher from a low cost company. Anything else looks the same. From Cancun to Zurich poor quality of food and choices from Zurich to Athens if you need water you have to pay extra.

One of the worst experiences! Direct flight departure scheduled at 12:05. Cancelled! Offered a new booking 7 hours later with change in Munich for a scheduled new arrival time around 22! Which not even is about 9 hours later as planned but also force you to make a stop in Germany instead of a direct flight. Rules of the airline are very clear that if a flight for whatever reason a flight is cancelled, they have to offer you the Same alternative. At the counter they tell you it’s not possible, they are all booked! Well, let’s raise the tone and remind them about their obligations towards their clients. I did it started a heavy discussion and, suddenly 2 places are available for a departure at 17! This is completely unacceptable and shows the way how they try to treat people. Ok! I will Not let it sit quiet like that. That’s why I’m first writing that review here, and will escalate it tomorrow, on Monday. Worst is they tried to send us via Munich, when they know that they have big strikes going on in Germany. Really! What a poor behavior, a poor customer service, a non existing hot line, a stupid chat bot and of course, no one available for direct contact. Definitely not the best way to keep customers. It was the first time, I could try to accept or understand it. But sadly all my latest flights were with problems. Since Lufthansa bought Swiss, it’s just becoming a garbage airline just oriented on profit with a complete lack of customer service or support. So this flight was definitely my last attempt to support and fly with a home company. There are many others to choose from.
Cabin crew very very nice, friendly and relaxed. Seat comfort was excellent. Unfortunately there was no meal in the economy class, but there was a bottle of water and chocolate.

Seat 3A on the A220-300 has a surprisingly good leg room. Flight was good and on time. Flight Attendant friendly, skilled and at top level. Only negative point is the quantity of the food they serve. ZRH-BUD they should serve a hot meal or at least more food. But the quality of food is very good. The wines I did not try but usually Swiss is not known for higher quality wines in Business Class.

We have flown the LAX-ZRH-LAX many times. This was our first try at Business Class at SWISS. Our experience in economy had been average and unfortunately the business class did not impress either! Seats are narrow and especially the couple's seat by the window has next to no working/storage area! Unless you spend the extra $300/seat for the "Throne" seats I think the remaining seats are just considerably below any major airline we have flown. The shoulder seat belt cuts right at your neck as even the FA admitted the issue! The "noise cancelling" headphones are JUST headphones it offered Zero noise cancelling quality. Food selection was average. As any major airline's business class the wine offering was adequate. The 2-2-1 and 2-1-2 seating arrangement is the most compacted and congested BC seating format we have experienced compared to other BC's we have flown (KLM, AF, BA , UA, AA and ITA). I will say however that SWISS is still the best choice to fly between US and Switzerland. Sharing some feedback with the FA's, they agreed that they can not wait for the A350's to replace these 777's as many people complain about the seats and other issues.
The purser, Rui, and his crew on LX797 were fantastic. It’s rather full flight and relatively short trip (just a bit more than a hour flight) but they made everyone feeling attended and cared for.

Swiss is a total disaster. 5 mn before landing in London, the plane turns back to Geneva due to a technical failure. Upon disembarking, no one is present to guide the passengers towards alternative solutions. They simply dropped all the passengers in the C departure lounge. It turns out they booked us on - not even - the next flight to London, not even the same destination (City) but Heathrow, 5 and a half hours after the original departure time. It turns out there were several possibilities beforehand, with Swiss or other companies (requiring that we exit the lounge, God knows how). ABSOLUTELY NO INFORMATION ABOUT OUR RIGHTS (compensation, meal, go for another company…). Icing on the calendar: the newly booked flight is delayed by 40 minutes. This an utter disgrace.

Be careful if you have an intercontinental flight with Swiss Air with a transfer in Zurich. I had a very bad experience with that. You book a flight online with a suitcase of 23 kg and hand luggage of 10 kg. Nothing special. It is also stated in your confirmation and on your ticket. Only if you change planes in Zurich does this 10 kg of hand luggage suddenly change to 8 kg. You are not allowed to take more with you. My hand luggage was refused. The ground staff was curt and very unfriendly. Customer service also does not respond to this remarkable action. Unprofessional! So you are expected to give away 2 kg of allowance when you arrive in Europe. Once but never again with Swiss Air.
Trasa: São Paulo to Amsterdam via Zurich

Tresc_opinii: My wife and I regularly fly to Switzerland by SWISS. However, in February 2023 at Frankfurt, when the power was accidentally cut to Lufthansa systems, our problems seemed to start. The day it happened we were flying from LHR to GVA. When we tried to make the return journey, our booking had disappeared from the system. We had to pay for new seats to get home. My wife suffers from mild claustrophobia, so I always book and pay for specific seats near the front. Since then almost every booking has been changed, without notice, at least three or four times. Every time when I query, the same reason is given; “a plane change”. The problem with this is the type of plane does not change; the seat plan / format does not change, therefore our seats should not change? The airline has a seating policy, which basically says you can play for your seat but we will decide where you eventually sit. For example, on one flight I booked row 7; the system moved us to row 9 to 11 to 19. Same seat plan, no explanation, no apology. Twelve months later, the call centre staff are admitting they don’t know why the system is doing this and they have no control over it. Still no explanation and no apology.

The family at AtlasAdventured highly recommends this airline! Needing to get from Valencia, Spain to Kotor, Montenegro as a family of three with a toddler, we scoured the internet for flights that were within our budget, and would get us there on a schedule that was beneficial to us. After much research, we ended up booking tickets through Swiss Air. Booking the flight was quick and easy. Our first flight was from Valencia to Zurich, Switzerland on Swiss Air flight LX2143. After being able to spend a day in Zurich, we caught our next flight, on their sister airline, Edelweiss Air flight LX8414 from Zurich to Tivat, Montenegro. Both airlines were great, but Edelweiss Air was a much better experience, especially when traveling with children. Check in was smooth, as was boarding the plane. Everyone we encountered from the people at check in, to the crew on board, were all very friendly and welcoming. Great customer service! A little bit after take off they gave our daughter a cute drawstring backpack filled with goodies! An activity book, colored pencils, and a game! It was very unexpected and so thoughtful. It was a short flight but we were still offered drinks and given these delicious chocolate chip buns, and a piece of Swiss chocolate. We have flown on a lot of planes, and this was one of the best experiences we’ve had as a family. We will definitely be flying Edelweiss Air again!

New aircraft in both trips. A321 NEO and A220 which both are really good and comfortable. Everything was on time, cabin crew are really professional and polite. The only big disappointment is that meal service from Cairo to Zurich (4 hours) nothing was served. Not even a snack which I believe a huge mistake and they are not even aligned with the Lufthansa group -I flew Austrian earlier and they do provide meal service.

The extremely rude Swiss airline guy working at the Zurich ticket office 7 Jan morning said I must pay both for cabin luggage and an additional 90CHF ski bag fee to carry a single checked ski bag. This was incorrect. When trying to refund the unnecessary cabin bag fee (only the ski fee should apply) Swiss airline support hung up multiple times apparently they’re having system problems. Ground stuff were also disorganised, but cabin crew were friendly. Overall terrible airline to be avoided.

After a stay in the luxurious First Class lounges at Zurich Airport - it was far too early to try one of the 3 Champagnes - to the embarkation what was on time. The plane was an older 330, but the First class part was well appointed. Very personal welcome both by the FA, purser; also the captain came to see and greet the passengers in First. On this flight Swiss did change the usual Champagne by Cuvée Louise of the house Pommery, a good surprise. The food was extremely good and the service outstanding during the entire long flight to Miami. A pijama by a high level Swiss brand and a Bally amenity bag were also pleasant. One minor fact : there is only one extrely narrow restroom in the First on an A330 and therefore I cannot give a 10. In Miami assistance by a very friendly lady for collecting the luggage, When waiting for the luggage the captain - also waiting - inquired if everything was ok during our flight.

Our recent experience with Swiss was great! We flew from Singapore to Ljubljana via Zurich and return. Singapore Airlines conveyed us from Sydney to Singapore and return. We purchased our our seats in January for our October/November travel. Luggage was at destinations, flights on time, meals were more than adequate, crew were friendly and helpful, and planes clean and quite new. There were a couple of times when flight times were changed slightly and information from Swiss was excellent as well as pre flight details a couple of weeks before leaving. The 777 economy seating looked cramped but because we booked early we were able to chose 2 seat rows up the back of the plane. After reading negative comments throughout the year we were worried we made the wrong choice, however our flights and everything associated with them were hassle free and without any concerns. We also had the added bonus of having around 20 passengers on our Ljubljana to Zurich flight. It was hard to compare Swiss, the first time we have flown with this airline, with Singapore as both airlines offered very similar service quality which we enjoyed on our flights

Brilliant flight from start to finish. The economy class cabin was only a third full but the flight still operated as usual, so we had even more attention than usual from the cabin crew. Smooth flight which was on time. Definitely my first choice of airline when flying to Switzerland.

Swiss externalises both legs to Helvetic Airways. Extremely deceived, both legs late, but explanation given on first leg and nothing on second leg. Swiss German spoken instead of German, could not understand anything. Staff absolutely not motivated by the job. Poor service.
Trasa: Milan Malpensa to Brussels via Zurich

Tresc_opinii: Paid for emergency exit seats due to my height. They changed my seats without telling me then get onto the flight and they were not the seats I paid for! Tried to claim a refund for them as paid for a service I did not receive and Swiss Air refused. Luckily I can do a credit card charge back. Welcome to Swiss Air fraud.

My recent experience with Swiss for my Lufthansa flights has been far from satisfactory. The primary issue revolved around a triple charge for a flight change, an ordeal that persisted for almost two weeks. Despite diligently following the advice provided and using the company's contact form, my attempts to address the matter were met with a prolonged silence. This lack of response left me with the impression that the experiences and feedback of customers may not be as valued as one would expect. The absence of a proper apology for the inconveniences and troubles I endured further compounded my frustration. Upon reaching the airport for my Lufthansa flights, I discovered that my ticket had supposedly been changed, yet no ticket had been issued. The information and instructions provided by the airline were often confusing and unclear, making the entire experience needlessly distressing. The airline's lackluster customer service, refusal to offer compensation, and the absence of formal apologies intensified my disappointment. In addition, the prolonged holding of my funds without clarity and the incomplete information provided during the resolution process only served to deepen my confusion and frustration.

Virtually full flights both ways, but staff helpful with hand luggage, making for on time departures. Friendly service, and felt relaxed. Just a bottle of water and chocolate offered, but a good solid product. Impressed.
Announced boarding gate a few minutes before boarding. Airlines refused to give information over the phone about gate and were nasty to me. Airline staff was very bizarre and unprofessional.

This airline would be OK if they stopped marketing themselves as a premium airline. The experience is one of a low-cost carrier at a premium price. They assign seats during check-in which you can change at the price of 35 CHF with an Economy Light ticket.  Why can seat backs be lowered in this cramped airplane? No one needs that on a short flight and it only means leg space is even more limited for the passenger behind.

It doesn’t worth to pay extra for Premium Economy. I paid extra on an upgrade bid. Premium Economy is 3 rows in front of Economy, no separate area. Amenities kit is very poor and looks so cheap (made of recycled material). Seats are very uncomfortable, there are wider than economy but they recline very little so you ending sleeping with a back-pain. Seat photo looks great but in reality they are not. Service on the ATH-ZRH flight was a joke, plane was an A320, at least it was not an A220 that they sometimes use on the route. Service on B777 was professional but not friendly. Food was good on china plates. They distribute menu and welcome drink, there were 2 options of meal. Head phone were on an excellent quality. There was great selection of drinks. After dinner, during flight you could go to galley at the rear of plane for some snacks. IFE was good but selection of movies very standard, limited selection of Asian/Indian movies. One hour before landing there was the second service, just before landing they distribute chocolates.

Swiss cancelled our flight (LX2254) 16 Oct 2023. First there was a delayed departure time then it was cancelled. We missed our connecting flight. They put us in a hotel over night and said they would send us notification of new travel itinerary for the and would pay the cost of transfer back to the airport. We never received an email or details of the reimbursement process. We had to contact our travel agent to find out what flight we were to get. Swiss just left us high and dry and have had no follow up communication with us.

Efficient, clean, friendly. We always enjoy flying with Swiss because (unlike Lufthansa), the staff consistently across as warm and friendly. Another nice touch is the bar of chocolate and bottle of water supplied on every flight. Check-in staff member at Hanover processed our bags efficiently, checked that we had the right visa for our ultimate destination but without grilling us. Both our flights were slightly behind in time in departing but made up the time, so that we arrived on schedule.

Tytul_opinii: "I found SWISS to be very disappointing"
Tresc_opinii: A very mixed trip in terms of standards. At Marseille, we went to the business class lounge and an attendant poked their head out of a crack in the entrance door and stated "full". Nothing else, the door was blocked, and he repeated in French "complet". Clearly SWISS do not worry about selling business class features that are not delivered. Onboard service was quick and very curt with the snack tray and drink served, but nothing close to a smile from any of the crew. Zurich transfer was easy and a pleasant SWISS lounge D is close to the boarding gate. As our boarding passes were scanned, staff handed us a slip of paper and stated "seat changed". They then pushed us away and would say nothing else. The second flight was onboard an airBaltic A220. The same snack plus a slice of cheese was served - adequate but it seems they have just 1 meal across every European flight? The airBaltic staff were much better and far more more friendly compared to the grumpy SWISS crew on the previous flight. Overall, for a short haul business class trip I found SWISS to be very disappointing, and not a patch on their standards of 5-10 years ago. No USB / charging sockets onboard, no WiFi service underlines how poor they have become. Aside from obvious cost cutting, SWISS staff service was very poor in the air and on the ground.

A very stressful experience that I am not keen to repeat. Zurich - Frankfurt on SWISS, with an onward connection to Rijeka on Lufthansa. As is nearly always my experience with SWISS, the flight left late, 90 minutes after the scheduled departure time. Due to the delay, many passengers - including myself - missed connections. (This was despite the fact that I had booked flights with a two hour layover in Frankfurt to avoid this kind of situation.) No effort was made to assist arriving passengers who had extremely short connections at the arrival gate. We were left to run to gates or deal with incredibly long customer service lines. After first being told I would have to travel the next day (thanks for the wrong information, customer service!), I did my own research and asked to fly to Rijeka via Munich in the evening. More stress again when the Frankfurt - Munich flight was very late and I had to run to make my connection to Rijeka before the gate closed. I arrived over seven hours late and didn't receive my baggage. I could have driven to Croatia in this time and at least have had my baggage with me. An utterly incompetent airline.

London City - Zürich. SWISS is the most unpunctual airline I know, chronically late. This is a good case in point. The flight took off over two hours late. No assistance was provided, not even a food or beverage voucher required per European regulation 261. An airline to be avoided if one has a choice.

Simply the worst and inflexible airline. Unlike easyjet, it is not possible to rebook a flight to another first name / same surname for an additional fee. This even as my wife could not fly because of health reasons. If you go to their headquarters at Paradeplatz, they come up with the lame excuse this would be international ticket trade, but it is rather financial greed as they are willing to resell the same ticket for almost 800 CHF instead of 200 CHF(economy from Zurich to Madrid).
