Flight and crew terrific. Food in Business Class good but too small portions and not warm. On a 2h flight in Business I expect a full lunch service. Swiss in about 90% of my flights is changing my pre selected seats, which is annoying. Wine in Swiss Business is too cheap. From a self proclaimed Premium carrier like Swiss, I expect a better wine choice.

I will definitely avoid flying with Swiss Air in the future. My recent experience was incredibly frustrating. A significant flight delay caused me to miss my connecting flight, which forced me to spend an unplanned night in Zurich. To make matters worse, when I requested access to my luggage, it was denied, leaving me without my personal essentials. At the airport service counter, I was promised reimbursement for the inconvenience and expenses incurred. However, my optimism was short-lived. Now, after reaching out to customer service, I've received a message stating that I will not be compensated for the toiletries. This lack of accountability and follow-through has left me deeply disappointed with Swiss Air's customer service and their handling of this situation.
Trasa: Hamburg to Cape Town via Zurich

Tresc_opinii: Enough is enough, it is such a shame what Swiss turned into. Once known for its quality, punctuality and reliability, now it is simply a cheap (in quality, not in price) Easyjet. And it just keeps getting worse. Me and my husband as well as our families travel often and it is hard to remember now when was the last time Swiss was not delayed (I wonder how Swiss people feel about such airline representing their country). Today, last flight from London to Zurich, 1 hour delay. What means for evening flights, you get home not just 1 hour but much later, as public transport/taxi connections become limited. There was a man on the flight saying to the crew that he will not be able to get to Luzern as trains there stop running at 23.45. The response from Swiss crew member was that they are not responsible for Swiss railways. Well, this situation would not have happened if Swiss (again!) wasnt late. Now its almost 1 am, we are not yet home (even though we live in Zurich itself) - and tomorrow need to wake up at 5 am for work. These constant delays come on top of cramped (although clean) planes without any entertainment on european flights and outdated on long haul flights, no snacks/food, only small bottle of water and chocolate on the flights, frequent flyer program with constant "technical errors" and quite random bad seats to change which i need to pay 35 chf each for 1h 10 mins flight? Flight attendants and pilots are quite good though. But overall takeover is still killing the "good old Swiss".

I am truly disappointed by the super low standard. The legroom was equal with low-cost carriers. The complimentary in-flight service simply does not exist in SWISS. The crew handed out one piece of super small chocolate. That should not be a standard in a traditional carrier like a SWISS, that in my opinion should be tagged as a super expensive low-cost airlines. Cabin crew were rude. The flight was delayed. As a FTL im Miles&More I am simply avoiding SWISS due to their horrendous cost cutting. Flying with SWISS in no longer a pleasure.

It is not about one flight, it is about the whole lot of flights (more than 40 in one year)… If you want to understand how it is, take any lowcoster airlines and multiply the prices by 10 or 15. That is Swiss. Services of a low-cost at a premium price. They charge you for everything, but have old planes, even the seats are paid only or they will always get you the worst one ever possible. Yes, they have good amount of flight schedules, but you will always feel robbed after the flight… You just have to really work to make Swiss Air THAT BAD… applause to the management

Tytul_opinii: "one of the most cramped economy 777 cabins"
Tresc_opinii: 10 abreast in any 777 economy cabin feels cramped, because it is cramped; narrow seats and aisles and a claustrophobic feel. Swiss have a similar seat pitch to most other 777 operators, but having flown Qatar, Eva Air and Egyptair 777s in the past few months (the latter has the rare, 9 abreast configuration), there is noticeably less legroom (or knee room to be more precise!) in the Swiss 777; pretty awful to experience on long haul. The seat recline seems much greater than on other airlines so if you have a selfish passenger in front of you who reclines fully, the experience becomes utterly miserable and the screen and tray table become effective unusable and trying to get out of your seat is fun and games. I was also glad that I hadn’t upgraded to Premium Economy as there are only a few PE rows tacked onto the front of the economy cabin and the seats and space looked decidedly non-premium compared to other 777 operators offerings. Even business class looked pretty basic, especially the ‘pairs’ of seats on the sides of the cabin (every other row) where it looked as if the window seat occupant would have to climb over their fellow passenger to reach the aisle. This was an 11 hour flight and we were well fed and watered throughout; there is a snack area in the middle section of the economy cabins and this isn’t just about snacks; we were treated to repeatedly stocked good quality sandwiches, amazing chocolate chip cookies, Swiss chocolate, nuts, crisps, drinks and Swiss Ricola sweets. It really was like going back 30 years to the way long haul economy used to be! Two decent meals, ice cream three hours out from Zurich and Swiss chocolate before landing-nice! The crew were superb; very friendly, went out of their way to help & genuinely seemed to be enjoying their jobs; so good to see and made a massive difference to the enjoyment of a long flight in a sardine can-feel cabin. I have never flown Swiss long haul before, so I may have just got lucky with this crew, but if all crews are like this, then Swiss are doing something right, that's for sure. Toilets were kept clean throughout and drinks were always on hand from flight attendants walking up and down the aisles. Boarding was shambolic; for some reason Swiss boarded economy from the front of the cabin first, working backwards by ‘group’. No surprise then that boarding took an age for those of us sat at the back of the cabin, as we waited for those at the front of economy (who boarded first) to sit down and stow bags. Why Swiss board economy from the front is beyond me; makes no sense at all, but just slows down the whole boarding process and it took almost 10 minutes from boarding to get to my seat (47G). Unimpressed to see single use earphones supplied, especially given the amount of sustainability propaganda fed to us on the IFE system (and particularly so on my next short haul flight from Zurich to Heathrow); hardy sustainable Swiss! Were it not for the dreadfully cramped Swiss 777 cabin, I would be actively seeking out Swiss for long haul travel given the great crew/service, but if I can get on an A380 or a 9 abreast 777 I would always opt for that, as these 10 abreast 777 cabins are just too cramped & the Swiss cabin has to be has to be one of the most cramped economy 777 cabins out there, so I would actively avoid it in future.

Tytul_opinii: "incompetence in training or a lack of care"
Tresc_opinii: Due to a passenger count discrepancy between ground staff and cabin crew the LHR-ZRH flight was delayed by 1h 20m, resulting in a missed connection at ZRH. The airline accommodated us on a much later flight with a different airline, arriving 5h 55m later than planned on timetable and 6h 10m in actual. On my return I contacted Customer Services and claimed for EU/261/2004. This seems a pretty clear case of delayed arrival resulting from operational issues. To my surprise I got a reply from the airline telling me I must contact the operating airline for this. As far as I am aware I was seated in an A321neo owned and operated by the airline. When I queried twice their definition of operating airline I first received a bland automatic response, hoping to welcome me back in the near future and second an email informing me the case was closed. Extremely disappointed by their customer services case handling, probably even more so than the delay, as it contains incorrect flight numbers and dates and shows incompetence in training or a lack of care in responding. Unfortunately I am a Gold card holder within the Group's FFP and have many future bookings with the airline. It just demonstrates how confidence in the brand can so easily be eroded by one mishandled incident.

Boarding was as usual not uniform.  I carry 7 kgs of luggage. No hold luggage through choice. Can you imagine my dismay when I see people with literally 3 or 4 bags, large rolling cases with more luggage on top and when it comes time to find a space it's a nightmare. I'm pleased about the laid back approach but I found this to be abused my many many people. Food this time I found OK. First meal was fine and apart from the starter which consisted of some rice thing. My second meal was a form of pad Thai which basically was noodles swimming in oil and unappetising. Seat was hard, very uncomfortable to say the least but it did recline. Entertainment was a total disappointment. Very little in movie choice and no game channel I could find. Cabin crew attentiveness was lacking I thought.

Dublin to zurich was OK but the main flight from Zurich to Bangkok was awful. Boarding seemed a mess. Don't know if any airline gets this right after all these years. My seat didn't recline properly and no help. My screen didn't work. Just 1 screen page. I asked for help 3 times but nothing done. Just we will try to reboot.  First meal was OK but the rushed service before landing at Bangkok was dismal. The scrambled eggs didn't look  appealing. The seat is one of the hardest I've sat on in a long time. I am really disappointed in this product. Long haul is hard enough in economy but this seemed like overkill. Not looking forward to the return.

Several things I found very disappointing about Swiss.  Seat very old and noisy. They are upgrading them but in 2 years approx. Food was not first class, ok at best. Wine was very good. A flight attendant was quite rude. Not insulting but it made us feel not at ease. Definitely not trained to work in first class - the airlines is not bespoke in first class. It has their processes and cannot even consider go around them. My experience from Air France or BA (to compare within European airlines) is a lot better and more worth it. You can feel it is a small airline without much investment.

We arrived on time for our flight. There was a group of people in the waiting area so we joined them. They didn’t do or say anything to indicate that they were closing the gate. Apparently, all of the other passengers had boarded the plane but we didn’t know as there were people in the waiting area. They closed the gate without doing a final call or calling our names. They marked us as no shows even though we had gone through security and had checked in our luggage. They refused to refund us and made us pay significantly more than our the original cost of our tickets to rebook for later in the day.

Flew with SWISS as I wanted to go to Dubai and their fare was the cheapest available. That along with travelling with a new airline via a stopover in a place I've never been added to my enthusiasm for this journey. Getting to Dubai was relatively stress free, except for the wallet busting food prices in Zurich. Note to transit passengers passing through Zurich, pack your own food or pay exceptional amounts for staple foods you take for granted back for home. Coming back from Dubai where things got interesting. Boarded the plane at Dubai as normal, then we were informed the place had developed a technical fault, resulting in the planes computers needed to be reset. All power to the plane turned off. Then we were told there was an issue with the GPS and the airline not having the relevant clearance to enter specific countries airspace en route to Zurich. Periodic updates occurred during the nearly 3 hrs they kept us on the plane, on the runway and still in Dubai. Finally after 3 hours, they announced the flight was cancelled and we were to contact the transfer desk. The queue was long but somebody prompted me to check my emails where i saw Swiss had rebooked me on another flight with Emirates, flying to Geneva and then on to Zurich. So I had to take 3 flights instead of two. Waiting to obtain a new boarding pass and rechecking my luggage with Emirates was stressful as queues were long and chaotic with no order to anything. As with these sorts of situations, it is those that shout loudest that get things done. No visible or practical support from any swiss air staff only an email. They merely dumped their passengers onto other airlines to sort. Eventually got to Zurich where i tried to reason with the SWISS staff if I could be booked on to an earlier London flight at no cost due as a gesture of goodwill for the additional time i was made to wait in Dubai. They were not having it and ended up waiting in Zurich for my next day London flight. A new situation for me but the support from SWISS could've been so much better. I would only use SWISS again as a last resort for any transcontinental journeys.
Trasa: London Heathrow to Dubai via Zurich

Tresc_opinii: The service itself was decent, but this is the second time that I experience great inconvenience on a Swiss flight.  The most recent incident was last March when I flew out of Athens and arrived in Singapore where I received a damaged suitcase. I filed a claim and was advised that the suitcase would be picked up from my hotel and repaired. I pointed out that Singapore was the first stop of a Far East trip with 6 stops, so my suitcase was badly needed in 4 days when I would take off again to continue. The suitcase was picked up from the hotel 2 days later, only to be returned in 20 minutes advising that they did not have the necessary parts to repair it. The local claims handling agency told me that they would not be further involved and I needed to sort this out with Swiss directly. As I needed to continue my trip I was forced to buy a new suitcase and throw out the damaged one. I tried to find as close a match to my original suitcase in size, make and quality. The replacement cost was SGD 329 or roughly 230 Euro. Having kept pictures I took the matter up upon my return with Swiss, filing a follow up claim. They re-directed me to another claims handling agency who, 2 months and numerous reminders later advised they would compensate me with 40 Euro! Alternatively they offered to pay for the repair cost but I advised them that the suitcase had been disposed as I could not carry it along on all my subsequent flights. They then increased their offer to €61.98. Bottom line is that my bag arrived broken and Swiss was unable to either repair it or provide an alternative for me to continue my trip. I was forced to buy another suitcase and realize that a discount would be reasonable but 73% I believe is insulting. I was forced by Swiss' inability to provide alternatives to dispose of the broken bag and buy a new one so I find it unreasonable that I have to bear that cost.

I booked my return ticket on the Swiss website and was able to reserve seats for all flights for free. It was indicated in the booking and e-ticket that seat reservations were included in the fare. Outbound all went well. However when I asked Swiss customer service whether it would be possible to change the seat for my inbound flight, they canceled the seat reservations and told me that I had to pay for them. I have exchanged numerous emails with Swiss customer service whose only response is that all seat reservations are payable, completely ignoring the information I sent them (copy of e-ticket, screenshots). The last email I received stated that free seat reservations are only available for Star Alliance Gold status. I happen to have this status, it is reflected in the booking and may be the reason why I could reserve the seats for free in the first place. However, it was sent to my as an explanation why I still have to pay for the seats rather than an explanation that Swiss kindly made the reservations. It seems that even supposedly human customer service staff has been robotized. "Service" also seems to have dropped. The saga therefore continues.

First time flown Swiss and pretty impressed. Short hop from LHR was delayed about 50mins due to ATC restrictions and the Captain explained this over the intercom from the front of the plane which I thought was a good personal touch. Caught up much of the time anyway on quick flight to Zurich with excellent cabin staff and service. Transferred to satellite terminal at Zurich and had about an hour in the impressive Senator lounge before quick priority boarding onto aircraft. Once settled in seat staff offered pre-flight welcome drinks and distributed menus. Flight pushed back on time. Inflight service was efficient and good throughout and food and wines were excellent. Seat was pretty comfortable and flat bed coped with my 6ft frame enabling me to get a decent amount of sleep. IFE had a decent selection of films. My only complaint was the cabin temperature was on the warm side for me. Arrived BKK on time but then had to wait 15 minutes for a gate to clear of a Thai Airways plane which was irritating given availability of other gates but hardly Swissair’s fault. We had a connection on Bangkok Air down to Phuket which we made with ease. Very satisfied with the fare and my experience of Swiss.

I had a flight scheduled for the day before at the same time that I always book and for which I pay more to return at the desired time, however I traveled to the airport and I was not informed by Swiss or by anyone, by email or by telephone that the flight was cancelled. They provided a flight for the next day at dawn, I arrived at the airport there was no open door to eat, I was hungry and sleepy. Swiss having caused this horrible situation was not even able to serve anything free to eat, and even so the second flight was delayed by 1 hour, the flight was now at 4 am and not at 3 am. On the plane as well as at the airport I couldn't sleep at all and after a day of the trip I'm still feeling bad and with severe headaches. Being horribly cold, the company didn't even have a blanket for the passengers. The worst flight I've ever had in my life.

The plane was over booked. We had an 8.5 hour flight which was delayed by 50 minutes. We did not have any sound on our in flight entertainment and the closed captions was not working. We travel with 6 other friends, 4 of the 6 had neither picture nor sound on their in flight entertainment. My husband was verbally reprimanded for organizing our food containers by the stewardess, who said, “ I wish you hadn’t done that, you only made my job harder.” My husband and I are small and we had absolutely no room in the middle rows. Our flight from The USA to Europe with Delta was more comfortable by far.

I flew from Zurich to Buenos Aires in a flight that was supposed to have a "fuel stop" (that is how the company advertised it) in Sao Paolo. However, when the plane reached SP, we were told we had to get off the plane and go over the security check all over again. The flight had the same number and the same aircraft was used. However, for Swiss, the flight from SP to Buenos Aires was treated as if it were an entirely new flight. People got off and on in SP (so, it was not just a "fuel stop" as advertised). When I was at SP, I heard my name on the PA. I went to the counter and was informed there was a better seat available for me for the rest of the trip. That I could change to a seat with more legroom in the first row of the Economy cabin. Of course, I agreed, as this was an upgrade. Many other passengers were being offered upgrades even to better cabins. To my surprise, when I re-boarded the plane, my seat had been changed to a middle seat in the second row (I had been seated at an aisle seat from Zurich) which had been allegedly changed for a better seat. I told a crew member and he was completely rude and sarcastic, saying he couldn't do anything, that I should ask the woman sitting next to me (who had been flying from Zurich as well). When I contacted customer service asking for compensation, they gave me an "empty" apology and said they couldn't do anything. This route is misleadingly advertised. Don't pay what is costs. The so-called "fuel stop" is an actual stop, where people get on an off the plane. Don't count on having the same seat you had at check-in. And don't accept any upgrades. They just need you to empty your seat because someone else paid for it at SP.

The flight was not the best but very good. I went on board and everything was lovely! The economy seats were comfortable and we even got pillows and blankets the screen was responsive and the seat was very clean and had a lot of legroom for my height! I really liked this flight but there was just one slight thing that concerned me. The service, I’ll be brutally honest about this. The service was terrible so first thing that concerned me was that when the flight attendant was handing out the food I asked for a vegetarian meal since I can’t eat non halal chicken pasta. They said in a kind of impolite voice that they didn’t have any more vegetarian meals I kindly asked if they had any options without chicken or meat, and they were like “we don’t have anything vegetarian deal with it” so I was very disappointed with this first part. I just ordered the chicken pasta and removed the chicken and everything close to it. The food came a bit cold for me but I don’t blame it on them it’s probably because I was at the literal back of the plane. Second thing is that when I wanted to use the restroom in the middle of the flight the same guy was handing out drinks to passengers he was basically at the beginning of the row so I kindly asked if he could move just 2 steps back so I could get into the restrooms and he pointed to my seat and shook his head? I kindly asked for him to move literally 2 steps which would take him less that 10 seconds!

I had two very different experiences with Swiss this summer, one excellent the other horrendous. Like most comments here state, the flights can be delayed, the staff seems to be hit or miss, or too friendly or too rude. They overbook their flights, so you will see a lot of people being denied boarding. Most carry ons will not fit the bins and will be checked at the door delaying the flight even more. The A220 planes are brand new and well kept, the A320 are old. Only a free bottle of water and a chocolate at economy, for the price they ask, not worth flying Swiss in economy to be honest.

Tytul_opinii: "my wife's and my bags did not arrive"
Tresc_opinii: Very happy with the flights. No so happy when both my wife's and my bags did not arrive. We lodged the report as advised. This is with a separate company as Swiss do not deal with customers for the first 5 days. We were told the bags likely missed the connecting flight from Zurich and would arrive the next flight. That didn't happen. 24 hours after our arrival we found out, by me initiating contact, that my bag had been found but we would have to pick it up at the airport, at our cost, as it was too late to deliver. That was the first 2 examples of poor service. We picked my bag up and saw the huge number of missing bags they had. Some seemed to have contact details but we still in the lost area. How they managed to lose both our bags, to obviously different locations, is quite remarkable. They provided a website to tell us the status of the lost bags. Over the next few days we checked regularly but nothing changed. It still showed my bag as awaiting pickup which was wrong. Numbers that we were given to ring either didn't answer or were wrong. Customer support was useless, they only care about bookings. The best offer we had was to get a number in America to ring (we are Australians in Europe.) No use at all. Eventually we left it with our cruise director on the Viking ship we were on. They were chasing other bags as well. After a week we were told the bag was being flown to Frankfurt and would be sent to the ship from there. That never happened. I suspect it was sent, sat there and then returned. The next update was it was going to Munich. We had no further advice about it. After Viking eventually confirmed it was there they dispatched a driver to pick it up and bring it back to the closest port. They then put it on a ship that would meet us in Vienna. After 14 days my wife got her bag, no thanks to Swiss air. I lost track of the number of calls and emails we and Viking made trying to get the bag. At on stage Viking spent over 4 hours on the phone trying to get answer. They we just totally unresponsive to nearly all calls and emails and the website updates were appalling and mostly non-existent. If not for Viking sending a car to Munich we would not have received the bag at all. We had our emails on our bag tags but that was no help. How hard would it have been for someone, once the knew it was unclaimed, to open the tag flap, see the email and let us know where the bag was and find out where we needed it sent. If you have got this far here are our tips Photograph your suitcase because you will have to describe it if lost Photograph the contents because you will have to describe that too Get an electronic tracking tag If they give you a number to call check it will be answered before you leave. Don't take anything they say on face value. Get it in writing that once located they will have the bag delivered to you, wherever you are. They did pay compensation for items purchased but there is a limit on that of $100. Not a lot for a 14 day delay.

The airline had overbooked the flight so we could not board these SAS Scandinavian flights. The customer service could not help and we had to pay everything ourself and got no help from Swiss to get back home. A month later Swiss will not take responsibility for this and we are still arguing to get back our money. 9643 NOK refund for rebooking and 800 EURO as a compensation. The customer service actually hang up on us and no-one can help you. I will never travel with Swiss ever again, because this is a bad way to treat customers.
I got a prompt response and help with my lost bag after I had reported my bag missing in Barcelona. After I filled out the form and I got a refund for my expenses.

I was flying to Catania (Sicily, Italy) via Zurich. 2 days prior to my supposed arrival time, there was a fire in Catania airport and the flight had to be diverted to a different city. They sent us to a random city, not in any way the closest possible to Catania, not even in Sicily, did not arrange any form of transportation to Catania, and there was about a 5 hour train ride to get to where we needed to go. I understand that a fire is an extraordinary circumstance, but arranging some form of bus (free or paid) would have been a better solution than dropping everyone in a random city and telling them to have fun.

Dissatisfying Experience - A Once Top-Tier Airline's Downfall. I regret to say that my recent experience with the airline, which was once considered a top-tier airline, left much to be desired. Despite the hefty price tag, the overall service fell short of expectations, leading to a disappointing journey. Initially drawn in by the airline's prestigious reputation and high-end image, I expected a level of service commensurate with the cost. However, my experience quickly took a downturn when I encountered various issues throughout my trip. Flight delays became an all-too-common occurrence, leading to inconvenient disruptions to my travel plans. Additionally, the seating arrangement was far from comfortable, lacking the expected space and amenities that one would expect from a premium airline. Moreover, the in-flight services were underwhelming, failing to meet the standards I had come to associate with top-tier carriers. The lacklustre customer service only exacerbated the situation, as staff seemed disinterested and unresponsive to passengers' needs. Sadly, it appears that the airline's emphasis on providing a low-cost service came at the expense of maintaining the high-quality experience they were once known for. As a result, the company's reputation seemed to have declined, and many passengers, like myself, began seeking alternatives from more competitive and value-driven airlines. It's disheartening to witness the downfall of what was once a leading player in the aviation industry. I sincerely hope that Swiss takes these criticisms constructively and endeavours to reinstate the excellence it was once celebrated for. Striking a balance between affordability and premium service is crucial for their revival in the highly competitive market. In conclusion, while the airline may still bear the vestiges of its former glory, the current experience leaves much to be desired. For travelers seeking a seamless and premium journey, there are better options available in the market today.

Worst experience ever with Swiss international. Delays, rude staff especially customer service. Missed connection in Zurich because of delays . Waited 7 hours with a 20euros voucher for a meal. Missed the ride at destination. On the way back delayed luggage, customer service rude and inefficient. 36 hours late I finally got my luggage at 5:40am. When I wrote a complaint I was basically told we are not part of EU so we don’t care about your complaint!- Seriously never again!

"My recent experience with SWISS airlines was nothing short of disappointing. From start to finish, the entire journey was plagued with issues and setbacks. First and foremost, the customer service was abysmal. The staff seemed disinterested and unhelpful, displaying a lack of professionalism that I found extremely frustrating. Furthermore, the flight itself was far from satisfactory. The seats were uncomfortable, leaving me feeling cramped and restless throughout the entire duration of the flight. The lack of legroom was particularly unbearable, making it nearly impossible to find a comfortable position to sit in. Additionally, the in-flight entertainment was severely lacking, with a limited selection of outdated movies and TV shows. It felt like a step back in time rather than a modern travel experience. To make matters worse, the food served onboard was tasteless and unappetizing. The meals lacked variety and were of subpar quality. I was left feeling unsatisfied and hungry, which only added to my overall dissatisfaction with the airline. Lastly, the airline's punctuality was highly questionable. My flight experienced a significant delay, causing me to miss an important connection. This lack of punctuality and disregard for passengers' time is simply unacceptable. All in all, my experience with SWISS airlines was marred by poor customer service, uncomfortable seating, lackluster entertainment options, unappetizing food, and significant delays. I would strongly advise against choosing this airline if you value a pleasant and hassle-free travel experience. There are much better options available that provide superior service and comfort."

Tytul_opinii: "worst airline I have ever flown with"
Tresc_opinii: I can confidently say that Swiss International Air Lines is the worst airline I have ever flown with. They have deleted my return ticket because I asked for a date change without my permission and didn't even inform me. I called them a few days before my original return date to see if I could change my return flight to 2 days earlier than planned, they said yes and went ahead and changed my ticket as well as sent me a confirmation email with the new dates. AA few hours later I received an email saying that my credit card used for rebooking charge didn't process. I gave them another call and this time the customer service rep said that I actually can't change my ticket and I would need to fly back during the original return date. A day before the original return flight I couldn't login to see my booking using the reference number so I called them again to learn that my return ticket was 'deleted'. They said because I asked for a change and it was not possible there were two booking under my name and they cancelled both. They robbed me off the return flight that I payed months in advance. I was told by the customer service rep this time that I could rebook my deleted return flight with a penalty and the fare difference if I preferred ... it is unbelievable but this is what they told me. When I got frustrated I was told by the customer service rep that maybe I should 'go away and think a little bit'. I ended but buying an entirely different one way ticket home that cost me over $1,000 in addition to the $1,900 roundtrip ticket that I already paid for with Swiss. T Worst airline, worst customer service.

Avoid at all cost! Worst airline from step one. First check in staff at the airport were unprofessional and poorly trained. Then flight kept getting delayed and delayed without any information then they told us that the aircraft is "weight restricted" so they deboard 10-15 passengers. Finally got into the plane only to be told after waiting for another hour that the flight was wrongly loaded. Please spend some extra money and fly with reputed airlines.

They cancelled my flight unexpectedly without providing an alternative option. They promised to refund me, but until today, I haven't gotten my money back. If you have the option of choosing other flights, please do not use this airline (Swiss).

Nobody needs something like the Swiss. Canceled flights, delayed flights, poor service. The Swiss does not even reach the level of a Ryanair. Total disaster, finally ended the tragedy and stampeded this airline.  Sowas wie die Swiss braucht kein Mensch. Annullierte Flüge, verspätete Flüge, schlechter Service. Nicht mal das Niveau einer Ryanair erreicht die Swiss. Totales Desaster, beendet das Trauerspiel endlich und stampft diese "Airline" ein.

Lost our bags. 3 days later airline has no updates and still cannot located our bags. Our entire trip is ruined due to this. Customers service is non existent. Aircraft is worn, bathrooms not cleaned, terrible food and the flight attendants not attentive at all. Absolutely horrible experience would not recommend nor would I ever fly this line again.

Chicago to Frankfurt via Zurich in Business Class. Start in Chicago was a bit disappointing. While check-in was good, security check and lounge at Terminal 5 were bad. Security check had no line for Business class passengers and the whole area was overcrowded with long waiting times. I was allowed to use the SAS lounge, which was very basic. There were no restrooms or showers, seating is limited, food and drinks (except wine) a big disappointment. The "highlight" was cold noodle salad. On board experience was much better. The cabin crew was welcoming and attentive. Service started with a drink (Champagne), later the menu was handed out. But there was no hot towel service and the amenity kit was very basic. Dinner service started shortly after take off, but while the presentation was good, the food (I had the vegetarian option) was only average. Unfortunately I’ve chosen a Swiss white wine, which was awful. My seat (12 G) was comfortable and offered enough storage space, but keep in mind that other business seats are different and offer smaller space. Entertainment system was good with an adequate screen and a great selection of movies and music. Before landing a cold breakfast was offered which you had to pre-order. My flight landed late in Zurich, but I made the connection within 30 minutes. The short connection flight on Helvetic was uneventful, the friendly cabin crew offered a small snack and drinks.

Their customer service is atrocious. I had to speak with 3 different people regarding an issue with my ticket. Each person told me something different and the last person literally refused to let me speak with a supervisor. They ended up cancelling my ticket and I had to book a new flight 2 days before I was supposed to leave. They did nothing to rectify the situation. The absolute worst customer service I’ve ever received.
Zurich to Delhi. Staff was rude to me. When we show faulty seats they didn’t bother to listen and adjust. Service was awful and I would not recommend anyone using this Swiss airlines.

I always used to fly with Emirates, and decided to try Swiss for the first time and I will never ever use this airline again! We have had the worst experience and such terrible service. The airline cancelled our flight and we have been emailing and contacting them to fix it for weeks with no response. No the airline rescheduled our flight and now only the day before our flight, we got rescheduled to another flight with no baggage allowed. We paid so much money for luggage and now we are told we have to pay again for bags with no guarantee of a refund. We did not budget for this and the airline has given us such poor service in assisting with the process! We do not recommend this airline to anyone, Emirates and even Qatar has provided us with excellent service for years and would never leave us with such an inconvenience! The service is poor and the additional expenses should not be our responsibility!

Tytul_opinii: "Swiss First is one of the best"
Tresc_opinii: Swiss International Airlines does not have the biggest suite or bathroom in the industry and does not offer the best entertainment system. Nevertheless the overall product Swiss First is one of the best. Seat and bed are very comfortable, Cabin interior is airy, elegant and beautifully designed. The suits offer enough privacy when wanted, but they offers as well a table for two travelers to dine together. The cheese fondue - on offer in wintertime - high above the clouds is one of the unforgettable culinary highlights in the sky. Food and wine on offer are changing each month. I had the special seafood Month, and the seafood starter and the seafood pasta were just amazing, as the rest of the dishes, which I choose from the regular menu. Worth mentioning the cheese plate as another highlight for cheese lovers. For breakfast I choose the Quiche, which was one of the best dishes I enjoyed on all my flights. The dining experience with very knowledgable and friendly staff was fantastic. Entertainment system was good, but not really exciting, especially the music section (classical music!) was rather mediocre. Getting to and from the plane is made smoothly and without the crowds: amongst others by private car and separate security control. Overall an exciting flight experience from check-in Zurich to arrival in Singapore with no problem.

I’ve flown SwissAir/Swiss frequently since 1968 and I am a frequent critic since the collapse of SwissAir. However, I just had the best flight ever on Swiss. Zurich to Chicago, seat 23k, first row econ+, bulkhead, window. The plane was empty because Swiss just added a 2nd daily flight two hours before the normal daily flight, so this flight was sparsely booked. And, the fare was $250 for this leg of the flight.  Normal price has been $750. In econ+ section of 50 seats, only 4 were occupied.  Staff was very attentive. Food? I stopped eating on Swiss flights years ago because it was consistently: Chicken or pasta. Instead I buy Spanish ham and a good cheese and a pastry at the deli at Zurich airport to carry on. However, what a surprise when I accepted only the salad and the dessert, and both were excellent. Previously served salad had been chopped iceberg lettuce, and dessert months old grapes. Swiss is beginning to treat the passengers better?

Booked because of very good timings and price. Manchester to Zurich going out, very good, transfer to Singapore flight could not have been easier, no security etc, literally took no more than five minutes from getting off one plane to to being seated on another. Flight delayed for about 30 minutes for late arrivals. Flights to and from Singapore ok, decent food, seats good for economy and good service. It then all turned into a complete shambles. We arrived bang on time, 6:14am. No particular problem getting off the plane. This time, no easy transfer. The 55min transfer time was looking shaky as we had a long to transfer from E to D by train followed by another long walk to security. Decent sized queue but didn't look too bad. Got through without too much of a delay only to find the Manchester flight had departed. Swiss had given a transfer time impossible to meet this time. I went to the transfer desk where they rebooked me on a flight eleven hours later and gave me a meal voucher that didn't cover the cost of a burger and fries. When I checked my emails, Swiss had sent me an email at 7:19 stating the flight had been cancelled and I had been rebooked on the later flight. Swiss had not cancelled my flight, it departed 7:24 as I tracked it over to Manchester. They lied to me and left me and several others stuck in Zurich airport for eleven long hours. I would not trust this airline again after their blatant lying.

Very disappointed with the ground crew experience at Zurich Airport. Travelling with a 2 month baby, 2 years old child, wife and elderly mum, we find out that SWISS family dedicated desks are closed despite several automatic marketing emails reminding us of this service. We then entered a queue for Fast Bag Drop. After 15 min, the ground crew employee filtering the queue entrance requested us to leave the crew, because we first needed to print out the luggage tags! We then needed to start the queue again without fast track despite their mistake to let us in the queue at the first place! 2x piece stroller was refused to be dropped at the gate so we needed to check that in and forced to rent an airport stroller ! Despite the mistakes and the crew witnessing our struggle, their where most unfriendly, no empathy whatsoever and arrogant. I feel ashamed of being Swiss myself after that experience. Some low cost airlines are much more friendly and family oriented than this ! Kudos to the cabin crew that operated our flight, they where marvellous. Customer experience does not start at the door of the plane, but as from the booking onwards.

Not a good experience with Swiss. It started with a massive waiting time at security control at Zurich airport. The flight was delayed. The flight as such was outsourced to Air Baltic. There was trash under my seat and the back of the seat in front of me was spilled with coffee. Clearly the plane had nit been cleaned properly. If you want to change your seat at check-in, one now has to pay Eur 30. A complete rip-off.

Personal item limitations don't apply at Swiss and is in fact extremely complicated to predict what happens at gate. Feels like flying easyJet every so often. Also paid exit seat was changed. I fly Swiss a lot and in my opinion it is very similar to the experience at Wizz Air / Ryanair.

We missed our flight because the boarding time was changed multiple times. Also there was no announcement as they said Venice airport is silent airport but next day announcement was done on the same airport (new flight booked at run time). Even we reached for boarding almost 10 minutes before the flight take off they denied boarding with 1 liner boarding time is finished, they could have allow if they wanted to do so. Very bad experience.

Booked two flights with this airline from Budapest to Florence through Zurich, and another from Florence to Nice. Both flights were more than 2 hours delayed. We missed both connecting flights on different days when the weather conditions were absolutely fine. Got stuck at the airport twice for 4 hours. Received nothing but cheap  meal vouchers that could be used only at 4 fast food chains. Tried to use them at starbucks and only one worked. Also, they gave us last rows near the restroom both times for a new flight.

Swiss used to be good but now are absolutely horrible to. The 14hr flight was just unpleasant. The seats were tiny, the entertainment years out of date. The service was unhelpful and the stewards were strangely aggressive to requests such as getting water on a long haul flight and continually bumping you in your seat. I literally had to beg them for food when they skipped out rows during service. The food quality was very poor. Then they rebook your connecting flight and lose your luggage and make no effort to redress the situation. Even if you call their contact line there is no response except to redirect you to a useless online form. About 7 people on the same flight have lost their luggage and nothing from Swiss.

Very dated aircraft, not comfortable seating with little leg room, dated infotainment and service is average overall. For a Swiss carrier there is a lot of work to be done to compete at international level. I would rather pay extra and travel with other airlines.

My flight was from Bangkok BKK to London LHR via Zurich. This flight and service a nightmare. 30 mins late leaving BKK for one reason or another but made up of time to Zurich. Got to Zurich then had to go across airport to get connecting flight to London, with short turn around. Getting ready to board when announced last minute technical problem slight delay, technical problem then turned out to be crew member felt sick and didn't want to fly. So no replacement crew at airport so had to wait 1 1/2 hours delay, which meant I would miss last train to my home from London. Swiss staff not bothered or concern and told me to fill out forms? They had a chance of putting me on another flight to London from Zurich but failed to inform me of this. This meant I would be stranded at LHR overnight, so had a choice of paying 350 for Taxi to get home to prepare for work next day or pay 250 for Hotel room and miss a day's work. No Swiss Air reps or UK numbers available. Stay away from this cowboy outfit.

13.5 + 2h flight in economy from Asia to Europe. As many others have pointed out, the hard product that the Swiss cabin offers is extremely dated and badly in need of a makeover, however on our flight the soft product provided by the warm touch of the cabin crew made up for it. Legroom was dismal and I was unable to stretch my legs out fully as I have been previously able to on many other long-haul airlines even in economy. On the highly fuel-inefficient A340 it was also evident that the cabin pressurisation features is far lagging the newer B787s and A350s and one could really feel the difference stepping off the plane. That being said, everything else worked just fine with regards to the IFE, meal service and punctuality. In a way I am glad our bid of €1500 (each) for business class was declined and saved us some money, since it seems like the seats in business wasn’t a massive step-up from what we got. Would like to specially mention Sophie on the flight from HKG-ZRH on 26 April who was really sweet, cheerful and polite and made everyone’s experience a little better.
Trasa: Hong Kong to Mallorca via Zurich

Tresc_opinii: From ZRH to LAX in Business Class on a 777-300 ER. Not a good experience at all. The Business Class on the 777-300 is extremely dated and not state of the art at all compared to the Business Class Seats of other airlines. Seats are extremely uncomfortable and narrow and sleeping felt like sleeping on a concrete floor. The pillow Swiss gives you in Business Class is a complete joke. Impossible to sleep on that. In flight catering is very poor. The starter consisted of two asparagus with some sauce and a piece of bread. No salad whatsoever. It was followed by a tiny portion of meat with carrots etc. as a main course. No more separate cheese service neither. The desert was absolutely tiny too - a piece of tasteless cake probably 1,5 time 6 cm. Prior to landing, there was a choice of a tiny sweat potato salad or gnocchi. It was ok but again far to little. The absolute shocker was the fact that after a 12 hours flight they do not even give you a wet towel in business class. Overall, not a good experience at all. It felt like a very dated product combined with a flavor of endless cost cutting/savings. If you fly on Swiss Business Class, definitely bring a pillow to sleep and some extra food.

Delhi to Zürich with onward connection to Brussels in first class. Very friendly staff, comfortable seats and smooth transfer in Zürich with first class passport control and security. The  lounge in Delhi (Air India) must be one of the worst airline lounges I ever visited with limited choice of food and drinks. The on-board catering (food) in Swiss is also rather poor for a first class cabin. Onboard wifi was also poor (only 50MB which is quickly consumed whereas other airlines even offer free wifi in business class). I would therefore rate it an average first class product. Swiss has work to do to improve its catering/food offer where other airlines offer a superior product in first class. First class passengers should also be offered unlimited free wifi.

Swiss quality has dropped significantly over the past few months, and I am a HON member. We are travelling under one booking, 3 adults and one child of 7 years. They assign a separate seat to the child, far away from any of us. The check in people say to ask the gate, the gate people could not care less and say you should have asked at check in. Phoning the Swiss HON service and they say lots of nonsense (like you should have done one grouped booking, which I did etc). We get in the plane and find another family with the same problem. I honestly thing there are better alternatives for a better service. A shame because the flying attendants are very helpful.

After a personal welcome by the captain and a very good Champagne, the bad news was that heavy rain is causing immediately quite some delay at Miami airport. FA were extremely friendly and very attentive. For the first time since a longtime I received hot towels on a flight. The dinner was also very good including the signature dish in Swiss First the balik salmon. The wine selection had a very good choice of Swiss wines as well as great red Bordeaux and a rather special dessert wine from Sauternes area. Breakfast had several options as well including eggs and a sausage. Passengers did receive a pyjama from a rather expensive Swiss brand and an amenity bag by Bally however not in leather. Unfortunately the 2 restrooms for first are rather small and there was a lack of nice toilet amenities. Transfers were done at Zurich airport by premium cars and the First class lounge had a lot to offer.

I have seen a deterioration in many aspects of the experience involved in flying with Swiss since the pandemic. Over 50 percent of my Swiss flights have been delayed, sometimes in excess of 90 minutes. The situation on the current flight LX52 on 04/13/23 involves an 80 minute delay on the tarmac. The stated reason keeps evolving from late connecting passengers to the flight log requiring an update to no further explanation after the most recent delay extension.

What a disappointment! In the future will try to avoid Swiss and definitely will not recommend. No drinks or food offered. Coffee priced at 4Chf and some awful sandwiches at 11 Chf. Only 1 toilet in economy with a full plane you spent most of the time standing in the back of the plane. Worst airline ever

Swiss used to be my favourite airline but recently service in business class seems to have deteriorated. On the flights between ZRH and STR I was surprised now seeing only sandwiches served in a paper bag similar as the ones handed out free to Economy passengers in the past. Only water, coffee or tea is now served on flights between ZRH and STR. On the flights between ZRH and BRU champagne is no longer served in business class but you can get some cheap sparkling wine instead or buy real champagne from the onboard sales menu. The only positive note on these flights was an extremely helpful flight attendant. Also when having Senator status you have access to the Alpine lounge at Zürich airport which is really nice, never crowded and with nice views over the airport and the runways

They have the worst customer service. I have been trying to reserve seats for a week now. They keep getting canceled. I spoke to 9 agents today trying to reserve the seats. I finally reserved 2 seats at $35 each and 2 seats at $14 each. They charged me $168 instead of the correct amount of $98. Now they are lying about the price even though I have the receipt which they sent via email. I have asked several times to speak to a supervisor which they REFUSE! I have never had an issue with other airlines. They are so incompetent. Three agents hung up on me. I also got disconnected a couple of times. They never called back or asked for a call-back number. I am furious. I am leaving in less than a week and issue still isn't resolved. I can't call them back one more time. They are HORRIBLE! I will never travel with them again. I have spoke to over 10 agents just to reserve seats and still don't have any seats. They even tried to tell me that I don't have any tickets even though I have confirmation emails. They also removed me from my connecting flight and never notified me. I accidently found out by looking at the United app. They are despicable and so unprofessional. What kind of company doesn't allow you to speak to a supervisor? I'm disgusted to say the least!

We flew Swiss Air back to Bangkok on Business class. The check-in was very fast and we enjoy very nice Swiss Lounge at airport. The seat was nice and spacious (for us). The food was OK but not good taste as we expected. The service by cabin staff was excellent. We enjoy some good sleep.

We flew Swiss Air for the very first time and also the first time with Premium Economy class. The check-in was smooth and the flight was a little delay. The seat was very nice and we enjoy our privacy and comfort. Their service by cabin attendants was excellent and the food was good. We also enjoy Swiss Air's snack service for all premium and economy class passengers with sandwich, chocolate bar, mineral water etc. We also tried cabin WIFI service which is OK but not cheap. The flight was smooth and we arrived Zurich only 10 minutes late.

I booked a round-trip ticket London-Aswan with Lufthansa/Swiss (via Budget Air) for £1,441 on Dec. 12. On Feb 14, Swiss canceled my flight, offering return bookings that would extend my 10-hour journey to 24 hours, including overnight at Zurich Airport. I decided just to postpone my return for a day in order to get proper flights, and was charged an extra £250. So I was away a day longer than I wanted and, with (with hotel charges) was down £500. You can't get a boarding pass online for Cairo, so by the time I navigated the airport, my Swiss flight was closed. I begged and was allowed to board, but never again. Swiss uses a narrow-body aircraft with no in-flight entertainment or sockets for the inter-continental flight, with just the empty middle seat you see in business for short-haul flights in business. Swiss has substituted cheap sparkling wine for Champagne in business, but did allow me to pay for the Champagne that they sell in economy. I've been a huge fan of Swiss, but it appears to have sunk below British Airways now, so I don't see any need to fly Swiss again. Oh, and when I did arrive in Zurich, the business-class lounge was closed, without explanation. The same thing happened the last time I flew into Zurich with Swiss. And my flight was delayed. (On a separate note, I would never book Budget Air again. The airlines refer queries/problems to Budget Air, which doesn't have a telephone helpline.)

Every time I have flown Swiss, I have been most impressed by the cabin crew, and this (delayed) flight was no different. They were fantastic. But Swiss has taken to serving cheap sparkling wine instead of Champagne. I read online that this is a temporary supply issue rather than an economy measure. Why, then, are they selling champagne alongside the almost-half-price sparkling wine in economy? This whole trip with Swiss was a bit of a disaster -- the Champagne issue is a minor sideshow -- but more in another review. After being a cheer leader for Swiss, I can no longer recommend the airline.

Overall quite an average business class experience. A330 is now showing its age and cabins are in need of refurbishment. The inflight entertainment system is ancient, device charging set up, Wi-Fi is poor. A positive note is that Swiss has efficient, professional and friendly flight crew. The food beverage and service in Business Class is only average, Bistro arrival meals were limited and served as if it was fast food. The amenities kit was flimsy and not of value. Not what we had hoped for in business, but since Swiss Air, Austrian are controlled by Lufthansa it’s about what you expect. The Business class lounge at Zurich Airport is well designed, however the food offerings for morning departures was limited. Swiss clearly needs to invest in improving its Business Class product.

Flight got cancelled in Bangkok after 3 hours delay and we are in the airport for more than 9 hours to get back our luggage. No food provided and water after 8 hours of waiting.  I needed to call the office in Zurich to get the new booking and finally get to our destination since out connecting flight was ruined as well. After 20 mins on the call  we finally got the flight on Finnair airlines departing in 3 days. They did not respond on twitter or Facebook even though in their web they encouraged to write there. Neither bot chat was working, just general answers and ‘We are sorry your flight is cancelled’. And then they we’re dropping us from the chat.

The flight got announced that it was canceled due to technical issues after 3:25 hours! It's not almost 4 hours and we are still on the plane even after the announcement. they rebooked my flight with a layover and now I will be missing a tour I planned for my limited stay in Zurich. Oh and no refunds on the tour since it's the same day. That aside, the foot room is horrible. I sit in the last row, to my left, is the door to the restroom. Every time someone opens it, I can see inside and sniff something. My row on the aisle seat also doesn't have enough space for my backpack. The space allocated to me is half the size of my backpack because of the placement of the support for the seats in front of me. Avoid SWISS.

Flew Business Class on an 777-300 plane from Singapore to Zürich and then changed to another one to fly from Zurich to the U.S. While Swiss has been my favorite non-U.S. carrier, both flights were awful relative to aircraft and service. A few lowlights: Seats are very uncomfortable and do not lie flat. Cushions are weak and they are too narrow. Some aisle seats have no sides. Window seats with 2 seat configurations are difficult to enter or leave. Controls for seat positions are few and placed near where you easily can press one by accident. Storage near or under seats is very limited, it was hard to find a place for shoes or a purse nearby. The SIN-ZRH 777 plane was not very clean and smelt. The other 777 aircraft seemed very new, and was clean, but my seat did not adjust downward as much as my companion’s seat, poor construction and quality checking. Washrooms were like in Economy. Meals and beverages reflected cost-cutting, and I’ve flown Swiss business for decades. Cheap new plastic trays are used, limited refills were offered, galley snacks on these long-flights were popcorn or crisps in small bags and a few small candy bars. Wines and liquors appeared downgraded, as were the menus. Meat was tough. Deserts were ordinary. Service was abysmal. First meal on a 10 hour flight was served three hours after departure. Service on the Singapore flight didn’t offer nuts or anything on the side with drinks. My companion ordered sorbet from a menu, but was given ice cream even though both were on the menu. When she asked to exchange, the attendant told her there was no sorbet left. However, I was served 10 minutes later, inexcusable for a couple sitting together. I then received sorbet from a different attendant. I, however, had asked for ice cream but I was told now there was no ice cream. Yet later I saw two other persons receiving ice cream. Sorbet or ice cream is no big deal. But due to the contradictions either or both flight attendants lied or were too lazy to care. Neither is excusable and both cross lines. Cabin crew was not friendly, but the ZRH ground crew wins a bad conduct prize. As the couple in front of us were boarding, the gate attendant turned to a colleague, rolled her eyes and said disparagingly to her colleague “Americans”. I don’t believe she knew we heard her. ﻿

Flight LX 138 at 22:40 proceeded normally, the staff was pleasant. Originally, a Boeing 777-300 ER was to be used for the flight. Which was a little disappointing for me. This flight was my first intercontinental flight with this company in business class. I was pleasantly surprised by the comfort of seat 8A and the surrounding space. I found the business class configuration economical compared to companies like Singapore airlines. The food served was tasty and nicely styled. The staff was very attentive during the flight and fulfilled any requests. The interior showed the older age of the aircraft. Entertainment was sufficient. The flight went smoothly, we arrived in Hong Kong on time.

Overall an average experience. Starting off with the good things: The 2-3 layout of the airbus A220 makes people traveling alone in economy substantially more convenient than other offerings in the A320s or the 737s with the ability to sit on the 2 side so you are only next to one other person. The seat was relatively new, there was a complimentary bottle of water and a little chocolate was offered (see photo). Now the downsides, as a full carrier charging full carrier prices and in a somewhat new aircraft, the lack of in-seat power points of USB ports was disappointing. Other competitors on this route all offer some kind of in-seat charging options (even on AF's old A319s) so it's a big downside for Swiss. Furthermore, the drink options was limited to only a bottle of water, nothing else. It would be fair to expect some more options offered by the crew in addition to just a bottle of water, especially for a morning flight like this one. Overall if you are business traveller, although not being one of the best, Swissair still remains one of the more solid options out there.

I recently flew SWISS from San Francisco to Oslo with a layover in Zurich. I found out that you can submit a bid for an upgrade with SWISS. I wanted a lay flat seat but I've had no experience with international travel until now so I didn't know which seats would do that. I saw that I could bid for an upgrade to premium economy. My wife and I were both flying and the minimum bid for the upgrade for 2 seats was about $700 USD. Before I submitted my bid I called their customer service line to see if those seats lay flat. The customer service agent put me on hold to verify if they do or do not. When she came back on the line she said “yes they do”. I reverified with her by saying just to confirm, the premium economy seat lay all the way back, they lay flat, and she said the premium economy seats lay flat. I thanked her for her time and submitted my bid. I found out on the flight that the seats do not lay flat. I submitted a complaint to their customer service and asked for a refund for the upgrade since I was lied to and since the lay flat seats, which I did not get, were my sole purpose for upgrading. They refused to refund the $700 USD. This is completely unacceptable. This was my first and last time I will ever fly Swiss Air.
Trasa: San Francisco to Oslo via Zurich

Tresc_opinii: Charge you to select seats and then they move your seat 22 rows back due to a plane switch, with no accommodations or return. Don’t waste your money on seat reservations, it might be a waste of money. I was 22 seats back further with only a 50 minute transfer window for my next flight.

The boarding was very good for First and business passengers, despite a decline to use the fast track for passport and security. In business, welcome aboard with Champagne or soft drinks - FA were very friendly. You must get used to the single seat in business - I was surprised Swiss did not offer a hot towel anymore. There were decent choice of food for the evening meal accompanied by a decent but not luxurious wine selection. Swiss is still giving cheese and dessert that was served after the tray was removed followed by coffee or tea with some Swiss after dinner drinks and chocolates . Nothing wrong with the quality of the meal. You are requested to fill in your order for breakfast what was continental, prior arrival at Zurich. A very good however not spectacular experience and very friendly FA .

Tytul_opinii: "the worst long haul flight experiences of my life"
Tresc_opinii: Both directions, South Africa to Brazil via Zurich were some of the worst long haul flight experiences of my life. If it’s avoidable I will never fly Swiss again, and I fly a lot. First of all, the app does not work correctly. You cannot even check in on the app, or choose seats, or add baggage. I had to use the Lufthansa app to check in and choose seats on my way to Brazil. On the way back not even that worked. The website also gives you an error when you check in. On my way back I had to check in with LATAM because I flew Rio to São Paulo on a LATAM partner flight to start the trip, but they would only let me check in for the first flight, so I had to recheck-in at the counter on my 2 hour layover - so I got a terrible seat for my long haul flights. Also the seats on the South Africa to Zurich and back flights are insanely tiny for an 11 hour flight, the smallest worst seats I’ve maybe ever had in a plane. To make it even worse the window seats have a 15 cm gap between them and the wall/window so you can’t lean on the wall (the whole point of a window seat). Worst food I’ve ever been served on an airplane, and that includes cheap African and Asian airlines. On top of that, they overbooked the SP to Zurich flight, and begged me to volunteer for compensation. I said no at first but told them I might consider it. They approached me after and really pushed me to say yes because they didn’t have enough volunteers. Then after taking my seat and boarding everyone else, announced my name on the loud speaker and told me actually I needed to get on the flight. At that point I had already asked a friend to come get me from the airport so we could spend the evening together and I had to call them off. They gave me a middle emergency row seat with no seat in front, so there was no place to put anything, no book, no headphones etc. Because I was the last person on the plane the overhead bins were full (they didn’t keep space for the emergency row people). The flight attendant told me I had to put my bag in business class. I told her I need access to it if I cannot have anything out of the bag for take off per the emergency exit rules, plus no seat in front of me. She started yelling at me she didn’t want to be on the flight and was tired of moving peoples bags around and it wasn’t her problem. She literally said to me “I don’t even want to be on this flight so you having access to your things is not my problem.” I was kind of in shock, and then another passenger volunteered to have move their bag to under the seat in front of them.
Trasa: Rio de Janeiro to Johannesburg via Zurich

Tresc_opinii: Completely full flights but smiling and efficient cabin crew, and managed the overhead locker space well. Water and chocolates handed out. Very comfortable and efficient.

Flight was canceled just hours before with no explanation. We were supposed to have a layover in Zurich for 20 hours where we booked accommodations and had to forfeit the cost because we were rerouted to Singapore for a later flight. This meant we now had to wait at the Male Airport for 12 hours before our next flight! I tried to call Swiss Airlines multiple time, but waited for 2 hours and still no answer. Since a phone call was useless, I wrote at least 4 different complaints on their site and only received 1 email a month later which basically said you're out of luck.

Having flown this route many times, Swiss was the most disappointing carrier. Seat not comfortable and no duvet for overnight flight, only one extremely uncomfortable pillow and blanket supplied. Poor food with few options, no wine list offered. Waited 40 minutes from first course salad to my main dish arriving. Staff not attentive. Small restrooms with no space for changing into night clothes. Laughably basic amenities kit (socks and toothbrush). Poor choice of IFE. Brand suggests quality but fails to provide it. EVA Air is head and shoulders above Swiss on this route. Would not recommend

Tytul_opinii: "you pay more but you get low cost treatment"
Tresc_opinii: The FLR-ZRH was on a Helvetic Airways Em190 in excellent condition. Flight was in time and inflight service was only a bottle of water. The ZRH-ATH was on A320 plane in good condition, departed on time. There was no IFE. There was no inflight service, than a bottle of water and a small chocolate. There was a buy MENU option. You could not change your seat at e-check-in, unless you pay for it. I cannot see the difference with low cost companies. On LH you pay more but you get low cost treatment.

First our original flight was cancelled due to "mechanical issues" 7 hours prior to take off. We spent the entire day trying to get a hold of someone to rebook, we were told eventually that the only way we were getting on another flight is if we paid $400 extra per person. We finally went down to the airport (2 hours away) and waited for the desk to open so we could speak to someone in person. We were rebooked on a flight 2 days later. Instead of having 1 layover we were going to have 2. So our first flight is fine but then the 2nd flight is delayed which causes us to miss our 3rd flight. We were then stuck in Zurich to wait in line at that airport for someone to rebook us on another flight. Which then ended up in 2 more flights! We finally get to Budapest only to wait 2 more hours for our luggage which never showed up! We file a missing luggage report and don't end up receiving our luggage at all during our Christmas vacation. We ended up having to buy a bunch of clothes and toiletries which we have still not been reimbursed for. We didn't get our luggage back til more than 30 days later. When it arrived it looked as though someone dragged it through the dirt and, it went to my neighbors house down the street, not even my own house! We haven't been reimbursed for anything! Not even the $150 luggage fee when they lost our  luggage!
Very fussy airline. At the gate they run around with a scale to find cabin luggage with more than 8 kg and charge you 70€ for it. Worse experience than with other low cost airlines!

Bought 5 business class tickets for > 20k€ and called a few day before to make a change. It took me 2 hours to talk to someone who was in a call centre with little knowledge about the airline. I asked to be called back if call dropped, which it obviously did and then no one called back. I dialled back and talked to someone who told me he couldn’t call back if it dropped. Call dropped again. I call back to talk to someone who took 45 mins to assess whether I could change my ticket. Long story short, they forced me to do an extra leg for nothing (thank you for the planet). I eventually gave up as the person was so unqualified. Horrible business class experience. I fly more than 100 flights a year for work and this is one of my worst experience. I used to Air France’s well qualified business class customer service who speaks English and actually cares about the company and its customer. I wish I could attach the recording of the call as it was just embarrassing the questions I was asked. The flight is a bit old and the service is low cost. Food is not good. Really not at par with other international company. I used to love Swiss, but this is my 3rd bad experience with Swiss business class in less than a year. If you travel business: avoid the company as there is no way to discuss with someone well qualified, and you have to wait 2 hours on the phone like any low cost economy tickets.

To begin with, the web check-in did not go through because my ticket was booked via United. In the aftermath, the seats I got were in rows 28 and 32. At the check-in counter in Chicago however, they changed my seat for second flight to row 23, where legroom was spacious. Food in flight was bland for both flights. IFE was functioning, watched Top Gun series on both flights. There is a lot of room for improvement in terms of food and catering service. Other than that, it is a decent airline, but needs a lot of changes. Also got miles on my United mileage plus account.

They cancelled the flight 4 hours in advance (LCY->ZUR). No rebooking options were provided, and I will miss a crucial part of my business visit. The chatbot was entirely useless and no human showed up in the chat box to discuss options. No information was given about refunds. They have zero respect for customers. I had previous bad experiences with them but the flight connection from LCY was too convenient to ignore. Don't make the same mistake.

Tytul_opinii: "they can't see any mistake from their side"
Tresc_opinii: I have always been a loyal fan and guest of Swiss and have always been more than satisfied with their service. Unfortunately, my experience with my last booking to the US clearly clouded my opinion. As always, I booked my flight to Chicago via the Swiss Smartphone App on August 30, 2022 to visit my fiancé. I wanted to take the opportunity right away to bring our two cats over. I knew that this is easily possible with Swiss and that I simply had to call the hotline after booking to reserve the places for the cats in the luggage compartment. When I received the booking confirmation, I found that the flight was operated by United Airlines, which was unfortunately hardly visible in the app. However, I figured if Swiss partners with United Airlines, the policies and services will be the same. I then called United Airlines to reserve the space for the cats in the luggage compartment. I was quite disappointed to find out that United Airlines no longer takes cats in the luggage compartment. My disappointment was enormous because I had booked a flight that is of no use to me. I then called the Swiss hotline and I had to book a new outbound flight with Swiss with additional rebooking costs of around CHF 270. About a week later I call again to make sure the cats are booked and they tell me they are on the Chicago to Zurich flight, which was wrong! After several calls i finally managed it to have them booked on the flight from Zurich to Chicago and not vice versa. The day before departure I went to the pet store to buy a suitable transport box for the cats and called the Swiss Hotline from the shop to make sure I was buying the right transport box. The person on the hotline assured me that soft transport boxes with a steel frame are also permitted for cats. So I chose a model for CHF 120. When I checked in the next day at Zurich Airport, I was told that these boxes were not permitted and I had to buy a new one for CHF 140.00 on the spot and had no other choice than throw the other one away. I had additional costs totaling CHF 530 for this trip, which I could have avoided if Swiss had communicated correctly and the information on the app were more visible. Afterwards I have filed a complaint and i got a short and impersonal answer back that they can't see any mistake from their side. Partnerships with other airlines are legitimate, but it must be clearly stated that the policies and services are not the same. every time I called the hotline, I agreed to be recorded, so they should be able to find out about their misinformation, shouldn't they?

Tytul_opinii: "My seat was changed from bulkhead aisle to middle"
Tresc_opinii: My seat was changed from bulkhead aisle to middle although I paid extra for the aisle bulkhead. No option to change back was offered. I later switched to an aisle farther back in the plane. No refund of the upgrade was offered. Boarding was delayed and not by group. Departure was delayed.

Tytul_opinii: "I am very happy they repaid quickly"
Tresc_opinii: Booked Manchester to Windhoek via Frankfurt with Swiss and paid £380 for extra legroom on the two long haul legs which were with a partner airline, Eurowings. On both legs the extra legroom wasn't allocated and the partner airlines gave a couldn't care less attitude about it and Swiss just sent automated reply when I complained by email. On returning home I requested a refund from Swiss and I'm happy to say that two weeks later we have been fully reimbursed. So whilst initially being very annoyed with their service and their partner airlines c.

Worst airline I have ever flown with. They made me, my fiancée and 9 year old fly from London to Zurich knowing that we would have missed our connecting flights and that there were no others to Brazil the next day. We tried speaking to everyone, including over the phone only to be told that it couldn’t be sorted in the UK. No flights were arranged when we arrived in Zurich and we were put in a hotel and told to share a double bed! Nobody called us to advise and I accidentally found out we had been put in a flight by logging on the APP. After calling twice and being told I was not on that flight but on one later in the day (which did not exist) the advisor said I should go to the airport to ask there as he was not sure. Indeed we were going via Milan and I almost missed it because of their incompetence. We had no bags as we were told it was safer for them to keep them. After 3 different employees checking the bags were on the flight to Milan and following to Brazil, we arrived without them. They arrived 38 hours later. No compensation given and I was told by them they are not liable. Terrible service. Tight flight. Food not great. Worth paying more and flying with another airline.

I called up for an upgrade to business class and was hung up on about 6 times, when I was finally able to reach someone, I was put on hold and then hung up on about 3 more times when finally I reached someone they told me that an upgrade was not possible even though I was willing to pay. I then asked for a seat reservation as I was unable to do it online as it was blocked for some reason, their website is a mess, I was hung up on another 2 times until I again was able to call and reach some who was able to reserve the seats with extra leg room in economy, I asked to be to the front of the plane as possible and they did the reservation for me and they charged my card more by $75 dollars than what was stated on their disaster of a website. I asked them to send me the new seat reservation and questioned them on why they charged me more than what was stated they said this is the way it is, and they refused to send me the new seat assignment on email saying they can only say it on the phone, what a mess, I must have spent two days on this story.
