I then called again to ask about how much an extra bag would be and they told me $120 dollars and I said no I will think about it and the next day I find a charge for $170 dollars on my credit card, what a scam of a company and I called again and was hung up on another 3 times until again I was able to reach someone and they said that if I cancel all is non refundable. I gave up and I can tell you I will never ever in my life use Swiss Air or Expedia both are disgusting and have zero notion on Customer Excellence. I do not recommend anyone to use both companies they are a disaster!

Very run down and outdated Business Class. Board personell actively hid from passengers to avoid requests or questions. Every single order I placed came back widely incorrect but instead of just fixing it, the stewardess decided to blame me for the error. The catering from DEL is a major disaster.

Tytul_opinii: "no better than any low cost flight"
Tresc_opinii: Flight lx 256 from Zurich to Tel Aviv. The plane is very old. Thin and uncomfortable seats. The food was horrible and it would be better if it wasn't served at all. A flight no better than any low cost flight. A big disappointment from a company with a good name without a decent value for the price of the ticket.

Tytul_opinii: "seats were shifted on the day of boarding"
Tresc_opinii: I would not recommend anyone to take this unless you have 0 options. I wanted to change my return ticket from Zurich and they forfeited my air ticket instead. I called to demand a refund since it’s their own system error and I shouldn’t be paying for it. They replied that there’s nothing they can do about the system Nor the refund at all. I called 3 different times and all 3 agents gave me mixed answers about my ticket status. Not only, I was told to send an email to rectify only to be five. A wrong email. So you’ll be spending time to dig the correct email. When I finally got there, they didn’t respond but attached a totally different booking reference to it. It’s as if you’re talking to the wall. I thought that’s the end of my drama to find out that my seats were shifted on the day of boarding. I think this is one of the worst airline ever.

I had terrible experience with my flight from Valencia to Zagreb. At first Swiss sent me SMS when I was already on my way to airport, offering me to move flight as they overbooked. I did not opted for this as my family already waited for me for planned family trip. First they denied me check in at the airport and then they sent me to Swiss office where they issued me ticket for flight 6 hours later. No voucher of any kind offered and then when I contacted them, after one month they said that basically everything was my own fault (!) and that they are not willing to compensate me. I would never ever recommend such terrible service to anyone.

Tytul_opinii: "not the Swiss Air I used to know"
Tresc_opinii: A trip to hell. From the crew to the ground staff very contemptuous in dealing with the traveler. The ground staff in Buenos Aires did not even speak English. Horrible food, the plane with broken seat upholstery. My seat was broken (it would not recline) and the cabin crew refused to give me another seat. The little time I was able to sleep I was constantly bothered by staff who kept hitting me as she passed. This is not the Swiss Air I used to know.

I was surprised by the quality of the service on this flight. London City usually means cramped aircraft and limited service, but this was fully in line with flights into Heathrow. The service was attentive, the seat was comfortable and there was a decent choice of drinks, including Champagne.

Tytul_opinii: "This to me was the final straw"
Tresc_opinii: I was denied boarding because the flight was overbooked. This to me was the final straw. I use the airline often to travel and I was not very happy with the services especially for long haul flights however today the services were below acceptable. We were offered the minimum compensation and the inconvenience is just too much. Never again. I truly believe that Swiss is probably the worst European airline that is not low budget.

Very nice! I want to thank to the company for a such good service. We travelled from Oslo to Milan, tur-retour, in both cases with stop in Zurich. We bought tickets from ticket.no (not right from Swiss). We didn't chose the seats, but the company gave us seats to be together.  We could take care about our child together. We got water and chocolate and our child got toys (they tried also to give to him sweets but we refused). The plane was clean and the staff showed us respect. In Milan we had to wait like 5min close to the plane to get our baby trolley. The shuttle bus was waiting for us. The crew got out from the plane and they tried to help to find it. They felt frustrated because we had to wait so much (and the bus full with passengers was waiting for us) and they apologized. Back in Oslo, I found out that my luggage got a little damage. In the airport, I spoke with them from customer service (baggage service) and they apologized and gave me the chance to chose (from a website) a new suitcase for free. In my opinion, their focus is on the customer. It was a nice experience and for sure we will travel again with them.

While I had a really good outbound flight on LH, the service on my return flight from Sao Paulo to Zurich was a disappointment. They don't offer aperitif with a drink run and nuts or nibbles before dinner. Dinner is served on one tray with all courses coming together at the same time. That's not business class and once you have finished the starter, the main dish is cold. Also no choice of breads and just two bites of cheese with no crackers. It seemed that cabin crew wanted to get the service done as quickly as possible, but it's an 11 hour flight departing at 6pm, so no need to rush or getting people to sleep soon. The breakfast service on Swiss is decent with many options to choose from. I ended up with hardly any sleep, partly because of quite a bumpy flight (that's not Swiss' fault of course), but also the seats are not well designed, quite narrow and uncomfortable to sleep on. Connection to Amsterdam is on European business class, i.e. narrow seat pitch, hard backrest and just a small snack to eat. Lounge in Zurich was incredibly crowded around 11am, I could not find a place to sit down and left again after having only a glass of water standing in the corner like many other travellers.
Trasa: Sao Paulo to Amsterdam via Zurich

Tresc_opinii: It has officially been my worst flying experience. I moved from Costa Rica to Berlin in the 21st of July, my 2 suitcases did not arrive at the airport. I spent hours trying to put a complain the same day. After a week I got back one suitcase, but he other one is still missing, it's about 3 months. Today is October 10th. I have tried to called them several times, there is no solution. I have written around 5 complains, no answer and no refund. I am moving from one country to the other, I really need my belongings. 15 days ago I received like a message from CLS express saying that they have found my suitcase and that they will bring it to my address. Wondering what happen? It never came. There is no way to contact them or the delivery agency. I was also told that visiting the airport will be helpless.
Trasa: San Jose to Berlin via Zurich

Tresc_opinii: Truly horrible first-class service from start to finish--from the ugly, low-cost lounges at JFK and Geneva Airports to the lack of car transportation & priority boarding to the way-below-average in-cabin service to the worst-ever customer service on the phone and by email. I will never fly Swiss again. My first-class seatback was broken (2A). They offered me a voucher for 50MB of free Wi-Fi on the flight (a $20 value), but the credit expired after watching just one TikTok video. The worst was the total absence of ground service, car transportation, priority boarding, first-class lounge with bathroom at JFK and Geneva Airport. Swiss is definitely going down.

Tytul_opinii: "never fly Lufthansa or Swiss Air again"
Tresc_opinii: I don't even know where to begin with the nightmare that is Swiss Air / Lufthansa. No one informed me when I booked wheelchair assistance for my mom at the time of booking our ticket, that she could not sit in the row with extra legroom and receive wheelchair assistance through the airport. The Swiss Air employees at LAX refused her wheelchair assistance, so my 82 year old mom who had back surgery earlier this year, had to walk all the way through LAX to our gate.  Swiss Air sent me 3 emails during our trip, changing our seats each time, due to "equipment changes." We purchased our tickets 3 months in advance, in order to ensure that we had one aisle and one window seat with extra legroom for each flight, due to her history of blood clots in the legs. And without any thought, they removed us from our seats and stuck us in middle seats with no legroom. I spent approximately 3+ hours on the phone, of which I was disconnected 5 times. Swiss Air told me they could not help me with my seats and that I would have to deal with Lufthansa. I called Lufthansa and they said they would NOT help me because I purchased the tickets on Swiss Air so I would have to deal with Swiss Air. A continuous loop of BS and unaccountability. No one would help us with our ever-changing seat assignments. We even asked if we could change flights for our return back to LAX, and they said the fare difference would be $1350 per ticket. The day before our return flight back to Los Angeles, we received yet another email stating that my mom had no seat on the flight, AT ALL. When I called, I was subjected to one rude Swiss Air rep after another, all saying "sorry for the inconvenience, but there is nothing they can do" and that we would have to wait until we got to the airport in Milan. Swiss Air said that extra legroom fees are non refundable and they would not be able to refund the money from the seats that we originally purchased and were REPEATEDLY STOLEN from us. So let me get this straight. We paid WAYYYY too much money in the first place to purchase our original tickets 3 months in advance on through Swiss Air's website, paying extra for each segment in order to have extra legroom. Then Swiss Air changes our seat assignments 3 times, each time to a middle seat with no extra legroom.  And to top it off, Swiss Air tells us we have to go through Lufthansa and Lufthansa tells us we HAVE to go through Swiss Air. I was so disgusted with both Swiss Air and Lufthansa  that we finally gave up and purchased one-way tickets home on Emirates, which was the airline we should have flown to begin with. I will never fly Lufthansa or Swiss Air again.

The first flight was 1 hour late, then they lost our baggage in Zurich. One bag arrived 5 days late the other never got to our destination, but was shipped back home to Denver. We never got reimbursed for more than $500 worth of clothes that we had to buy in order to continue our travels. All the forms and emails we filed and wrote led us to nowhere.

Tytul_opinii: "new low for a unjustified Premium price"
Tresc_opinii: Zurich to Narita. Unfortunately I got rebooked from ANA to LX because of flight cancellation. I avoid LH and LX on long distances because they offer much worse service than Asian carriers. So Swiss was always know to not be on par with ANA. But now they seem to have hit a new low. Flying premium economy with ANA gives you certain advantages. Lounge access, free choice of seats and a wide selection of on-board services. Swiss doesn't provide any of those. Their online a Check-in also didn't work. So my wife and I had to sit separately because we where only able to check in shortly before the flight. No assistance was offered. In flight their service is the worst. Rude CAs, cut Snack services and the Meals not available in Premium Economy. I understand covid has been hard on airlines. But the current state is new low for a unjustified Premium price.

The worst gluten free meal ever. They served me a piece of cheese and a dry rice cracker for breakfast. Looks like they combine all meals together, gluten free and lactose free. Everybody else got yogurt at least. Dinner was horrible, dry rice and chicken. Seats are not comfortable, our butts were hurting.

My flight had been booked using United miles but that should have made no difference. I tried about 6 times in 6 weeks to make my seat selection for this flight by phone. Each time I gave my credit card number to pay and the seat selected would show up for a couple days on both the Swiss Air and United websites and then disappear. My credit card was never billed. Then the final time my credit card was billed and I was assured everything was okay. When I got to the Geneva airport my seat was not available and I had to take another seat. Also on the phone I was assured that my luggage would be sent through to Dublin and that in Geneva I would be given a boarding pass for the LHR-DUB leg on Air Lingus. Neither of these happened. In LHR we had to technically leave the UK and enter again. Many times I could not reach a Swiss Air agent by phone and had to get a United agent to connect me! No way to run and airline.

Tytul_opinii: "cannot comply with your request for a compensation"
Tresc_opinii: Swiss Air response to a broken seat: "I understand the disappointment on board your flight. SWISS does offer goodwill, however, we have been subjected to numerous limitations. Hence, I regret that SWISS cannot comply with your request for a compensation."

San Francisco to Zurich. A flight attendant could've been less rude in telling me we were not supposed to plug into the charging station on the retractable TV stand prior to take-off. He came over and practically yanked out my USB phone charging cord with contempt. I could let that go as I'm sure he sees it all the time - not that I knew. But then halfway through the trip, I realized the padding on my seat was doing me no favors. My bum was sore and there was nothing much to do about it except sit on the pillow provided; the rest of the flight was full so I couldn't just move to a different seat. I didn't bother with any of the in flight entertainment but the food was forgettable. I suppose I have always associated the Swiss with high quality but that confidence has been shaken after this trip.

I was on Singapore Airlines ticket but code share with Swiss Intl Air Lines on a SWISS airline operated plane. Boarded the plane and my colleague on the other aisle beside me was served champagne by an air steward and I asked for the same but he said I have to wait for the steward on my side to serve me. Very inflexible. When I asked the steward on my side, he said they ran out without offering me any alternative. Felt like a sub par economy class service here. When my main meal was served , it came all in one plate all at once, again like an economy class meal. During breakfast , they ran out of cheese spread for my colleague and she had to take mine. Very disappointed with SWISS for their on board service.

Tytul_opinii: "the worst customer service I have ever experienced"
Tresc_opinii: They have the worst customer service I have ever experienced, and I am a frequent flyer. They changed the flight times and then gave me the option to change the booking dates, but said I needed to call. The airline said I was entitled to a full refund. They told me to wait and I would receive all the money back and could re-book. I told them that the terms and conditions stated I can't get a refund, but they assured me that there was a change in times so I would. I then only received 100CHF from the 2000CHF flights. They even admitted that I was provided the wrong information but said 'the operator has been disciplined, however we will not give you any more of your money back'. They ignored emails, letters and phone calls. Did not care. I spoke to friends and this seems to be a common occurrence with Swiss Arline's. I had wrong info given by Easyjet in the past and received a voucher instantly. This company is awful. if you book flights with them, just hope there isn't a change or any mistake in the booking because you will never recover money if they make a mistake with your booking. It is not worth the risk, use any other Airline aside from this one.

Tytul_opinii: "I am so shocked by this treatment"
Tresc_opinii: My flight got cancelled back in July 2022 and I never received a full refund, nor an email to let me know the flight was cancelled. I only received about 1/3 of the amount I paid. I have been calling and emailing Swiss Air for the past 3 months. Emails are useless no one answers. As for phone calls, I called the UK line (+44 345 601 0956) and was on the phone with an agent. He was extremely rude and didn’t want to bother with the issue saying I should go to “swiss.com”. When I wanted to double check that everything was in order and my case was sent to the investigation team and when I asked to repeat and make sure, he said and I quote “am I speaking to a child?”. I asked to be transferred to someone else on the phone but he didn’t. I am so shocked by this treatment and the people working in customer service should really know how to speak and be respectful!

Shocked by the lack of professionalism and rudeness of cabin crew. One of the female cabin crew was particularly poor. She failed to reset the video entertainment properly and when asked to do so again she asked if she was actually expected to walk through the aircraft to do it again. She was resentful and arrogant in the way she spoke to passengers.  There is also a problem with the dreadful design of the premium economy seats. There’s no foot rest and it’s a sliding shell seat which doesn’t actually work. Not worth the money. Economy looked like a nightmare. The food in premium was very good. Seemed to be the same as business just served on a single tray. Swiss is clearly a low cost carrier now but they need to upgrade their staff with new cabin crew who are up to the task.

I purchased 4 upgrades to business class from Paris via Zurich to Thessaloniki after the customer representative told me it's 330 CHF per person. In the end, I found out they charged double (8 x 330 CHF). Exactly the same amount for the small flight and one for the longer flight. They say they don't release any communication and there is nothing I could do. Never seen such a non caring airline. On top of that, our luggage was not transferred in Zurich and we arrived without it in Greece. Would not fly again with Swiss, there are plenty of alternatives luckily.

On last July 14th my wife and children (3yo and 5yo) flew from Vienna to Bordeaux with Austrian, booked with Swiss Airlines. Originally the flight was scheduled at 9:35 in the morning, but they were not able to onboard due to a booking issue on Swiss Air's side. I accompanied them to the booking counter, where they had to wait for about an hour before someone helped us. A new booking had to be issued, and flying was not possible until 15:00. The new flights had then both delays - and my family finally landed in Bordeaux at 00:30 on July 15th, whereas the arrival was originally planned at 14:05 the day before. There is a compensation for these kind of cases, named "EC261-2004". Therefore I reported the issue to Swiss Air on their website. I only got an answer 2 weeks later, stating that the problem was not Swiss Air's fault, but occurred because of air traffic controller regulation. But it DOES qualify as a situation covered by EC261-2004. The booking was changed at the last minute by the company AND the flights had delays. Therefore I responded asking for a better answer, but the lady keeps turning me down. I then decided to call the customer service directly as it should be easier to clarify things over the phone, right ? So. I called and had to wait for more than 1 hour 10 minutes, with the worst voicemail I've ever heard. It really sounds like they are trying to discourage people! So, after 1 hour 10 minutes I finally got to speak to a lady and explained the whole story. I was quite angry at this point, and she recognized that we should receive a compensation. She then told me she was not responsible for this (seriously?) and gave me another e-mail address which I should contact. I sent an e-mail to this other address, more than 2 weeks ago (on August 29th), and all I got so far was an automatic response. There was a link in this mail, that should redirect to the contact list of Lufthansa's support. Guess what happens when clicking on the link ? I get this lovely message : "You don't have permission to access this resource on the server." This has got really tiring at this point. I feel like I have to fight for something that Swiss Air is deliberately ignoring because they don't want to take responsibility. This is a very bad customer experience, and I would definitely recommend not flying with them, because it just shows how much they don't care about their customers, let alone their poor support staff which is completely under water.

I flew Swiss Air because they offered a good price for my return trip from Florence to Geneva and because of their good reputation. However, my flight was disappointing from start to finish. Beginning with their mobile app, I was not able to link my flight to it or even check in on their website, even though I had had no problems with these functions with other airlines just a week previously. Then I received an email the day before that my seat had been changed, though the email did not give a reason and there was no link to find out what my new seat was. I arrived at the Florence airport early because I couldn't check in online and it was then (only a few hours before) that I found out that my flight was delayed, first by 15 minutes, then by an hour and 15 minutes, with no explanation and no clear indication of the gate until after the original flight time. When I realized that I would miss my connecting flight in Zurich, I went to the Swiss Air clerk to ask what could be done and she told me that I had already been rescheduled for a new flight (for which I had not received an email). After asking more than once how I would board my new connecting flight without a correct boarding pass, she printed one for me. Our flight from Florence to Zurich finally left, 1.5 hours late. The only explanation given was that the previous Swiss Air plane had been delayed. After arriving in Zurich, most of the food shops were closed and I had to walk all the way to the other end of the airport for my next gate. The 10:35 pm flight was again delayed until 10:50 pm and we didn't actually take off until 11:15 pm. Once again, no explanations were given. And when we finally boarded, the clerk forced me to check my bag as being too large even though that had not been a problem on the previous flight, and even though I saw at least 2 other passengers with bags the same size as mine, who were not forced to check their bags. I had decided to limit my belongings to a carry-on bag and not check a bag so that I wouldn't need to wait at baggage claim. Because I was forced to do this, I was delayed and had to wait 30 minutes for my bus home. I did not arrive home until almost 1:00 am. I should have been home by around 10:15 pm. I hope never to fly Swiss Air again. It was a long series of disappointments.
Paris to Copenhagen via Zurich. My flight has been canceled. And I am still waiting my refund. It has been nearly 2 months and I want my money back. I don't recommend this company.

Zurich to London on September 2. Flying on SWISS is like taking a crowded bus, with perhaps even poorer customer service. I had reserved and paid CHF 30 for an emergency exit seat so as to have more legroom. However, as is nearly always the case with SWISS before a flight, I received an annoying email, brightly titled ‘Your seat had changed!’ saying that the airline had ‘done its utmost to assign me an appropriate seat’.  Despite having paid for an emergency exit seat, I was assigned a regular seat far back, from what I could tell. I called the online check-in service for assistance, but one would be hard pressed to find a more clueless agent. Terms such as ‘emergency exit row’, ‘aircraft type’ and ‘seating configuration’ were completely foreign to him. I tried to explain them to him, but was met with utter incomprehension. I then called the regular call centre number, but hung up after 20 minutes of being told my call would be answered ‘shortly’. I finally went in person to the city ticketing office, where they confirmed that ‘having done their utmost to assign me an appropriate seat’, SWISS had decided to assign the emergency exit row to business class. Even Edelweiss, Switzerland’s leisure airline, offers you a snack, but not SWISS that is ostensibly a full-service airline. Paying close to CHF 500 for a short-haul economy class flight still doesn’t entitle you to a bite to eat. The only saving grace was that we landed on time – quite a feat given that every single one of my SWISS flights over the last few months has been considerably delayed, regardless of the time of day.

Start with 1h&45 min delay before departure. No SWISS staff or any official representative to provide an explanations. When arrive to Zurich we lost our connection flight. On ground There was no reasonable support. We had to run and find and guess what we need to do by ourself. When we  found the SWISS transfer desk they treat us in a rude and way. All the alternative solution she offered were poor. We spend hours at the SWISS counter there but they didn't offer us any food or drink vouchers. Later we had to locate our baggage by ourself.  I will never fly with them again.
Trasa: Tel Aviv to Stuttgart via Zurich

Tresc_opinii: Berlin to Milano via Zürich. Almost missed my connecting flight due to a delay of the first flight. Even though I made it, my baggage never arrived. I will never ever book Swiss Air again! My suitcase got lost and even after filling out all the forms at the lost and found counter it did not arrive.

London City to Geneva. The worst airline I have ever experienced. Gross incompetence. I was due to fly with Swiss to Geneva. I was flying with 2 cats so expected them to care. They cancelled my flight whilst at the gate. No Swiss representative arrived for 20 minutes. The ground crew were outsourced and didn’t have a clue. Swiss had rebooked everyone on a flight to Zurich but failed to tell anyone. They then couldn’t find taxis for anyone and told people to “find their own way home” (against the law). When requesting compensation they claimed that an fault with the aircraft is an act of god and they cannot accept the refund. Awful, awful, awful. They lied and lied. Eventually got us on a flight to Zurich (which was delayed) so we missed the connecting flight. Got the train instead. They promised a call back from a manager the next day. 2 weeks later still waiting for a call.

Departure was delayed due to late incoming aircraft. Ground staff is rude and condescending, not willing to help. People have to hand in their carry-on luggage as Swiss only allows 1 item per passenger. One item might be your handbag or laptop bag. Flight was full, seat OK. They brag about their food and beverage service which sadly is very expensive. There is one small bottle of water free for each passenger. Staff is condescending and makes you feel you don't deserve better treatment because you just travel economy class, something I have witnessed on several Swiss flights and never so much on other airlines. The airline markets itself as premium but there is nothing premium about the experience on board. Will not hesitate to book other airlines if available.

My flights were operated by Helvetic Airways and I wanted to make sure I recorded my positive experience here. Both aircraft appeared new, clean and well-maintained. Services on both legs was water and a small chocolate bar. Both legs of my journey were delayed by storm activity, but handled really well. Many of us had tight connections in Zurich, and the crew made a point of reading out all gate numbers for those with short connections, as well as confirming that all connections would be honoured - a huge relief. Their app even confirmed to me that my bag had made the short connection. We landed in Florence during a storm where ground handling operations had been suspended. The captain came out to reassure everyone of our safety, made sure we got fed and watered, and invited children to visit the cockpit while we waited. Brilliant service, highly recommended.

Sylt to Zurich. Swiss cancelled my return flight from Sylt and I had to fly back a day later. They were kind enough to find me a hotel, but now expect me to accept compensation, less than the cost of the accommodation organised by them and less than EU law specifies. They keep telling me I am a valued frequent flyer, but this is not the impression I get from their customer service.

Swiss International Airlines is the absolute worst airline travel experience that I have had in 40+ years of air travel and I will permanently avoid them! August 12, 2022, on flight LX006 (ZRH to ORD) a 10-hour flight. We found the gate agent to be very rude when asked about checked luggage and this attitude seemed to be reflected in the dismissive manner in which the flight crew interacted with passengers. We were seated in the first row (row 22) just behind the bulkhead dividing business class. During the entire 10-hour flight the flight attendants made “appearances” less than 4 times. We left the gate at Zurich at 9:30 AM local time. Within 1 hour of takeoff to provide and initial beverage (only a small cup, would not leave a full soda); then 2.5 hours after takeoff back to serve “lunch” although they failed to serve my wife any meal. Assuming that they may have been serving “special” meals first, we patiently waited. After 30 minutes and in looking around seeing all other passengers had been served, I pressed the flight attendant “call button” and it remained on for no less than 45 minutes without any sort of response! I turned it off after this time as it was clear I was not important. It was 2 hoursS after our neighboring passengers had been served, two flight attendants showed up to clear away the meal trays which by now littered the cabin floors and other areas as passengers had gotten frustrated with having no outlet for their trays and garbage. Once the flight attendants returned, I asked, “When will we receive our meals?” and was told they didn’t have anything available, but they would check…he returned with two vegan meals. 4 hours into the flight, we were flying with the sun the entire flight, the flight attendants failed to advise the coach passengers to lower their window shades…as they advised all passengers in the business class cabin to do (I could hear as I was the first row in coach) …so, it was next to impossible to get any rest in the bright sunshine. 6 hours into the flight the flight attendant returned to finally clear our meal trays and offer another cup full of soda or water. 8 hours into the flight was the last time we experienced the flight attendant where they handed out a silver dollar sized “breakfast pizza” and a US Customs form (with no pen). We landed in Chicago and deplaned at 12:20 PM local time. Baggage claim was #23 at O’Hare, we arrived at baggage claim at 12:45 PM (after passing through US Customs), the first bag to come down the conveyor belt occurred at 1:15 PM and about three bags would come out, then there would be a 5-10 minute gap before the next set of 3-4 bags would come off, and this baggage flow continued for the next 2.5 hours! It was 3:45 PM before we retrieved our two bags and 40% of the passengers were still waiting at the time we had left baggage claim. This was completely unnecessary and unacceptable service.
Awful seating. People press down in front and you have no room. Uncomfortable, too. Bagel with Philadelphia for breakfast, or banana. For the money we paid? Nice staff though.

Had a LHR flight to Zurich then Zurich to Johannesburg 8/8/22. First leg, no snack or refreshments except for a bottle of water and then a small bar of chocolate at the end. Long haul flight, hot supper not interesting at all. Breakfast, cold, box with a mini stale croissant and a Yoghurt. Would think it's a kids' box. Entertainment nothing to write home about. Very disappointed with the airline really. However, staff was absolutely excellent on both legs.
Trasa: London Heathrow to Johannesburg via Zurich

Tresc_opinii: The flight itself was no frills, minimal seats, minimal food, no entertainment, and that was ok with me. But nothing prepared for for when they lost my luggage and left me hanging: it's been 4 days and  nobody is helping, and I don't know if my luggage is lost, stolen, on its way, or maybe it is already here. Called Swiss and they had me on hold for 25 minutes trying to get me a phone number I got myself online in 15 seconds, only to find out they don't handle lost luggage. Called again and got another number which again doesn't handle lost luggage. Called again and got an email which does not exist. To summarize: lost my luggage, zero service, nobody cares.
Trasa: Brussels to Tel Aviv via Zurich

Tytul_opinii: "going downhill in terms of service quality"
Tresc_opinii: I am a long time Swiss frequent flyer (Senator Status) and I have to say that Swiss is losing many of the aspects which made it my preferred airline. On my most recent trip, while the flight and in-flight service were fine, the situation with luggage was completely different. After paying $70 per piece of luggage (fair enough - I did book an economy light fare which does not include luggage allowance,) one of our suitcases got stuck in Zurich. I have placed Apple AirTags in all my luggage, because I simply do not trust the airlines. When I filed the claim, I was able to show the airport staff the exact location of the missing suitcase (based on the aforementioned AirTag) - however in their system they had no information and they refused to note down any details. It took 6 days before the luggage was finally delivered. In that time I bought a few items to be able to make it through the 6 days with my family of 5 - but the airline refuses to reimburse beyond 100 EUR - and refuses to refund the fee for the service not rendered. (I am not bitter about paying and it was transparently disclosed by the airline - I am bitter for paying for something which I did not receive.) Additionally, my efforts to contact customer service were ignored (daily email to the provided email address requesting updates), unanswered (literally nobody answered the phone number provided), and when I finally did get through to an agent they ended up hanging up on me. This is by far the worst experience I have had with Swiss - and despite this, I would still recommend them, but they are clearly going downhill in terms of service quality.
Trasa: New York to Palma de Mallorca via Zurich

Tytul_opinii: "suitcases were delivered to us 3 days later"
Tresc_opinii: Seated in the airplane, our child, who was by the window seat, exclaimed looking outside: "Look, our suitcases are there!". And indeed, our suitcases (which had colorful coverings which made them extremely recognizable) were on an airport trolley right by the airplane. And at that moment, the captain announced: "Cabin crew, arm the slides". Almost immediately we observed the workers on the airfield starting to cover the trolleys with our suitcases with some kind of fabric. I rushed to the flight attendant: "These are definitely our suitcases there right by the airplane. Would we not load them into the airplane?" The flight attendant promised to check with the captain and went to the cockpit at once. Returning back, the flight attendant  replied: "We are sorry. These are your suitcases, yes. We were given a time window to take off now and we don't have time to load your luggage into the airplane". Two other flight attendants  witnessed our situation of total helplessness. We merely had to observe our luggage staying behind and comforting our child the way we could. Throughout the flight, I kept asking myself these questions: *It is minus 22 at our destination, and our child's warm clothes are not coming with us. Do they think that treatment of the passengers is normal?  I am the organizer of my father's funeral in a few days upon arrival, and my clothes for the ceremony are left behind as well. Upon landing, there were around 15 families in total including us who did not receive their luggage, apparently all from the trolleys we observed being left behind. Of our 3 suitcases we registered for the flight, 2 were left behind. Each of these families had to spend additional 2 hours registering the lost baggage, most of them with children like us, already in the late hour. At some point, we observed the whole crew of the Swiss flight just passing by. They had their suitcases with them, so why should they at all care? Fast forward, after numerous phone calls to the airport to check the status of our luggage, the suitcases were delivered to us 3 days later at 2 a.m. in the night. That was the earliest time they could deliver our luggage, but I agreed on that and spent the sleepless night, because my father's funeral was next morning and I desperately needed the contents of my suitcase by then. As a conclusion from our side, we are not using Swiss these days for our summer vacation. Having passed through that experience of ours, we are confident in our decision to not use Swiss ever again at all.

I flew in late June from Milan to Geneva via Zurich on Swiss. I checked in my case to Geneva, my end point. The Milan departure was late (maybe 30 mins) to board; as was the Zurich flight was late to board - approx. 45 mins - and we then sat for close to 75 mins on the tarmac. A series of refuelling and other delays causing them to lose their allotted slots. Not great but these things do happen. After asking specifically for an isle seat, I ended up in the last row, middle seat, blank wall, no window. Jammed in while we sat on the tarmac (I'm 6 foot 3).  I arrived in Geneva to discover my case had not arrived. To arrive in Geneva and wait around aimlessly for almost an hour at the carousel is a trying experience for anyone - but particularly so in my case, as this occurred after a cumulative 36 hours of travel from Sydney. No Swiss rep to engage with. No one to help. Then the long queues at the lost baggage office. This caused huge inconvenience as I had all my hiking gear in my suitcase. I was over in Geneva / Chamonix only for less than 6 days – so the loss was both very costly and very inconvenient. The case finally arrived back in Sydney 2 weeks later. But no home delivery - I had to go to the airport to collect it. No contact from Swiss; no apology. But the real frustration is that Swiss has:  no reliable 'push updates' on its website regarding the status of your bag and its expected time of arrival (ETA) - nothing - simply a void of information after receiving a call a week earlier to say the bag had bene found. After that a complete vacuum of information. No accessible channels to complain though - no email, no landline / helpline, and nonsensical/unworkable website, and  no accessible channel to submit and arrange a refund. Quite clearly this is an airline that doesn't want to be contacted. Their website makes it impossible to lodge claims – it feels almost deliberate – or at worst a terrible user experience, and their chatbot doesn’t work.I am not a happy customer and Swiss Air has not covered themselves in glory by any stretch. So much for Swiss punctuality and efficiency.

Tytul_opinii: "luggage has been at the Zurich airport for 5 days"
Tresc_opinii: My luggage has been sitting at the Zurich airport for 5 days. I am medically compromised and need my additional medication in my luggage or I have to fly home. No one has responded to me despite 5 days of phone calls and emails. I have an air tracker in my bag and it hasn’t moved from the Zurich airport.

I have never been so jammed into a plane before. We were packed like sardines. I couldn’t even recline my seat because the knees of the passenger behind me were jammed into it, and prevented me from moving my seat back. There was very little leg room due to some structure under the seat in front of me. I’m short and couldn’t stretch out my legs. It was a night flight and I spent a very uncomfortable night for 10 hours on that plane. The flight was late and had to wait for a runway to take off also , 2 extra hours on that plane.

Tytul_opinii: "didn’t get our second piece of luggage"
Tresc_opinii: Been trying to reach them for 5 days and I’ve had no response or representatives telling me they can’t help me. We had a 1 hour delay for our flight from Tel Aviv to Switzerland. We purposefully took only carry on luggage so that we wouldn’t have to risk losing our luggage or being delayed on our vacation. By the time we got on the plane, there was no room for carry on luggage. instead of telling people to put their backpacks and smaller luggage under the seat, the overhead bins were full of small bags so we couldn’t put our carry on suitcase there. The stewardess pressured us to send one of our suitcases with the bigger luggage and promised us it will get to our destination. We get to the second plane from Switzerland to Palma de Mallorca and they take our second carry on and reassure us that there is nothing to worry about. By the time we got to PMI, our suitcases were nowhere to be found. We were at the airport for another 4 hours and left empty handed, and there was no way  to reach them! We got one piece of luggage at 12 o’clock at night and we still didn’t get our second piece of luggage. I’ve called 6 different numbers connected to Swiss airlines, one of them didn’t even work and the other two ended in representatives telling us with no hesitation: “this is not our problem have a nice day” and hung up.
Trasa: Tel Aviv to Palma de Mallorca via Zurich

Tresc_opinii: Worst airline ever! I have been trying to reach someone about my luggage, we returned from a flight yesterday and have not received our luggage. I HAD another flight today, in which to visit family, and had to cancel due to this inconvenience (not having my things and being told to purchase replacements for a “potential” reimbursement). We have received little to no help and I am aggravated. I tried calling and when I finally got through was hung up on, redirected to someone who redirects me again, or given a number to call that does not work. Please for the sake of your sanity and enjoyment of your trip think twice about Swiss, I don’t think it’s worth it.

Left with the first flight of the day, on time departure and landed on time. No issue at all, seating was a bit tight but comfortable for the 1.10hr flight. Check in experience was positive and staff was of good standard. Returned with same type of aircraft and the service was good as well (probably better than first leg) but both of good standard. Airplane was full both ways but cabin crew managed really well. I bought from the shop and no issue there. There are areas to improve but for the short flight, it was a positive experience. Will definitely use it again.

Tytul_opinii: "force to check in your carryon luggage"
Tresc_opinii: I’d rather fly with multiple stopovers than with Swiss ever again. I kept giving it a try, it’s been 4 times now and it’s been consistently terrible. Possibly worst airline and that includes budget airlines. Most understaffed; worst, rudest staff when it’s present to assist; they force to check in your carryon luggage even when there’s plenty of space on board; you can’t check in online to USA and have to wait endless lines (today was over 2 hours) at the airport (each airport I’ve flown through with Swiss - they have 2-3 staff at check in max). Even if you have only carryon you have to wait those lines and then they force you to check it. I never have issues with my carryon except for Swiss. The most stressful experience each time, save yourself some sanity. Never again, I really hate them.

Tytul_opinii: "business class cabin was such a throwback"
Tresc_opinii: I almost laughed when I saw the dimly lit business class cabin: It was such a throwback. There was zero privacy, and only small TV screens. I paid about £150 extra for a crown seat, with plenty of space, but I was perturbed to be able to look straight across the aisle at my neighbours. The flight leaves at 5:25am, and I missed the first meal service. I asked for a snack later and was served a not-very-nice chicken pastie. The "wine list" offered a choice of only two whites and two reds, with no mention of Champagne. I ordered a Swiss white, which was so nastily acidic, I couldn't drink it. (That's a first for me: I normally glug down whatever is on offer, even with Ryanair.) The breakfast was very poor. Service was OK, I suppose. I'd only fly Swiss long haul again if the price were very competitive. Oh, and the lounge at Zurich was closed. Oddly, the flight on to Heathrow was good, as were my two previous short-haul flights with Swiss.

Tytul_opinii: "bags didn't show up during our 10 days"
Tresc_opinii: We booked this one stop flight instead of a low cost airline and paid almost CHF 500 oneway, as we wanted to treat ourselves and thought that, should anything happen, service would be at the level of the price paid. Little did we know. First, because of a technical problem we departed Geneva almost 3 hours late and missed our connection in Athens. We then had to wait 7 hours to have seats on another flight and, when we arrived in Mykonos, our bags didn't follow despite confirming 3 times in Athens that it would be the case. But things got even worse: our bags didn't show up during our 10 days in Mykonos and we had to spend our holiday with only a few clothes and toiletries we bought there. We had no one to talk to and tried vain to contact them numerous times by phone and at the airport (the local agent). Our holiday ended up stressful and frustrating and was totally ruined. Now we are back home and one suitcase has still not been located three weeks later! To add insult to the injury, Swiss customer service (outsourced wherever in Africa and not deserving the name of "customer service") told us they won't pay an indemnity for the 7 hours delay as it was caused by a technical fault, and offered EUR 100 for the expenses, even though we spent our entire holiday without any personal effects! They have no longer anything "Premium" or "Swiss", despite their aspirations. Do yourself a favour and book Easy Jet: you will pay 4 times less and be treated better.

Tytul_opinii: "the contract is for them to get me to my destination"
Tresc_opinii: Our flight got delayed in Zurich and when we got to Athens we missed our connection to Santorini because we landed after the connecting flight departed. It was 11.45 pm and with small kids in the family we had to spend the entire night at the airport. This happened because any Swiss Air airline personnel we asked gladly passed the buck saying the next personnel we speak to will know how to help us. No one helped at the departure gate, the flight crew, at the arrival gate, and the counter at Athens was closed for the night. After spending around 7 hours once the counter opened we were able to get onto a flight. To those who say I am wrong about complaining because I should have read some unknown terms where the airlines is a point to point connection, let me ask them if they read their entire apple or microsoft contract or read terms for most of the products they buy. If I have purchased flights from an airline the contract is for them to get me to my destination and not leave me stranded. Sadly that's what Swiss Air did. There isn’t any way for me to get my money back or complain a different way I simply have my opinion and I intend on using it fully.

Tytul_opinii: "worst airline I have ever flown with"
Tresc_opinii: They cancelled our flight home last minute, sent us a rebooking confirmation, and we thought all would be well. When we showed up to the airport, we found out they attempted to book us on a full flight, we’re denied, and we were never informed. Then the service person at the desk told us we have to call Swiss for help while they chuckled and scoffed. Once we called I was on the phone for over an hour trying to find a flight that was anywhere close to the one I booked. They wanted to take us from a direct flight to a flight that would take over 14 hours to go from Spain to Germany. After being hung up on twice and placed on an eternal hold we were met with attitude and told we would not be compensated for the hotel, the extra charge for my parked car, and our pet sitter. I made sure to moderate my frustration as much as possible, since it wasn’t the fault of the person on the phone. This is by far the worst airline I have ever flown with, and I will never fly with them again. I suggest no one reading this does either.  Stay away from Swiss airlines.

Tytul_opinii: "not giving me my cancelled tickets refund"
Tresc_opinii: Worst everything, I was told to cancel and book a ticket again due to wrong name. And when I do so (within 24 hrs) they are not giving me my cancelled tickets refund.

Tytul_opinii: "Refused to refund even a fraction of the ticket"
Tresc_opinii: $5300 business class ticket BOS-ZUR-BKK. Forced to sit in coach because they were overbooked. Refused to refund even a fraction of the ticket price, not a penny. Literally fraudulent.

Appalling customer service. I arrived two hours before takeover to discover Swiss Air had five desks for all their flights. I was on a midday flight to London. After two hours queueing, and one protest visit to the front of the queue (to be told by an unhelpful desk clerk), I was told my flight had closed. A couple to my left were told the same and were incandescent. Desk clerks couldn’t care less. Told me to go to the sale stand for Swiss Air who offered me a flight in the evening. Had to book easyJet home, far better organised check in took 10 minutes. Swiss refused me a refund. I spent an hour waiting on the phone got through to a Swiss Air agent and the line went dead. The airline is run like Ryanair not a scheduled air carrier. Fly with anyone else and don’t waste your hard earned money with this sham of an organisation.

Remarkable flights. To start, I have only paid $130 euro promo fare for one way ticket to Montreal. For the price, I get a lot more what I could have imagined. CDG to Zurich, flight was on-time, boarding went smooth, plane was spotless. My only complain about swiss would be that as other regional airlines like Air France etc, they do not provide any complimentary coffee tea on their European routes, nevertheless, we were given a bottle of water and small bite-size swiss chocolate. Zurich to Montreal, on time flight, spotless plane, I get to choose a seat with extra legroom, free of charge. Bottle of water, then followed by little snack and soft drinks service then after an hour in the air, lunch was served, 2 choices and I went for Thai rice, the meal was amazing, warm bread roll, fresh salad and creamy caramel mousse with cheese and butter. An hour before landing, cheese snack with ice cream and choice of drink was offered which is more than what you expect on any transatlantic route. Over all, I am so impressed by Swiss and will defiantly fly with them again!

Company has really slipped as of late. Used to be that the slightly higher pricing was worth it for the higher than average service, however now it's clear the staff are stretched beyond thin (not their own fault), there are new convoluted classes and policies that are borderline predatory and seating refits to smaller, less comfortable seating for long haul routes (this last 12hr leg was a seat I would have expected on a max 3hr route). It seems likely this airline is in a death spiral as it's not better than a no frills, yet they're still charging as if nothing has changed. On my last trip, I was force downgraded due to overbooking, given "compensation" that was nowhere near the cost difference and then, in more words, told to shove it in follow up by customer service, as they're not subject to regulatory oversight for ch-non EU routes. At this point I'm actually hoping they go bankrupt so ZRH is forced to support alternative carriers.

Tytul_opinii: "Few years ago SWISS used to have much better meals"
Tresc_opinii: This company can overbook your flight, and you won't get a seat that you paid for. I booked a flight almost one month in advance, via "GotoGate" website. Paid a full price and got a confirmation. Than I arrived to luggage delivery in the airport two hours prior to my flight, I was informed that I don't have a seat as the flight is overbooked. Why me and not some other person? It's a really bad experience: I was on the "standby" list sitting in the airport and worrying, until the last moment not knowing if I'll get back home on time or be stuck in Zurich. They tried to look for volunteers to switch to another flight and get 400 eur compensation. I got lucky that someone didn't show up in the last moment, so I got a seat just at the last minute. Also, the quantity and quality of food went down. Few years ago SWISS used to have much better meals. Now you get few spoons of cold pasta, small cheese, small piece of ham, one bun and tiny cake. I remember the time it was twice the size.

Tokyo Narita to Johannesburg on Swiss via Zurich. I had originally booked to fly two weeks previously but had been informed that the flight had been cancelled a couple of weeks before departure. The rebooking process had been pretty stressful due to extremely long wait times when calling the airline's customer service center in Tokyo. I was on hold for at least 40 minutes. After rescheduling I noticed that the ticket was printed with my name in the wrong order which was partially my fault as I had booked the ticket on the Japanese site and in Japan they put names in the opposite order. I called up customer service again, was on hold again for 30 plus minutes again and spoke to a very unhelpful person. I was told that I would need to pay 3500 yen (about $30) to change this. The woman on the phone was rude and unhelpful. I was on the phone for an hour in total. This was not a free phone number so not only did I have to pay to change the ticket but also for a 2 long phone calls. The flight was scheduled to leave Narita at 11am and when I woke in the morning I had received a message saying the flight would be departing 40 minutes late. Check in was smooth and quick and the ground staff were efficient and polite. The plane was perhaps 60% full. Due to the closure of Russian airspace the plane flew east over Alaska which means the journey to Zurich was about 15 hours long. The seat was comfortable. Full complimentary drink service was offered with pretzel bites. The first meal was one of the better economy meals. I chose the Japanese chicken and rice, the rice was well cooked and not dry and the chicken was flavorsome. This was accompanied by cold soba noodles, a matcha dessert and roll and cheese. The second meal was pretty terrible, a veggie bake thing which resembled a split white sauce with some random veggies (one bite was enough). This was served with a carrot and lentil salad and some fresh fruit both were tasty. Snacks were available in the galley through out the flight. The flight attendants were friendly and polite. The entertainment system was easy to use and had an adequate selection. After a 4 hour hour layover in Zurich I took the fight to Johannesburg. Much the same experience. Friendly service and decent food. The main meal was rosti potatoes with chicken in a tasty sauce with a salad, caramel mousse and bread and cheese. Breakfast was small but fine, a croissant with jam, a piece of cheese and a yoghurt. Both flights were smooth, the food was decent, the staff were friendly, the cabin was clean and the entertainment system was adequate and easy to use.
Trasa: Tokyo Narita to Johannesburg via Zurich

Tytul_opinii: "Not an airline I will use again"
Tresc_opinii: I booked a Swiss air ticket. Flight was operated by Edelweiss Air. Swiss allows 2 checked bags on this trip AYT/ZRH/CUN. At check in in Antalya the agent stated only one bag allowed, I had to argue with him and supervisor told him 2 bags ok. When check in agent stated only one bag allowed he first said $ 50 each extra bag. Then changed it to 75 Euro. Suggested cash payment before credit card. Gave me a boarding pass only to ZRH, When I questioned about the ZRH/CUN boarding pass he lied and stated the boarding pass was valid for both legs. It was only the small receipt, not an entire boarding pass and I had to get a boarding pass for the ZRH/CUN in Zurich. The flight I booked for the ZRH/CUN leg was a direct flight (LX8024), instead it was changed to LX8026 with a stop in Havana Cuba. Food was awful. Not an airline I will use again

On Friday, May 20th, after a flight with United from SFO to LAX and then LAX to LHR, I was supposed to have a connecting flight from LRH to Nice through Zurich with Swiss. Unfortunately, the first flight was delayed and I haven't been able to catch my second flight. I had to go to the transfer desk (no one on the flight crew help me to find it) and after one hour of waiting the desk person told me that all flights to Nice were fully booked until Monday (it was Friday). So I had to ask him if I could fly to Marseille, and probably rent a car to go to Nice, but the first available flight was the next day. So I had to stay for the night at the Movenpick hotel, next to the airport. I paid for an Airbnb that I haven't been able to use and the Swiss airline refused to pay for it. At the Movenpick, the TV was not working and the internet was barely working. I haven't been able to get my luggage, so get a refreshment kit. Concerning the food coupon, no one told me that it was limited to 20 CHF, so I ended up paying an extra 45 CHF. On my way back from Nice to Zurich, I experienced a lot of issues with your airline: - Issue with the electronics on the plane, forcing the plane to come back to the gate in order to reboot the plane. -Last-minute changes forced to renew the flight documents.  Last-minute changes forced us to add fuel to the plane. When we landed in Zurich, the group staff was late, forcing us to wait on the plane. The result has been to miss my connexion plane, again. The entire experience before, during had after the flights has been awful, and I recommend people to not use this airline.

I hope people read this and choose wisely when selecting who to fly with. I mean it when I say this was the absolute worse experience we’ve ever had with an airline and people couldn’t have been less helpful if they tried. Due to a delay by the airline we missed our connecting flight. These things happen and I understand that sometimes flights don’t depart as planned. When we arrived in Zurich we were given a 20 Franken voucher to redeem at restaurants. The text messages directed us to a link from which we are were able to choose from over 20 restaurants at their airport. The fact that we had to wait over four hours was acceptable given we had now time to grab something to do. We went from restaurant to restaurant that told us there is a mistake and they don’t accept these vouchers and after the fifth attempt of trying to redeem our voucher, we finally got lucky. Unfortunately as it turns out the vouchers didn’t work and we had to line up for another 30 minutes at the check-in as unfortunately the information desk was not able to provide any help. Besides, the flight itself was average. It’s not worth saving $200.

Flight delayed in Nice. We landed 10 minutes before the next flight departs. I inform the stewardess and she does nothing. We ran and didn’t catch the flight. They give us boarding for next day and 20 Swiss francs for dinner, which is a joke, food here in Zurich is expensive. On top of that, we cannot find the luggage which has my medication on it! Service is a joke, I paid a lot to have such bad service and ridiculous organization

There was no email communication or phone call until this email response about my lost baggage from yesterday's flight. Even the Swiss Airlines bag tracker website I was told to check has no record the bag arrived. Once I figured out about my bag, and the Zurich Airport staff said: your bag is still in Amsterdam. Rubbish, expenses again and again.

LX1583 from VIE to ZRH. The flight had a delay of 30 minutes, but boarding was smooth. I really like SWISS' modern product on the A220. The seats are very comfortable for short-haul economy and the large overhead bins facilitate finding a place for your carry-on luggage and thus speed up boarding. The flight itself was short and uneventful. There was no meal service, but passengers could order small snacks. I had a very tasty pulled beef sandwich. Though it wasn't exactly cheap, the prices are comparable to what you would pay on the ground in a Swiss airport. Passengers were also distributed free water and chocolate. The crew were very friendly and efficient. All in all a great short flight.

Flight across via Lufthansa and Swiss was delayed so my partner and I (who were on separate flights) had to sprint to make connections. No offer of assistance in doing so at Frankfurt and Zurich airports. Legroom is minimal compared to Singapore and Thai. No variety on the food offered - one choice is all you get. On our flight back, Checking in night before, we discovered our VCE to ZUR flight leg was cancelled. No email notification, just relied on me checking my booking details on the website. Arranged a flight the next day, no offer of hotel accom. Went to VCE airport as well to ask for hotel accom, the check in desk told us to take it up with Swiss via email and keep receipts! Terrible. Get on our rearranged flight the next day, only to find the VIE to BKK leg was delayed so that we now miss connecting flight to Sydney. No one at Vienna airport seemed interested to help, they said 'sort it out at Bangkok'. Called Swiss via phone, and they said that they can't do anything. I pointed out to Austrian / Swiss that we can't leave Bangkok airport as we don't have the necessary Covid related pass. The Austrian Airlines person seemed completely indifferent. So now I'm wondering when I will actually get home to Sydney. And not one offer from Swiss (or their codeshare Austrian) for any compensation, even for a simple sandwich. Their customer service is completely apathetic at best, and abhorrent in their indifference at worst. Pay the extra money and go with another airline

Boarding Passes never arrives on the mobile app, so you have to queue for a printed boarding pass. Customer service is a mess. Usually you'll be dropped out the waiting line 3-4 times before you can talk to someone. Waiting 30-60 minutes. They even cancelled one ticket because service hotline and other business lines do not communicate well. They reimbursed me only less than 100 CHF despite I have paid a lot more despite they have mad an error. Online Interface is a mess for booking and nearly no process are digitally. In short the worst airline since corona. I did 10-15 short haul flights. I'm sure they'll be bankrupt soon - again.

Tytul_opinii: "business class was not worth the extra cost"
Tresc_opinii: All round awful experience. Booked business class due to the long 8 hour flight time. The business class was not worth the extra cost in terms of seat size or comfort. However worst of all is that this flight was the start of our honeymoon. Our first day of our honeymoon would coincide with my wife’s birthday and would be spent in Rome Italy. This Swiss flight was so badly managed that we were 90min delayed and we missed our connection from Zurich to Rome. Instead of spending a beautiful day in Rome, we had to divert through Frankfurt and only arrive at our accommodation in Rome by 4pm and half the day was gone. I will never fly with this airline again. To top it all off, their wifi service was advertised all over the cabin however there was zero wifi and no attempt to fix this. This meant we could not inform our hosts in Rome that our flight had been delayed and we were charged double for the two trips they had to make to the airport.

When checking in at OR Tambo my wife was told by the check-in staff that she did not have a seat and that the plane was full. Of course she had a ticket, booked 3 months earlier through Flight Center. Then instead of offering her a choice, they made an once-off offer to compensate her financially but said that if she refuses the offer she will go on standby and if after being on standby there still is no seat availability she will be stranded in Johannesburg without any assistance from the airline. This is absolutely unacceptable.  Needless to say, my wife was totally distraught and didn't know what to do. She messaged me and after at least 10 phone calls I managed to secure a seat for her on the plane.

I am a former Philippine citizen and enjoy visa free privileges for up to a one-year stay in the Philippines (other Canadians only get 30 days visa free stay). Proof of ex Philippine citizenship, like a passport needs to be shown. Upon check-in, I was told I would need a visa for a stay of 2 months in the Philippines. I argued that I've done this trip many times before and enjoyed up to a 1 year visa-free stay. I pulled up immigration information from the web, published by the Philippine Embassy in Paris. I showed old passport stamps of Philippine arrival wherein my date of arrival (and maximum date allowed to stay) are clearly indicated on the stamp (like I said, 1 year visa-free). But the check in staff were not convinced. I had to rebook an earlier return within the 30 day limit. I was angry but I thought I would be able to resolve the issue later. Several times that morning, I was told to remove myself from the vicinity of the check-in counter to allow them to serve other passengers. I was the only Business Class passenger in the counter as far as I knew, all the rest were lining up in the economy queue. The station manager  made me feel like a piece of dirt. Upon arrival in MNL, I was given the usual 1 year visa-free stay. I wrote Swiss Customer Service, described the whole debacle, scanned the passport arrival stamp with proof that I did not need a visa to stay up to a year, and asked them to reinstate my original return flight for June. Customer service agent for premium passengers just forwards my complaint to the NCE check in agents to once again stated that I was in the wrong (even with my 1 year visa free stamp on my passport). The customer service continued to say via email, that it was my responsibility to ensure I had the right visas and paperwork when travelling, and that Swiss was not liable for any lapses in my judgement.  To call Swiss reservation lines, you are on hold for about an hour, and if you get through, one in two calls will be disconnected. Swiss has an excellent onboard product and I've flown them many times on business and lately for holidays to Asia (in business class). But this last experience has left a very sour taste in my mouth.  After this last incident, I am decided to move my business elsewhere.
Trasa: Nice to Manila via Zurich / Tokyo

Tresc_opinii: A smooth experience actually Helvetica for Swiss into Zurich, then mainline to Lisbon. Despite the inferior ”Euro” style business configuration, flights were good. Easy transfer (separate bus for biz class) and friendly efficient service on both flights. Decent snack into Zurich and good lunch into Lisbon. No complaints. On time, good and friendly service and luggage delivery efficient in Lisbon.

I booked a flight from Manchester to San Francisco via Zurich and everything was good to go. I was in Norway, but got COVID there, even after recovery, was no longer allowed to enter the UK because I still tested positive. I called Swiss Air to switch my flight from Oslo to SFO since I paid extra to change my flights, and they happily did so for $65- no problem! Then I get a charge for $900, and I asked the rep why is there a $900 charge? He said I submitted a $900 bid to upgrade to business class, and I informed him I did not. He said I should email them to cancel it and it would be no problem. I emailed them to get that canceled, but it was chaos from then on. The airline said I was not allowed to receive a refund because I submitted that upgrade request, but I reminded them that I was the one to inform them they request was wrongly submitted and cancel that upgrade that I never submitted or received (I only received an economy seat) but they refused to refund it. Over the next two months, I had to argue with Swiss Air every day over the phone and email to cancel that $900 business class upgrade that I never submitted, but they refused to cancel and were continuously rude over it. I had to report them as fraud and my bank refunded me the $900.
Trasa: San Francisco to Manchester via Zurich

Tytul_opinii: "decent meal for such a short flight"
Tresc_opinii: Boarding started on time however then some problems started as the vast majority of passengers were carrying a lot of oversized luggage into the plane, quite some hand luggage had to be removed and put with luggage. Unfortunately this caused a delay of some 25 minutes. Good service, decent meal for such a short flight and friendly crew, the captain even did his welcome in front of the passengers.

Brussels to Zurich. For such a short flight the service was very good - a cold breakfast with ample choice of drinks - including Champagne and of course some Swiss cheese. Only feeling sorry that in Zurich a lot of planes are not parked at a gate and transfers were done by coach - FA were very friendly. Swiss is still one of the best in Europe in business.

I have flown more than 25 segments with Swiss in a 12 month period, but I have had enough. I always select my seats in advance, for which I am being charged £ 30. I don't mind, because that gives me the opportunity to select the seat that I want. On at least 5 out of the 25 flights I was told either at the check-in or at the gate and once on the plane itself that my seat has been changed 'for operational' reasons, only to see somebody else seated in the seat that I have selected and paid for. I complained in writing that they should not charge me £30 for a seat that I did not select and not want and asked for a refund. Swiss refused a refund, although very clearly, I was paying for a service which they did not provide. I was assigned a seat by Swiss but I was being charged for 'selecting' a seat. I have had enough. I have made my last flight on Swiss.

Tytul_opinii: "two small pieces of cottage cheese as lunch"
Tresc_opinii: Me and my wife boarded at Mumbai in business class. We had requested Asian Vegetarian meals. At lunch time, they gave us two small pieces of cottage cheese as lunch, nothing else. As I am a diabetic and need proper meals I asked for some bread and butter. Even that was not given. All these while other passengers were given meals.  On complaining to the airline after reaching Zurich, they offered me 50$ as travel voucher to be redeemed in our next flight booked with them. It was meagre and insulting. I rejected the offer. They did not even offer to streamline their procedure, not even vague promise if being more careful in future.. Their seats sucks. Once in sleeping position, your legs from knee downwards gets fully locked under the front seat and you cannot move your legs even an inch.

Plane arrived two hours late in Montreal, and then departed 2 hours late from Zurich. Arrived at destination my baggage missing (some others 20 people too). They brought my baggage 5 days later. After complaining, they will offer me 45 Euros as refund.

Tytul_opinii: "cabin crew were grumpy and unwilling to serve the passengers"
Tresc_opinii: I paid 20 Swiss Francs for seat reservation only to find out at the airport that I was transferred to a middle seat which was not my choice. The reasons given were: organisational but the 20 Francs for the reservation were not refunded. This is fraud in my view. The cabin crew were grumpy and unwilling to serve the passengers.

Traveling with Swiss has been the worst nightmare. I boarded and check my bag in Milan. Once I landed in Newark and I was waiting for my bag, I was informed the bag was delayed and I had to submit a claim. After submitting the claim and after 4 days had already passed they supposedly found my bag in Cyprus. I called Customer Services in multiple occasions, sometimes they answer and sometimes they don't -- left 2 voice messages and they never return my calls. The information they give me when I call contradicts what the tracing systems shows. This is just a tiresome situation. One week has passed since my international flight and I still do not have my bag with me. I called customer service to inquire about reimbursement for expenses incurred and they indicated since I was in my permanent address they will not cover the expenses. I will not be using their service in the future. It's unpleasant and terribly inconvenient in general.

There was a center cabin section empty, economy section in the rear was mostly full. I asked the attendant if after take off could I move to the unoccupied section for more room. She said that because that plane was not full, the section was closed to balance the plane. They just did not want to give the customers a more pleasant flight by letting them spread out. My suitcase was damaged. just try and get anywhere on getting some compensation or repair for it. I have to say that the attendants on the flight were particularly wonderful. I should have gotten their names.

I am a frequent traveller with miles and more, and was in group 5 for boarding and Despite being star alliance silver I get no priority boarding. It was a quiet flight with about fifty people so no need for group boarding. They didn't do this on the way out from Zurich yet they did it from Brussels. I just find Swiss app and website poor.

Unfortunately due to red list rules we couldn't fly anymore but were given the opportunity to rebook which is fine. Only problem is we could only do so via the phone line, which was constantly busy. When it came time to rebook we had to travel in a few days, I called numerous times to no avail, to the point I had to book a whole new ticket with another airline. I keep getting a generic email that they will not refund me the full fees, just a nominal amount. I have raised a formal complaint after sending at least 4 emails refusing the outcome .

This was my first time in LX long haul in economy class, and all in all it was a satisfying experience. A330 from Dubai to Zurich about 50% load factor, A321 from Zurich to Berlin less than 10%, therefore, plenty of space which made it tolerable, but would have certainly be different, i.e. cramped, if it were full. Catering on Swiss longhaul is above average for economy these days, a light snack after departure and breakfast before arrival, a cold one though, and also several drink rounds. Flight attendants professional, but somewhat reserved and robotic. Haven't used IFE as it was overnight, but from a brief glimpse, content was not overwhelming and the system quite old with a rather small screen. Easy transfer in Zurich. European flights have gone to Buy On Board, only a small bottle of water and a piece of chocolate for free. Prices for drinks and sandwiches seem insane, even for Swiss standards 11 CHF for a sandwich is an impertinence.
The service, food and overall flight was fantastic. I congratulate the airline a wonderful experience flying with you, I will definitely recommend Swiss.

I booked it with Lufthansa and ended up with SWISS. Too many redundant, repetitive checks in Mumbai throughout the process which were time consuming. They checked all the documents while checking in then they repeated checking the names with passports again before entering the gates and they made an X-ray and metal detector checks right after entering the gates which were already done by security. All a total waste of time and with only one boarding gate open and they don’t accept our personal masks.

Dublin to Zurich. I use Swiss since years, but only if I have no other choice (I'm Swiss living in Ireland). They have the worst website of all airlines I ever used. It ends up most of the time that I actually have to ring them and book and fight for not having to pay extra because I could not book online. It is hard for me to accept that in 2022 Swiss still do not have a proper working website. I can book a flight with all European airlines in 10 min, but it takes 30 min and 3-4 attempts with Swiss still I just give up again.

My hold luggage did not arrive at destination with my flight on 22 dec 2021 and was delivered at a temporary address on 29 dec, 7 days later than the flight. I was provided with no tracking number for the delivery and the DHL courier managing the delivery forced me indoor expecting my luggage for four days (dec 26,27,28,29). After complaining with Swiss, they offered me only a 50% refund of the cloths I had to buy, amounting to 65 euro, which is even less than the 85 euro (100USD) maximum refund I was entitled to according to their website. This is ridiculous given the exceptional inconvenience of not having the luggage plus being forced indoors and that the flight ticket cost 830 euro.

First of all, the purpose of my travel to Bangkok last month was due to the fact that a family member there had suffered a life-threatening illness which required of my immediate support (I'm a medical doctor) to help with certain medical related decisions. After I booked my flight online, I noticed that my name was misspelled. But the system was so badly developed that this simple mistake couldn't be easily corrected. I called several times to notify this. At first I was told that it's not possible at all, then after having been put on hold for many hours and finally, by calling different numbers someone assured me that the spelling of my name had finally been corrected. All this calling and waiting time added up to almost 10 hours in total. The day before my flight I noticed that I still didn't receive any e-ticket in my mailbox as I should have. When I called the airline and asked about this, a Swiss Air representative said she could not see my booking in the system at all. I was alarmed and decided to drive the 80 kms to Geneva airport, hoping to settle things. There, a representative who introduced herself as a supervisor, gave me a print-out and assured me that she had finally corrected and solved my problem. On the next day as my wife and I went to check in our luggage (about two hours before boarding time), the man behind the counter told me that he has no record of my booking in the system. The absurdity of the whole situation was unbelievable! After my wife pleaded with this man, he sent me to look for another colleague of his across the hall and told us that everything will have to be corrected "over there". When we got to the said counter, I was sent yet to another representative again. No one seemed to care or know what was going on. In short, the incompetency of these people was just unbelievable!
