My wife and I have flown with many airlines in our life time (some of them from the third-world countries) and we had much better experiences than this.

Traveling with covid restrictions can be a nightmare, granted if it’s absolutely necessary to travel to see family then it is important to take advantage of this situation. I test myself quite frequently because I am a caregiver but my final test result did not come in time for my flight. I was greeted by 2 unfriendly desk associates, showed them my documents and asked for help. I eventually spoke with someone and Wow the incredible customer service provided for me led to to write this. He told me to come back tomorrow morning to rebook for another flight and to not worry. Of course I worried! But when I arrived the next morning I was again greeted by a very rude attendant but I saw the same staff at the service desk and as he was quickly and calmly smoothing over other customer issues he helped me rebook my flight. Very polite, very professional, very kind, and quick to solve problems! Amazing! 9/10 because of the incredibly rude service before getting to the person who actually solved the issues at hand.
Trasa: Los Angeles to Lisbon via Zurich

Tresc_opinii: The worst airline ever. There is no monitors for the kids and very small narrow airplane. Everything is for money (food, drink). They mentioned food and beverage included but when you board they ask you its for extra money. So flying for 4 hours and they don't give you anything and the flight is not cheap compared to others. Also they declined my boarding on my way back asking for transit visa while the embassy confirmed no transit visa needed. They just made me lose my ticket and time and they were very rude at Cairo airport. I'll never travel with them again.

Awesome flights. The European flights are no frills, but the transatlantic flights are top notch: good food, open bar during the whole flight, friendly attendants, good IFE. SWISS is my go-to airline for transatlantic travel.
Trasa: New York to Krakow via Zurich

Tresc_opinii: No refund for seat purchases when flights are cancelled? This is wrong on every principle. Management should be ashamed. You cannot change your own flight on many flights - they ask you call to optimize penalties or ensure they profit maximize on price differences. Every time you call you get a different number - each person need to check with back office - on everything. Anyway - well done Swiss Air. You are now my airline of last resort.

Absolutely fantastic trip, crew were very friendly and helpful, the seat was extremely comfortable, IFE was working well, recline was great as well. The meals were the best I have  had on a flight, and the SWISS chocolate the crew handed out was fantastic.  I recommend everyone to fly SWISS, especially long haul. Tickets were cheapest for the route as well.

In Tel Aviv there is no Business lounge for Swissair. Returning. The ground staff had no capability of assisting passengers in showing PCR tests. In fact they were rude in the handling of this matter. There was no facility for business class in boarding. The plane was not equipped with business class seating. Couples were not seated next to one another. The seats were normal economy class with economy spacing apart for the center seat of three being vacant. There was no entertainment provision, only the small economy television used for announcements. The food was disgusting. The attendants were very apologetic and did their best under the circumstances. They recommended that we write to customer feedback services, which I did. Your "consultant" in Customer Feedback Services talks of the pleasure to welcome us on future flights. or wishes us "better luck next time"

We have bought a Lufthansa ticket from Hong Kong International Airport (HKG) to Manchester UK (MAN), and transit at Zurich International Airport (ZUR), both flights (LX139 and LX 390) are by Swiss Air. When we have taken the flight LX139 from HKG to ZUR. We haven't received any cancelled notice when we have departed in Hong Kong, until we were landing in ZUR for transit to MAN, we have looked on the transit board, then we known that our flight to MAN, LX 390 flight from ZUR to MAN has been cancelled without any further notice of Swiss Air. There have had no one at the Transit desk of Swiss Air. Until around 9am 21 Dec 2020, someone was at the Transit Desk of Swiss Air and we have queued up, until our turn and we have been told that our flight has been cancelled, due to Swiss government has been banned all UK flights to Switzerland because of COVID-19, and it have had no current reschedule time. Then we would like to pass the border to go to Switzerland and book a hotel room, but because COVID-19, I could not pass, because I'm holding Hong Kong SAR passport, and my husband couldn't leave me alone. And we told that all to Swiss Air. On the first day, Swiss Air still has provided us coupons for meals and drinks, sleeping area. From the 2nd day, my husband also couldn't pass the border, because Swiss Government did not allow UK passport holder to go into Switzerland. However, they have stopped to provide us food, drinks coupons and sleeping area, no compensations until we have flights to leave ZUR due to the reason that they have only recommended us to go back to Hong Kong, because they think we bought return tickets, and we have refused. Because the thing is, our final destination was Manchester UK, and we just only bought one way ticket. Swiss Air stopped providing us everything, but we just only can stay in the transit area. Luckily, we met some people they gave us their food coupons to us. Swiss Air had provided a flight from ZUR to Turkey, then transit to MAN, but, the earliest flight was on 27th Dec 2020. We still have had no choice to stay there, and keep asking Swiss Air if there have any flights. In the afternoon, they told us, they will have flight to LHR (London Heathrow Airport) on 24 Dec 2020 morning, they didn't told us other flights. At that moment, our mental and physical status were collapsed, so we agreed. Finally, we have made it to London Heathrow. However, one of our luggages was lost and we reported to the airline desk immediately. But there has only to fill the form on a computer, we have had no choice except to submit, and we did it. When we arrived Manchester, we emailed to Swiss Air that we would like to claim the train tickets and the extra fee in ZUR and the luggage delayed. But they replied only claim 40 EUROS, we absolutely cannot accept that offer. Until 29th Dec we got our luggage back, but it's damaged already. Swiss Air haven't taken the full responsibility.
Trasa: Hong Kong to Manchester via Zurich

Tytul_opinii: "quality of the service and politeness of the staff is nowhere near fine"
Tresc_opinii: Very rude crew. They attacked me almost the whole flight due to the mask-wearing. Almost every minute a crew member was coming to me saying that the mask is not properly worn. When tried to explain that I can't drink with the mask, they said that I can't drink for so long. By which right do they decide on how long I drink or how I wear the mask?! The overall impression is like spending time in prison with preoccupied wardens. The funniest thing is when I've left the plane in Moscow, almost no one around was in a mask. Crazy kindergarten in the plane, never again! And no food provided. The quality of the service and politeness of the staff is nowhere near fine. Only adepts of the disinfection church may enjoy this!

Tytul_opinii: "a day trying to contact customer service"
Tresc_opinii: On 19.07.2021 tried to buy Prague-Zurich ticket. Got to payment, Visa confirmation message, after this the screen became blank and there was nothing I could do. Checking my CC account - the payment was there. I spent a day trying to contact customer service, without success. Filled about 3 inquiry/complaint forms - no replay. After this I resolved to buy the same ticket through a booking company and it was a snap. Anyway it cost me a day of anxiety, irritation etc. As I am obliged to use Swiss due to luck of alternatives and in about 30% of cases I had problems with payments, web page problems and lamentable customer service. Have been flying swiss for about 35 years.

My wife and I flew from Los Angeles to Malaga Spain via Zurich. The good: the flights were pretty much on time. The bad: We paid extra to select premium seats. Did not make a difference as we got moved around sometimes not even sitting together. This would have only gotten me to remove one star except to enter Switzerland and Spain we needed to get Covid Healthforms with Q-codes. These forms needed seat numbers. As Swiss Air was playing musical chairs with our seating assignments they invalidated all our healthforms. This forced us to run around the day of the flights to edit Swiss and Spainish online forms and get new Q-codes issued. As our AirBnB did not have a printer I was running up and down the street trying to get a merchant to print out the new forms.
Trasa: Los Angeles to Malaga Spain via Zurich

Tresc_opinii: I flew from Moscow to Los Angeles on September 9 from Domodedovo airport. Since the work with clients at this airport is awful and no one explained to me where the exit to international lines is, I could not immediately find my gate and missed the plane. My suitcase flew to Zurich, where I had a change plan. After a long time figuring out how to rebook my ticket and return my luggage, I was helped to solve all these issues quickly and easily. I am very grateful to the manager for this help, which relieved stress immediately. Please note his competence and willingness to solve the client's problem politely and quickly.
Trasa: Moscow to Los Angeles via Zurich

Tresc_opinii: My luggage was lost on Sunday, today is Tuesday and yet not even a phone call! The airline has just being careless of my belongs or of any feedback regarding my personal items!

I decided to pay a bit extra and to try Swiss this time (Air Canada and Air Transat were $40 cheaper than Swiss and direct). At check in counter, agent was super friendly and checked my luggage without any extra charge to make my travel and transit at Zurich a bit more easier. Boarding and departure was on time. There was no "Welcome on board" greeting and smile but thats ok. Plane was clean except under the IFE tv screen, there was this thick layer of dust which I ended up wiping out. Right after the take off, crew gave out little snack of olive crackers and a whole can of soda, I asked for diet sprite and i was told straight up that only coke zero is available, still ok. Within an hour of take off, dinner was served, main portion was really small (two thin layers of beef and carrots and mashed potatoes), ample amount of salad, small dessert and two rounds of bread roll and drinks. Coffee or tea was served after dinner and then crew just disappeared. One particular crew member seems like she was forced to do this job, her attitude was very up-tight (take it or leave it), rest of the crew also seems like not really interested in doing their job. I was surprised when breakfast was served, it was just a muffin and a coffee, didn't expect that from swiss. Anyhow not a really impressive airline as I imagined (Air France and KLM are my only European airline choice from now on and lets not compare Swiss with Qatar Airways).

Tytul_opinii: "the way they handled my delayed baggage situation was absolute trash"
Tresc_opinii: EWR-ZRH-KBP. Staff in Newark were friendly. Boarding in Newark was on time, however departure was delayed because some cargo from the inbound flight spilled on the tarmac and needed to be cleaned before the flight could depart. Really? Why not send the flight out on time and clean up the mess after, so people can make their connecting flight? Crew on board was lovely and food was good. Arrived to Zurich 40 minutes late, this left me with 20 minutes to make it to the flight to Kyiv. Luckily, the flight to Kyiv was delayed 20 minutes, so this gave me 40 minutes total to transfer. I felt relieved and was sure all was well. Boy, was I wrong! In Kyiv I received an SMS that my luggage was left in Zurich! How is it that I was able to make it to my connecting flight, but my luggage was not? Zurich is not even that big of an airport. The bag was put on the flight to Kyiv the next day, and I was told they'd set up a delivery for me. Another day passes and no word of my luggage being delivered to me. I contacted Swiss customer service in Ukraine, and was told that it is not their responsibility. So you mean to tell me, I fly with your airline but the luggage that you transported for me is not your responsibility? I finally had enough and went to Kyiv airport myself to get my luggage. While the service on the ground and in the air were excellent, the way they handled my delayed baggage situation was absolute trash. I highly do not recommend Swiss to anyone.

Tytul_opinii: "This airline has the worst customer service I have encountered in a long time"
Tresc_opinii: This review concerns post-flight customer service. I flew with Swiss Air on Aug 4 from Tel Aviv to San Francisco via Zurich. Since I was dreading the possibility of sitting in a center seat flanked by two strangers during the COVID pandemic, I purchased reserved seating to ensure an aisle seat on both flights. The reservation, for which I paid 70 US dollars, was made already in May. Shortly before the flight Swiss sent me an email informing me that they changed my seat assignment. They did not disclose the position of the reassigned seat, but wrote that they have done their “utmost to assign an adequate seat”. When I boarded the plane, I discovered that they had placed me in a center seat, flanked by two strangers who did not keep their masks on – exactly the scenario I was trying to avoid. On the official SWISS airlines website I see the following: Might SWISS change the seat I reserve in advance, later on? If SWISS has to change your seat reservation, e.g. due to a short-notice change to the aircraft type used, SWISS will do its best to automatically reserve you a new seat in the seat category you have booked. If it is not possible to reserve an equal seat for you, you may apply to receive a Refund of the charge online. Upon arriving to my destination, I filed a request for a refund. I was answered 11 days later by a customer feedback consultant, she flatly refused my claim. When I politely pointed to her that the official website states that I am entitled to a refund she gave this rude answer: “SWISS has responded adequately in your case. I therefore trust in your understanding that this message reflects our final position and that this file is now considered closed.” I was shocked by her response, and asked her for contact information for her supervisor, which she completely ignored. I then tried calling the US customer service phone number. I tried twice, but gave up after waiting for 60 minutes each time. This airline has the worst customer service I have encountered in a long time.

These are times of great stress and it is easy for travellers to make mistakes when booking. A good airline tries to make allowances for this, exercising their discretion to be generous. Swiss International is NOT such an airline. I originally booked a light economy ticket leaving on 5/8/21 and needed to change my dates. I couldn't get through on the internet and tried to do so via phone. The person I spoke to on the phone gave me incorrect information. They said the money had not yet been taken for the first ticket, so I could just cancel it and should buy a new ticket. I thought that what they said was correct. I later found that the money for the first ticket had been taken, that I was given the wrong information. That person even suggested I keep both tickets in case the first flights were cancelled. Eventually, just before I flew, I panicked and just asked to have the taxes refunded, not the whole ticket. When I tried to have the issue reconsidered, I was told that no refund would be forthcoming. I am very disappointed in Swiss International and hope that I can use my usual airline for travel to Switzerland, Easyjet, for all future trips. I would advise others to keep away from this airline.

Tytul_opinii: "none of my emails are being answered"
Tresc_opinii: SWISS Airlines cancelled my flight due to Covid and has refused to issue me a voucher or to pay me back. I can’t get through to anyone when I try and call and none of my emails are being answered. They are stealing from customers - don’t use!

I booked the very first row in business, the throne seat on the left. The seat is good, although very narrow for Business Class, but very private. The airplane has been retrofitted to the new design, so it looked very nice. I liked the design of the small business cabin in front of the galley, but the when but put into flat-bed, the seat was more like a coffin. The pillows are small, and you do not get a comforter or a seat topper like on most other airlines. The service was distant, and the food just OK (I used to work in my younger years as a Swissair Flight Attendant, so I know what to expect and this was a huge let-down). Swissair was proud of having a multilingual crew, but now is was reduced to 2 languages. The crew was not trained in wine-pairing, and had no idea of food allergies!

Still top notch service: that is post takeoff drinks, surprisingly good meal with drinks, after meal drinks, can always pop back to the galley for a drink, and nice prelanding snack with 2 drink runs. Friendly FAs, good choice of movies, great service.

I like to spoil myself and the family a couple of times a year, selecting Swiss Business Class. This flight was just myself travelling CPH/ZRH/FLR/ZRH/CPH in Business Class. The service onboard has gone down hill, now there is only one cabin member serving Business Class. Furthermore, the procedures have changed now their complete every passenger with meal, drinks, top up etc before moving down the cabin. This means that the last rows are lucky to even get served on a short route. Final leg I had 15 minutes before arrival. I noticed the seat pockets in front of me had not been cleaned but rubbish had been left from the previous passengers. But anyway, here is the absolute shocking experience happened upon arrival. My bag (and the bag of several others) did not arrive. Our flight was over 2 hrs delayed and all onward connections were lost. When I found out that my bag was not onboard, I went to the handling agent (Aviator CPH) desk - empty. No bell to ring, neighbouring desk also empty. So, I had to leave the Airport with no report. Since then I have tried to phone Aviators - no reply. Emailed Swiss in ZRH, no reply. Wrote to the on FB - got a reply to say please fill out this form. However the system says unable to complete this form if you boarded on a self service airport. I didn't self service, I was checked in at the Business Class desk. I give up now, I consider the bag lost - I donate it to CPH Airport. Enjoy. I for one will never fly Swiss again, all these nice words about service are easy but in real life I have a very bad experience. Sad and Bad.

Excellent service by staff on the ground and in the air, very friendly and efficient service on board, excellent safety record and exemplary cleanliness of aircraft. Very modern brand new B777 aircraft.
It is been more than 1 year since my flight got cancelled and I am still waiting for the company to process my refund. 1 year is more than enough time to manage it. I am very disappointed.
Trasa: Barcelona to Sydney via Zurich, Singapore

Tytul_opinii: "responsibility to make sure all documents are valid"
Tresc_opinii: New York to Istanbul with SWISS and connecting to Pegasus Airlines to Istanbul. I prepared all documents needed to travel prior my flight and when checking in NY JFK I was told that all documents are correct (pcr test) and the dates were valid, as soon as I get to Zurich to catch the Pegasus Airlines  flight to Istanbul I am surprised by the agent notifying me and my friend traveling with me that our PCR tests dates are invalid and that we will miss the original booked flight and unfortunately we did miss the flight and were told we have an option to be booked back to NY which was totally unprofessional and unacceptable. So in order for us to resolve our situation on our own with absolutely horrible assistance from Swiss to find a reasonable solution we had to pay $165 each for a PCR test done in Zurich which results arrive after 5 hours and  we had to book separate tickets to Istanbul $400 by Turkish airlines which happened to be the only flight available that day in order for us to arrive on time for our booked medical operation in Istanbul. So overall the worst experience for me in an airline and unreasonable judgment from Swiss airlines for PCR testing dates which is impossible to get prior the flight, note in US testing centers have a 2-3 business day time frame to get results and our flight was on Sunday (Saturday &sunday are weekends). I contacted the customer service and asked them that we would like as a courtesy for this experience to get a reimbursement for the additional expenses, and their response was it’s the traveler responsibility to make sure all documents are valid, even though they let us travel from JFK to Zurich and they have the final destination and could have told us that our PCR won’t be valid when i get to zurich. MY ADVICE don’t ever travel with this cheap airline. Thank you

Atrocious customer service. Cancelled my flight booked for 29 May 2021, now lying about refunding. No point cancelling flight if you don’t then want to refund people back when you fail to provide the service.

Plane was quiet and as such I managed to peg a "throne" seat without having to pay extra to book it in advance, there was one still available at check in. The seat does afford extra privacy but the whole cabin was nice. Service was outstanding, all the staff clearly wanted us all to have a good experience. I found the amenity kit excellent because I liked the little Victorinox tin that the products were presented in. Food was delicious. got a good sleep on the trip over Atlantic, I have read some people suggesting the bed is firm, I thought it was great. I cannot think of a Business Class experience I liked more than this... I highly recommend Swiss Intl Airlines and am looking forward to my flight to Tokyo in July!

I have booked the trip in July 2020. However the flights were cancelled due to lockdown and I was provided with option to re-book the flight ticket within Jan 2021. I decided to book it now and I have tried to contact them online and they used to reply only after 12 hours with huge price differences. So I called them to re-book. I was told that it would cost 1600 DKK extra. (Which is 50% extra to my previous payment). I checked their website and the same dates and the prices listed in the website are less than the price I have paid already. I asked them why they are charging extra than the price listed for the dates in their own website. They have me 3 different answers in 2 minutes time. First they told me that I have booked in tariff S last time so I have to re-book in the same tariff even though there are cheaper tariffs available. I was stunned with that answer. Then she recalculated it and told that their "goodwill" rebook policy allowed her to charge me the lowest tariff available and I need to pay only 1200 DKK. I said they charge me whatever they want just because I didn't have other option so they are scamming me. She got furious and told me to go with cancellation and book again in the website instead. She knew that I can't do that so she literally blackmailed me. At last I was forced to pay 1000 DKK extra just for rebooking in total which cost way more than the live price in their own website.

Due to Covid, I had to change my may-2020 flight. In a call with customer service before my flight, i was guaranteed a no change fees and a 50EUR discount arrangement if booked again before 31 Dec 2020. Fast forward today, customer service denies this past arrangement and wants to charge me more for the same flight in May 2021, while the price on their website is clearly lower than what I paid. When requesting an explanation or a commercial gesture, given the price gap, I got hanged up. I felt insulted and cheated. And will try to avoid swiss as much as possible from now on. Even EasyJet's service line was friendlier and more helpful, I couldn't believe it.

Tytul_opinii: "they charged me $240 CAD in "customer call" fees"
Tresc_opinii: Swiss Air cancelled my return flight on two occasions due to the Covid19 pandemic (understandable). I had to call twice to re-book a return flight since everything they would suggest by default required to spend a night in another city, dangerously increasing COVID19 exposure and incurring additional fees with added transportation, hotel stay, food, etc. What is outrageous, is that to rebook another return flight (on two occasions, of course), they charged me $240 CAD in "customer call" fees. So in addition to cancelling my flight twice and having to waste hours on the phone to find a solution, I have to pay an absurdly large amount of money to fix the difficult situation they put me in. Just to clarify, these are not re-booking fees. They are strictly phone call fees. Please keep that in mind next time you're considering traveling with Swiss Intl Airlines.

One of the best flights I have had within Europe, despite coronavirus restrictions. The service, by a chap called Rici, was outstanding. The Champagne (Duval Leroy) was excellent. The meal was well-presented, although necessarily minimalist. The aircraft felt clean and new, though I checked and it's 2016. I usually reckon that it's not worth paying extra for business class within Europe, but this was money well spent.

Disastrous because one pays over 1000 euros for a flight (March) which is cancelled due to Covid19 and then they do not reimburse. They ignore! One would have thought one could trust a Swiss airline but no. We are at the end of August and they simply write "please be patient". Avoid this airline. At your peril and risk! We chose Swiss Air specifically because we thought they were reliable. This was a big mistake.

Passengers not wearing the mask or not covering their noses. I kindly asked the crew to remind passengers and they told me that I could personally remind them (flight number LX1254 - Zurich to Stockholm). I asked one passenger and he ignored me. I told the crew again and the two crew members on the flight just told him. I have evidence that they were at least near me 5 people covering only their mouths and the crew did not say anything. This is a pandemic and it is important to use masks in close spaces as in plane. The correct use of masks on planes is mandatory as well as to fasten your seat belt during take off and landing. The crew on this flight did not do their job.

Worst experience ever with Swiss International Airlines on a completely full A321. Captain decided pre-departure to offload 90 passenger bags incl. checked in hand luggage to reduce weight but he did not inform the passengers - neither pre-departure in Brindisi nor after arrival in Zurich. Passenger had to find out themselves at the baggage reclaim belt when there bags were not delivered. Inflight catering is almost gone as well due to cost cutting reasons. A horrible experience overall from a customer journey perspective.

Tytul_opinii: "impressed at the handling of this matter"
Tresc_opinii: Due to the Covid-19 outbreak in March, Hong Kong government has made all passengers (residents and non-residents) from any foreign countries to succumb to a 14-day compulsory quarantine upon entry (in my case, return). For this reason, I had decided to cancel the trip. It was quite easy and pleasant to contact Swiss air in Hong Kong, they were very helpful and offered full refund of my business class ticket (bought directly on their website). It is understandable that most airlines will need quite a long time to process all their refund requests, as the pandemic situation is really one of the worst in recent years! my refund finally came in the beginning of July, which was reflected in my credit card statement. I am really quite impressed at the handling of this matter, and have confidence to fly with them in future when it's safe again to travel, likely from middle of 2021.
Trasa: Hong Kong to Vienna via Zurich

Tresc_opinii: Connecting flight from Edelweiss to Swiss in ZRH. Brand new A220. I moved with my entire family to Spain so we had a ton of rather heavy carry-on baggage. The FA´s were super nice and tried hard to accommodate everything, Actually, I had to step in to push the stuff into the overhead bins to help the FA´s with that heavy stuff and told them just to check some of the bags. Then the Captain asked my kids to explore the cockpit like in the good old days of flying. We took some amazing photos of my kids in the captain seat. Needless to say how happy and proud we all were. Flight itself uneventful, but the kids got some gifts too from the crew. Nicest crew I've ever experienced. Would fly Swiss again anytime.

SWISS was pretty average, with a very comfortable but slightly dated cabin. The entertainment system was pretty limited, but the food was good and plentiful. I didn't really like the need for a ground stop at DAR given how out of the way it is, making for a short evening leg followed by a long overnight leg. Facilities at NBO are terrible and inadequate, with a chaotic boarding process. ZRH, on the other hand, is a very nice airport. SWISS wouldn't be my first choice, but it was perfectly adequate.
Trasa: Nairobi to Zurich via Dar es Salaam

Tytul_opinii: "all they refunded was the airport tax"
Tresc_opinii: I cancelled my 26 February Air Malta / SWISS flights to Geneva at the beginning of February. The airline policy says refunds will be given in 4-6 weeks. After months of trying to contact the customer support and getting nowhere I finally received an email 5 months later stating my refund is on its way, to my disappointment I was refunded less than a third of what the flights actually cost me, all they refunded was the airport tax. I tried getting in touch with the customer support once again and unsurprisingly could not get through to anyone. Swiss Air have terrible customer service I will never fly with them again.

Tytul_opinii: "Swiss are below any standard from my experience"
Tresc_opinii: My flight from ZRH to GWT was cancelled due to COVID19. Most horrible customer service ever. Impossible to reach any agent. Still waiting for an answer and refund after several months, whereas all other airlines have already refunded my cancelled trips. Swiss are below any standard from my experience.

After my first sector Cathay Dragon flight from DaNang to Hong Kong was cancelled, they apparently made a mistake and closed my other flights. As a result I couldn't take my flight from Hong Kong to Nice via Zürich, though it was confirmed on my side. I spent 4 hours on the phone at Hong Kong Airport with Expedia, with whom I booked the flight, and they were trying to understand why they had closed my flight. I had to fly the next day back home with Aeroflot since Expedia / Swiss didn't manage to figure out the problem in 4 hours on the phone.I wrote Swiss an email on March 10th to complain, but I haven't heard back from them after more than 3 months. I will never fly with that company ever gain.
Trasa: Hong Kong to Nice via Zürich

Tresc_opinii: Awful communication. Trying to get an answer from them is a waste of time. On the phone or by mail, they’ll reply but never answer the questions you ask them. It feels like they don’t even read what you write. We’re still waiting for them to give us some money back, and they don’t even have an idea of when it’s gonna happen. I will never book with them again and advise you not to. Definitely not a reliable company.

Dealing with Swiss has been nightmare. They modified my return flight significantly, completely canceled my final flight destination country which makes it impossible to reach the final destination. After being on the phone for 3 days and being bounced back and forth, they connected me with the "supervisor" who confirmed that the flight has been cancelled by the airline, and when asked about the refund, at first he said that there will be no refund and after I mentioned I am recording the phone call and they are required to provide refund according to EU law, he said that the refund will be coming but he doesn't know when. And that I should contact Swiss again in 2 months. I has to deal with Swiss several times in the past and there always seem to be a problem with their agents - unprofessional, incompetent, they are refusing to help and refusing to connect you to the supervisor. Still waiting for the refund, but will never again book through them. Very tired and frustrated of dealing with this airline.

We had premium seats for the flight which was booked through United in the US. United provided the refund promptly for the ticket due to COVID outbreak, but we were told to also process refund for upgrade charges through Swiss who were operating our planes. A month after submitting the refund request for the add'l charges for upgrades we are still waiting. All we have is a  print out of a submission for refund online, no email recognition that the refund request was received, no updates on processing. We cannot get hold of any relevant department and the booking agents in the US have no idea how long it'll take to process the fees - they cannot look anything up but assured us that a refund would be provided. This related to a canceled ticket and flight. We have essentially paid for virtual upgrades in some parallel universe.  While other airlines are similarly inundated they have systems in place for response and provide email responses and guidelines. Swiss has no such thing in place after months dealing with the epidemic.

Swiss International canceled my flight, did not offer any alternative and refused any compensation. As the world was locking down Swiss International canceled my flight. I don't have a problem with that. I called them on the phone and after a long wait they told me that I had to call the travel agent (Expedia) who sold me the ticket. I called Expedia and after multiple tries and long waits got through to a helpful person who told me that Swiss International still had a flight scheduled for the same day from Newark rather than JFK. I told them that would be fine and waited on the phone while Expedia attempted to rebook. This proved impossible because Swiss International would not provide them the code they needed. I gave up and was unable to fly anywhere. After the fact I had repeated contact with Expedia, who unlike Swiss International would answer the phone, about getting a refund, voucher or whatever. The final word from Swiss International was delivered via email through Expedia that any refund was refused due to “rules and restrictions.”
Trasa: New York to Valencia via Zurich

Tresc_opinii: I have always had much respect for Lufthansa, as my experiences have been positive. While I accept that the airline is prioritising rescheduled flight passengers, a plan must surely be made to accommodate cancellations. I was forced to cancel my flight on 18 March 2020 and a full refund was promised. However their normal turnaround time cannot be adhered to and they unable to provide a date to process my refund.

Under the pandemic situation, it became even more clear which airlines are the real low-cost ones. I had multiple tickets with Swiss for cancelled flights amounting to 500+chf, but I could not change one of them for a 60chf-flight. Class and ticket category differences, upgrades and downgrades, system excuses and a total time-consuming mess over the phone to even get information. Even airlines like Ryanair and Easyjet provided straightforward vouchers.

I had a flight booked for 28th April, and I rang on March 28th to try and get an answer of what would be happening. I was told I had 3 options: 1) Cancel the flight myself and receive only £50 refund per passenger, I told them this was not an option 2) Rebook using their new rebooking policy, again I told them this was not an option and we cannot rebook within the available timeframe, not do we want to. In his  words ‘Wait and see, we might cancel your flight ourselves’. I told him this process was disappointing but that would have to be our option. I am now due to fly tomorrow, and so I checked the website for flight information - There is no clear indication on any flights that have been cancelled. I have received no communications that my flight has been cancelled via email or otherwise. I then rang the company’s UK call centre, only to be told that the flight is no longer running, but more than that, that I myself had requested a cancellation previous to the flight being cancelled by Swiss. As stated above this was not the case, the agent I spoke to would not give me details on which staff member made the cancellation so that I could have it looked into, he would not pass me to a manager so that I could try and resolve the situation, and was completely unhelpful. The company is trying to cut me out of my £500 refund in any way possible, and I am  disgusted with the way it has been handled. I will never fly Swiss again.

Singapore to Heathrow. They seem to be partnered with Singapore Airlines. The cabin staff of Singapore were so much better, in terms of overall service. Swissair cabin staff offered so much less in terms of customer service.

Zurich to Kyiv. Awful support! Regarding the coronavirus, I changed my trip and back home because the government of my country closed the borders! I was trying to contact to Swiss ar support team for 5 days via email, phone, Facebook, and they didn't answer! Thank you so much for understanding and support! (sarcasm) If you choose Swiss and something unpredictable happens just be ready to lose your time and money!

Brussel to Saint-Petersburg via Zurich. Wonderful as 10 years ago. Swiss is still a top airline. Read some negative reviews about them and did not know what to expect since have not flown with them for 10 years or so. Very clean and new fleet! Polite and friendly flight attendants! Easy connection at Zurich. On time arrivals and departure. No doubt, I will fly them again if happens.

Zurich to Kiev. Having flew on its long-haul aircraft and particularly impressed with the product offered, I had high expectations with the short haul product as well. My experience was mixed. The flight was on-time, service with a smile and excellent food served. Majorly disappointing was the seat comfort, being six feet tall, I didn't have any space for comfort, made more uncomfortable when the seat reclines and shoulder / neck support is inadequate. Even though the aircraft was new, there were scratches in the overhead bins and didn't close properly. However, none can fault the impeccable service offered by Swiss.

Geneva to London. Flight re-routed to Zurich because of a technical issue. The aircraft was a Bombardier C-Series (now A220) - the airline bought this unreliable aircraft with a hope to save money, but now ends up cancelling and diverting numerous flights at the expense of customers. Re-booking process was stressful, with 4 agents attending to 100+ customers. We were asked to run through the airport to get our replacement flight (and were told we'd otherwise miss it). Luggage was subsequently misplaced for 10+ customers, with no communication from the airline. Overall SWISS fails to offer good customer service, because of a quasi-absence of ground staff and cold service across the board. GVA airport facilities were also sub-par but this applies to all airlines.

Tytul_opinii: "not a baby and family friendly airline"
Tresc_opinii: London Heathrow to Tokyo Narita via Zurich. If traveling with families and infant please avoid this airline. They charge parents if they want to book basinet for the baby, and in some other cases gives priority to sell those seats for a fee (for the extra legroom rather than infant comfort). The flight was late going out of LHR, while the help of Heathrow staff was good, there was no help in Zurich. We had a baby stroller and it wasn't delivered back at the aircraft gate, then there was nobody to ask for help, with little time for the connection because of the previous lateness we rushed with the baby on hands thru the airport. In Zurich for our next flight was already boarding and there was no help for families with children. The stroller failed again to be delivered at the gate in Tokyo-Narita, we had to carry baby on our hands thru whole airport again, finally stroller was delivered in the baggage belt. Confusion was evident with staff about baby car seat approved for aircraft use, while the flight attendant in London to Zurich approach was correct and we clarify, attendants in flight from Zurich to Narita was rude and was asking us to remove the seat where my baby is most secure because front passenger cannot recline, finally manager clarify and let us carry with the use of the baby seat. Swiss is not a baby and family friendly airline. For the aircraft, while the A321 was fairly new and nice maintened, the 777 was a bit old but clean.
Trasa: London Heathrow to Tokyo Narita via Zurich

Tytul_opinii: "one of the two suitcases was damaged"
Tresc_opinii: Zurich to Vienna. I was coming with a short connection flight with SWISS, and everything went smooth with the layover procedure within the terminal. I boarded in the plane and I was sitting in a middle seat, but this is what swiss provided me during check in as it was a rescheduled flight. Everything seemed to be working smooth and going well and after being already 9h on the way due to LH delays and strikes, I was very happy by sitting in the plane back home. We made a very long push back and very slow, until we arrived at the departure track but the captain gave the command to release the crew, it was unclear and there was no loud speaking announcement so I thought I would have just misunderstood, but unfortunately it was not like this, but after a small 45 min delay and some issues solved by the ground staff, we tried to departure again with no success, while they were trying no success. The captain went back again and the Maitre of cabine  made the announcing that we would have been stuck for more time. I went to her and explained my situation and asked for internet to say to who was waiting for me that I was not coming to the meeting, and she and her colleague  gave me some private internet of their phone, and something to drink. She started making all the possible arrangements that she could, and  the crew started to help until we were not told to leave the aircraft as the flight was officially cancelled. I was rescheduled on the flight later with 2h more of layover in Zürich, were the airline didn´t offer any type of help by giving any dinner voucher or whatever it could have been helpful for our comfort. The flight to Vienna at 09.20pm  was very crowded but very quiet. At my arrival at the airport they lost my suitcases and I had to stay there to make the lost luggage declaration which brought me to miss the last train to the city and forced me to use the taxi which was very expensive. The procedure for retrieving my suitcase was very difficult as I had to pass through three offices and none of them was seeming to have a clue how to help me, after two days it arrived and one of the two suitcases was damaged, a nightmare ! It took me two or three weeks to get the refund for my damaged suitcase. Overall, I would still recommend the airline just for the cabin crew on my first Vienna bound flight as they were professional, otherwise I would not fly with them anymore.

Venice to Zurich in November 2019, the flight was fully booked and it was literally a mess from the beginning we wanted to enter the airplane, I was sitting in the last row and we had a 20 minutes delay, which caused me a bad feeling as I has just 40 minutes layover in Zürich. On board they usually serve you even for just a 1h flight a little snack and their signature chocolate, as I was on the last row, I could not enjoy anything than water or coca cola zero, the only two things had still for the last row passengers in the plane. They should have made sure we would have had enough drinks, it´s a small and silly detail . The crew in self as usual with swiss is always very polite, á la old school, which is great and always with a smile on their face. Overall the flight was not matching with my expectation.

Tytul_opinii: "must pay to change my return ticket"
Tresc_opinii: London to Bangkok via Zurich. Boarded A320, no Business Class Cabin, only three abreast Economy seats. No entertainment screens. Dep almost 1 hr late, arrival Zurich with ten minutes to spare for the Bangkok leg. Only caught the flight because it was delayed. Leg to Bangkok in Boeing 777. Business class with very poor and uncomfortable seat, not enough cabin staff to cater. Five days later in Thailand, suffered a medical emergency, Hotel contacts Swiss re changing return flight to next day. Told plenty of seats available for both return legs. Told I must pay up front £1145 to change my return ticket. Paid it and got to Bangkok airport on time. Cabin crew chief made aware. Given pain killer en-route. Final leg from Zurich to London, same with no Business Class for me.

Zurich to Venice. The flight was fully booked and therefore I was not able to take my carry-on suitcase. I was disappointed by that, but the staff gave me the priority on the suitcase, so I had to wait less, very nice and thoughtful gesture. The flight was very short, and the cabin of maître was impeccable, LX1660 on the 29.05.2019, literally one of the most professional gentlemen on board I´ve seen. I found it a bit disappointing that they have just offered a little chocolate and drink while flying 1h, but the crew was very good!

Zurich to Vienna. I was coming from Basel with their train and I was able to check in basically at the rail platform and leaving my suitcase right away until the gate, which was so much help and as the airport was crowded and packed! Amazing service and super nice lady at the check in counter. The flight was very packed and short but they could maintain a good level of work, even the less expert was very professional, although you could see that they were very new in their job but doing great.

Vienna to Zurich. First flight of the day, boarding at 05.55am, and as usual you need to pass through Austrian Airlines were I went to the check-in counter to ask for a boarding pass with no success, just a rude way “go to print by yourself”. The flight to Zürich was great, got my pillow to nap, some coffee and warm croissant, perfect connection and perfect service, they are as usual just impeccable.

Vienna to Zurich. Flying their new Airbus A220-200, C series, which are amazing for short-haul flights, super wide legroom and I could have all the legroom I wanted. The only note about this aircraft is that the Toilet is a bit too narrow, but at least was cream and fresh amenities in. Food was very nice, 1h flight and we received a nice little sandwich, and the attention and professionalism of the FA is definitely accurate. My suitcase was delivered in a very short time and this was just great after a bumpy and windy landing

Berlin to Zürich. Why pick Swiss over budget airlines for short trips when their customer service is just the worst? They managed to lose my luggage on a one hour direct flight, I can deal with that, but the customer service afterwards was infuriating.

Zurich to Los Angeles. I have been very impressed by my latest flight with Swiss. The cabin crew was extremely friendly and warm. The Boeing 777 seat's is very comfortable, with a generous recline and slide that allowed me to sleep. But what impressed me most is the abundance of food! Lunch was ok quality but good quantity. And during the flight the cabin crew passed by with ice cream, a sandwich and finally with a warm light meal. Impressive! And Zurich airport is a breeze to connect through. Will try to fly with them in my next trip to Europe!

Tytul_opinii: "you will feel really cramped in these economy seats"
Tresc_opinii: Having not taken a long haul flight with Swiss since 2009 I was very excited to be on aboard their flagship Boeing 777-300ER from Bangkok to Zurich. Unfortunately, this seating configuration 3-4-3 is terrible to experience in economy section. After a couple of hours flying, you will feel really cramped in these economy seats. The crew was professional but with a lack of friendly touch. Also, they ran out of 1 of the 2 meal options (no more pasta option were available) and the female flight attendant tried to hide this by throwing the chicken option to you without any explanation. The Swissair days are really gone. What a disgrace for Swiss to offer this poor product in Y! I would not recommend this airline in Y for a long haul flight.

Paris to Buenos Aires via Zurich.  I took four flights with them, none of them departed on time. I tried booking an extra suitcase (average size and weight) through their web page, impossible to do. After an extensive search (they do not give you contact information and do not make it easy for one to contact them), they told us that it was impossible to do that online nor by phone, thus making it impossible for us to reduce costs as they claim on their webpage! They told us that it could only be done at the counter when checking-in. They also said that it would be in the amount of 200 Euros! We arrived at the checking desk on our departure date and were charged 250 Euros for an extra suitcase. Moreover, ground personnel had a rude and dismissive attitude towards us. The aircraft was old and there was no room for my legs and I am average size and of medium built. A very uncomfortable intercontinental flight of over 11 hours. We will never  fly with them again.
Trasa: Paris to São Paulo via Zurich

Tresc_opinii: Newark to Zurich in business class. Very nice cabin crew, though the plane looked very dated. Swiss have a very old business class on the A330-300 which does not offer much privacy and which is very dated and worn out. The entertainment system is very dated too and there is not much of a selection. Many of the movies are very old and the contents are not updated frequently like with other airlines. So if you travel on Swiss you are better bringing your own entertainment device/movies in my opinion. I did not eat dinner so cannot comment on it. Breakfast was very poor for business class. There was no hot dish nor any cheese or charcuterie. The breakfast just consisted of a coffee, a yogurt and some bread with butter and jam. Overall, Swiss have very nice cabin crews but they desperately need to invest as it comes to their product.

Zurich to Johannesburg. This had to be the most uncomfortable flight I have experienced. We sat in a row that had four seats in front of us (row 42) and our row only had 3 chairs. The result of this was that we were off centre from the tray table and screen which meant that you had to balance your tray between two tray tables and keep your neck turned to one side to watch the screen. For a long flight this eventually caused back and neck ache. I think it is unfair to expect people to sit like this. We all paid the same fair as everyone else and I feel aggrieved. Remove one chair from the row and the other two could be centered properly. Would not recommend this airline.

Zurich to Rome. Had a decent experience with SWISS. The check-in process fast and efficient, so was the security. Zurich airport is well designed and very spacious, making the experience at the airport very good. However at the gate, we waited in a queue for boarding, which started more than 15 minutes after the stated boarding time, and the gate agent did not say anything. Nonetheless the experience on the aircraft was smooth and uneventful. For a 22-year-old aircraft, it looked pretty fresh, clean, and the seat was pretty comfortable for the short intra-Europe flight. The crew were friendly and helpful, and drinks and a small sandwich was provided.

Berlin Tegel to Zurich. Berlin Airport is a very badly designed airport, so I don’t fully blame SWISS for the disappointing experience at the gate as it was not their fault. Nonetheless, check-in was fast and efficient, and the airport lounge was large and comfortable with more than enough seats. However, the boarding area was cramped, packed and the boarding process was an absolute mess in the small space. There was no order, no priority boarding for Business or Star Alliance gold - everyone just rushed on and there was no one to control the crowd. The aircraft I flew, the A220, was in a 2-3 configuration and it was pretty comfortable. There were little overhead screens which showed flight information. Cabin service was good and there was a round of drinks and a sandwich was given. The flight was pretty uneventful and we arrived in Zurich on time, and collected our baggage pretty quickly.

Zurich to Athens. The lady at check in wouldn’t print the boarding pass for me and my wife because i didn’t do that by my own on the self check-in  machine. She claimed i had excess bag weight and it was 23.6kg instead of 23kg. I asked to check my hand luggage and she refused and then before I go in the aircraft they took my bag for check in. All this is a shame. I won’t fly with Swiss again.

Geneva to London. Awful. Hidden bag charges. Unhelpful staff. Nasty plane. I fly regularly and would recommend all other airlines over this one. They are in the premium category but operate as a budget airline.

Zürich to Johannesburg in First Class. Perfect service, nice flight, everything very good. It can’t be better. Service was very good. Food excellent. Crew is caring about guest, unbelievable very good

Prague to Zurich. Easy online check in and seat selection, extremely friendly staff and very accommodating with best Kosher food. Thank you Swiss Air for my great experience with you and I will definitely look to fly with you again.
Trasa: Prague to New York via Zurich

Tytul_opinii: "had to pay for drinks and food"
Tresc_opinii: Munich to Geneva. We had to pay for drinks and food on this 1 hour flight. Low cost service for premium price. Crew was unprofessional in that they only noticed after departure that a child was seating in the emergency exit row. I like the A220 aircraft.

Malta to London via Zurich. After a great previous trip with Swiss – was looking forward to flying them again and pleased to say wasn’t disappointed! I flew in Economy from Malta back to London via Zurich and the whole process was incredibly seamless. The inflight service is second to none for a European carrier; with the cabin crew always being super friendly and attentive. Would highly recommend Swiss if looking for a premium carrier.

Zürich to Hamburg. I had a bit of time to visit the Senator Lounge in the A terminal. The lounge agent recommended me to visit the newly opened Alpine lounge. This new contemporary lounge is super and the staff was extremely friendly and nice. The lounge also has great views of Zürich Airport. After my lounge visit I took my flight to Hamburg;  I was welcomed and recognized as a Senator member and offered a refreshing towel and bottle of water during boarding. The flight itself went smooth and on time. We were offered sandwiches, drinks and the Swiss Frey chocolates. Swiss remains a benchmark of high and consistent quality.

Hannover to Zürich. Very disappointing. Booked Business Class  and was not allowed to board the plane as they overbooked business class. Eventually I was given a seat in Economy as one passenger didn’t show up. Wrote a complaint to Swiss and didn’t get any refund just a standard reply that many airlines overbook flights. This is what I would expect from a low cost airline. It’s a shame that they are allowed to use the name Swiss as their quality is nowhere meeting the Swiss standard.

I was booking a flight from Skopje to Geneva with Swiss on their official website. They charged my Visa Card, but did not issue me a booking reference. I called their customer service, they were rude, unhelpful and impolite. I wrote them several e-mails and they have been keeping me on hold for almost a week. In the meantime, the prices of the flights have gone up. They are saying they will most probably return my money, but they ignored me completely when I mentioned the increased price of the flights that I need to rebook. Meanwhile, I am still waiting to hear from the customer service when they are going to return my money (if they do at all). They behave like it is my fault for what happened, very frustrating!

Tytul_opinii: "the most faultless and perfect product in Europe"
Tresc_opinii: When I booked the flight I intended to book Swiss mainly just to use the Senator lounge at Zürich airport, which is undeniably the best star alliance lounge I have ever visited. I found that their twitter, who used to be very polite and responsive seemed to turn around, they were still responsive but the responses I received were nowhere near polite, such as aggressively asking me if that's all the questions I have. Check in for my 6am flight out of London Heathrow had quite a long line, however it did move quite quickly I was checked in very quickly and invited to use the United club, as our flight oddly left from a B gate, which is not normally used by A320 aircraft. This lounge is nothing significant to write home about, but there were adequate shower facilities and a full english was provided. Once I boarded I found out that half the passengers on the flight were rebooked from London City due to inclement weather, and the flight was quite full. Nevertheless, I received a cold snack and chocolate on this flight. Arrival and transfer into Zürich Kloten airport wasn't something I expected, in a bad way. It seems as if half the security staff had called in sick and therefore there was only one screening lane open. There was also no gold track as advertised on the star alliance website. After buying some cheese and chocolates, I headed to the Senator lounge, and was delighted to find the terrace open! The outdoor terrace is amazing, you can watch planes take off from both active runways, and it was very fun to see some apron activity. Meals at the lounge were also made-to-order, and I wish I could have everything. Everything I tasted was delicious and actually seasoned. The whisky bar was also a delight, the barman recommending different whisky combinations and I was able to enjoy a couple of cocktails and different whiskies. I must say that this barman was the most delightful person I have ever met, and his knowledge of whisky is immaculate. The last leg of the trip was operated by Thai Airways, and I cannot fault that flight. I did want to try Swiss' economy as a lot of people claim they are the best economy in Europe, but unfortunately that flight was full. My baggage was one of ten to come out first, and I was out the door in a matter of minutes after clearing immigration. Overall, Swiss has the most faultless and perfect product in Europe. They beat their competitors like BA or Air france by many, many miles. I would certainly choose Swiss over any other airline in Europe, and hope they keep the quality up.
Trasa: London Heathrow to Bangkok via Zurich

Tresc_opinii: Brussels to Zurich. This flight was operated by a new A220. Friendly service, rather small breakfast howver with a piece of a hot quiche. Rolls and croissants with jam, they should add some small piece of fruit or yoghurt. Coffee, tea or other beverages were provided however no newspapers anymore. Immediately after boarding business passengers receive a 33cl bottle of water and a wrapped cleansing towel. Some brief information was given concerning connecting flights. Very acceptable in view of the distance. Everybody still receive the traditional chocolate before leaving.

Tytul_opinii: Swiss Intl Air Lines customer review
Tresc_opinii: I would personally like to thank the flight crew aboard LX1412 from Zurich to Belgrade on September 24th for the warm birthday wishes and gifts. That was such a pleasant surprise in the early hours of my day. Swiss was always one of my number one choices but after this top quality gesture it's now my favorite.

Newark to Zurich. Economy seats are small. I had my bagpack hidden under seat, it was difficult to take something from my bagpack. Entertainment screen very small not much movies selection. We land to Zurich morning time so we got a breakfast. Cold breakfast: strawberry yoghurt, jam, roll, orange juice, butter. My next flight was to Dublin. I asked twice for water, service not really good, crew needs improvement.  At the airport in Zurich one que to passport check, economy and business, then they send you to another que, you will get another boarding card with stamp checked even that if you have mobile boarding card.

Tytul_opinii: Swiss Intl Air Lines customer review
Tresc_opinii: Zurich to Bucharest. Wait for the flight, boarding and once we were seated in the aircraft ready to start the engines, they discover a technical issue with 1 engine of the aircraft. Had to wait 3 more hours in the airport for this incident. They didn’t care if we have another flight to catch and they didn’t offer water. Really awful experience.
London to Zürich. Smooth takeoff and landing. Seats are amazing for me, the best legroom. Free sandwich and chocolate bar, pleasant crew.

Zurich to Amsterdam. A comfortable economy class flight with Swiss. We do had 20 min delay due to baggage offload of passengers not showing up. The female captain kept us well updated. The cabin crew provided excellent service with a smile, no service cars bumping into the seats and giving a refill of the drinks when asked for. A pleasant experience.

Hong Kong to Paris via Zurich in business class. Hong Kong - Zurich was with Boeing 777-300 ER and Zurich - Paris was an A320. The business class product in Swiss long haul is good. I like the friendliness and enthusiasm of cabin crew, classy cabin design, smooth take off and landing, and the quality of the business lounge at Zurich airport. However, the seat layout 1-2-2 means that there is always 1 passenger per seating line who doesn't enjoy clear access to the aisle. I sat next to one of those unlucky passangers. My neighbor had to ask me a couple of times to go to the lavatory. Individual and toilet amenity kit were also could have been a bit more imaginative. The individual kit was very basic and there was practically nothing available in the lavatory apart from basic soap-lotion.
Trasa: Hong Kong to Paris via Zurich

Tresc_opinii: Boarding in London City airport, Swiss told us that the flight was overweight. Therefore 15 passengers had to be left out of the flight, while seats were still available. Effectively preferring to take the luggage rather than passengers on the flight. They assigned me a flight from Heathrow 4 hours later. So we had to change airport. Then the 2nd flight was later an hour / an hour and a half. Basically it took me 10 hours and lost a full day of business meetings. I got a 250€ that I could only take part in cash because banks don't allow smaller amounts to be taken out. I got spoken in a very disrespectful way on my way back from Zurich by the staff at the gate threatening to overcharge me for my cabin bag. This last incident triggered me to write the review because it is one thing to be treated less importantly than luggage but an other to be insulted as a customer.

Cairo to Paris via Zurich. SWISS abandoned passengers at transit. Flight was late leaving Cairo to take more passengers from another destination. The connection was a short 55 mins. On landing 35 mins late we were told to "hurry". We ran. Arrived to gate with staff still there. But they denied us boarding plane is now closing. Zero customer care from flight and ground staff.

One of the best short-haul experiences in European economy class. Flew from Gdansk (GDN) to Barcelona (BCN) via Zurich (ZRH). Aircrafts clean and well-maintained. Rich and free service onboard including sweet snacks, Swiss chocolate, beverages (also wine, beer). I appreciate that most of products are local from Switzerland, staff were generally decent, but some FA's could be a bit more smiling and attentive (for example no greeting at plane entrance on one of legs). The hub in Zurich-Kloten (ZRH) is a bit cramped and worn out. Boarding process in ZRH could be more efficient.

I fly Swiss every year, but always pay extra for a forward cabin seat. $50. Miami - Zurich - Budapest- Chicago. The flights are always punctual, and the on board service excellent. The food, pedestrian. Chicken or pasta. I stop at the airport deli in Zurich and buy Spanish ham and a nice cheese. I don't like the small seat back entertainment screen. All airline service is deteriorating and Swiss is a better choice.

My wife and I, for years, only fly First class of two different Airlines: Emirates and Korean Air - we love both of them, but now, SWISS had very special fares for flights from London and why not? We wanted to try their First class, (for the first time), and we were so impressed with their service, that I have to be writing this review. In any case, here I am to tell everybody how good SWISS service was at the Airport and in flight. We had the best flight of our lives on September 3, 2019. The flight attendant was extraordinary at taking care of us and everyone was extremely nice and professional.

Athens to Düsseldorf via Zürich. The once known quality of this fine airline is going down. The flight segment ATH-ZRH was operated by a A320. The lavatory in this new configuration in the back are too small compared to the old configuration. The food is unacceptable as we got served cold Curry Rice with a very small piece of chicken. The beverages containing a piece of cake and cheese and roll are ok.  The flight segment ZRH-DUS was fine, great staff, good snack tha'ts all we need.

Montreal to Zürich in Business Class. As I was traveling with a carry-on only, I proceeded straight to the lounge. Swiss uses AC’s Maple Leaf Lounge in the international concourse. This is a well equipped, bright lounge with great food and beverage options including made-to-order cocktails. Boarding was slightly delayed but orderly. On-board the hard product was good especially if you are seated in seats with no neighbours as these provide a huge amount of personal space. The seat is not particularly comfortable in the lie-flat position and it’s too close to the floor when fully extended. Upon takeoff, we were offered drinks with a small appetizer which was followed by a full dinner service. Food was tasty and wines were of excellent quality with multiple refills. The FA’s were very professional and attentive and the one taking care of my side of the aircraft was all smiles all of the time. IFE had decent content but the screens are relatively small compared to those you get in other business-class offerings. Flight pulled back and touched down on time. It was a great flight all around.

I flew Johannesburg to Madrid via Zurich on 4 September. However, my luggage did not arrive. I spoke to the lady at the counter in Madrid who told me that my luggage has been already found in Zurich and that I should get it this afternoon. I had nothing with me except for the clothes I was wearing. I was surprised that Swiss never offered my any financial assistance to buy some necessities but I figured that since the luggage will arrive this afternoon there was no need to press this further. My luggage did not arrive this afternoon. It did not arrive the next day either. I called the call centre number at least 10 times during this time and they told me that the luggage was still missing. This contradicts what the lady at the counter told me. Furthermore, they gave me an email to escalate this issue. I sent three emails and never got a reply from them to this day. I also lodged a complained on the Swiss airlines website which to this day has been totally ignored. Finally, I received feedback on day 3 that my luggage has been found and is in Madrid. I immediately called the call centre number to find out when it will be delivered. The gentleman who answered told me that he does not control the shipping schedule but he expects it to be delivered this morning. It was not delivered in the morning, nor in the afternoon, nor in the evening. The next day, complete exasperated I took a taxi to the airport and picked up my luggage myself because I completely lost faith in any information I received from Swiss. I want to say that I am really disgusted by the level of service I received from Swiss Airlines. Luggage gets lost and I am not upset about this. But the miscommunication, lack of transparency and complete lack of empathy for my situation by Swiss Airlines is appalling. If I just received some honest feedback and a little financial aid to buy some basic things (like underwear, socks) I would not write such a harsh review. I can say honestly that my vacation experience was ruined because of the service I received from them.

Delhi to Zurich. Flew Swiss for the first time and had a good experience. Cabin Crew was very attentive and friendly. Midnight Snack (Chicken Roll) was great and served hot but Breakfast (Parantha, Vegetable, Cutlet, Breads and Fruit) was bland and left a lot to be desired. IFE selection was great but screen was iffy and often took time to respond to touch. Seats were comfortable. Would recommend to fly.

Brussels to Zurich. I am frequent Swiss International Airlines flyer. Unfortunately, the service attitude is degrading rapidly.  I had a business flight with Swiss from Brussels to Zurich. Unfortunately, I missed my 6:55 pm flight by a few minutes. This is unfortunate. Yet, that is exactly why I purchased a Business ticket. Fortunately, there was a 8:10 pm flight. Since I missed the flight while already being on the terminal I went to the Swiss personal of the 8:10 pm flight. Fortunately, the gate opened early for the 8:10 pm flight and I contacted the Swiss personal around 7:35 pm. Yet, they told me to go to the Swiss Check-in counter on the terminal. At the Swiss counter at the terminal the cleark told me, that they could not issue a new ticket, while I offically would be on the plane with the other plane. Obviously I missed the plane and could not get a new ticket. After some discussion I was asked to call the Swiss international line. Again, after long waiting, I was told that I could not get a new ticket for the evening flight via phone. I would have to go to the Swiss ticket counter outside of the terminal. At 7:50 pm I arrive at the check-in counter of the Swiss outside of the terminal. There, I was told, that they would not issue a ticket, since I would be too late. If I had given a phone call a few minutes earlier they would have been able to help. Also, no matter that the 8:10 plane was already indicated to be delayed and no matter that I had no luggage. I was not issued a new ticket. I would have to wait for a night. Last but not least I was told it is a non-refundable Business ticket. You will have to purchase a new ticket without any discount.

Zürich to Newark with Swiss Intl Air Lines. Although the flight staff and crew were great our trip was extremely uncomfortable. I fly quite often and have never experienced such cramped quarters. You couldn’t even get out of your seat if the person in front of your reclined. I couldn’t even recline my seat because the gentleman behind me had his knees in my back. Again, the staff was great, entertainment was lacking but it was a safe and smooth flight.

Berlin to Thessaloniki via Zurich. Swiss what a disappointment! The seats are to small and the trip was very uncomfortable. They  delayed Berlin to Zurich flight and I almost missed the connection and the Swiss staff was rude and unhelpful. Delays everywhere even at the check in counter.  I would never recommend this airline

London City to Zurich. Swiss is not what it was. I bought a ticket (cabin luggage only) for a break in Switzerland and was horrified to arrive at the airport on standby. I would not recommend that you buy a cabin luggage only ticket - despite your payment, you pay for a standby seat, not an actual seat. On my return flight, a passenger was pressing his knees in my back continually. Although I had bought a ticket for a seat, I got a bouncy castle seat where the other passenger had more rights than me. Awful flight both ways. Swiss was always my first choice go to airline. No longer. Disappointed.

Geneva to Frankfurt. Frequently late and with significant delays even on very short flights. Recently had trouble with subsequent connections in Frankfurt because of late arrival with Swiss in the preceding flight. In one case lost my connection. On the other nearly missed the plane (headed for the US) and there wasn’t enough time for my luggage to be transferred.

Montreal to Valencia via Zurich. The flight as itself was pretty good, the staff were very polite and professional. However, I never received my baggage on time. When i got to Valencia, i did not receive the baggage and only received it 4 days later. Now that I'm back to Montreal i was told my luggage was left at my previous airport. They do not keep me posted on where my luggage, I always have to call and 9 times out 10 they do not answer. If im lucky they would answer and would try to take me off the phone asap as if my luggage was not important. If the ground crew were more efficient and cared about their flyers, the airline would be very good since in sky they take good care of you.

Hong Kong to Paris via Zurich. My first time with Swiss, what a disappointment. The seats are quite small and the trip that i did it was very uncomfortable. I got refused to be given a big bottle of water so I had to regularly ask them cup of water. The meals were not exceptional in comparison of what i had in the past with different companies and the attitudes of the staff were not exceptional, only 1 or 2 more mature air hostess were a bit more friendly. The entertainment wasn't exciting (not a lot of offering movies wise). Swiss was the main company with one flight operated by Cathay Pacific and i was shocked to see my damaged baggage upon arrival.
Trasa: Hong Kong to Paris via Zurich

Tresc_opinii: London to Zurich. I was supposed to go on holidays to Zurich from London 25th July and come back on 28th July. when I arrived to the airport the flight got delayed 15 min, then it got cancelled. Staff gathered people flying with Swiss and told everyone that the flight got canceled because “there are problems with Italian aircraft”, then they asked us to check ourself out, find where the airline desk is and call the customer service to ask for a refund and rebooked on the next flight. I did what they asked, to later hear that I was rebooked for Saturday night, 2 days after my original flight, i have asked several times to be rebooked for Friday morning but they said the flight is fully booked - later on I gave the number to a friend of mine that was going to Zurich as well and he called an hour later and got a seat on the Friday morning flight! And the answer was because he is a frequent flyer. I had to ask for my refund and the compensation for all the disruption from their website to which I get a reply giving a different reason. “As you may know, your flight irregularity was due to bird strike on engine".  Really unsatisfactory service

Newark to Zurich. A very mediocre experience on Swiss. The most uncomfortable seat in business, hardly adjustable. Vegan meal was shockingly bad. Plain rice and very plain veggies. For all the talk about a Swiss vegetarian restaurant looking after their meatless food, this meal was terrible and I think they need to go back to ask vegans what they consider good food. There were plenty of crew but seemed very young and disorganized with no warmth whatsoever. We were given a card to fill out for breakfast (no hot choices) and even then I had to ask for my breakfast which arrived incomplete. Not a sight of the touted Swiss chocolate on board either. Even the entertainment on board was very limited with old movies etc. This was my first time flying Swiss and I would avoid in future. No going the extra mile on Swiss but just the bare minimum they can get away with.

Belgrade to Brussels via Zurich. As always a joy to fly with them. The flights were perfect and with a little delayed from Belgrade I manage to catch my next flight to Brussels. The airplanes where clean and the crew was so friendly.

We had a terrible experience with Swiss! Four business class seats with absolutely no business class benefits. No IFE, terrible (or no!) food, and a plane change even took away the extra space that business class affords you. And to make matters worse, Swiss Air’s customer service couldn’t have cared less. Avoid at all costs!
Trasa: Tel Aviv to Venice via Zurich

Tresc_opinii: Budapest to Delhi via Zurich. Swiss re-routed us at Zurich (they had delayed Budapest to Zurich flight and we missed the connection) Zurich- to Copenhagen-Delhi by Air India. My 2 bags did not arrive and were delivered 2 and 3 days later. For compensation Swiss pushes me to Air India and they say they cannot compensate me because I do not have an Air India ticket. What a pathetic state of affairs. We had travelled business class.

Flight from Singapore to London via Zurich. Check in staff at Changi airport very efficient and helpful. They use the SIA lounge in terminal 2 at Singapore which was good. Some nice food options and helpful staff who prepared special food for my children as they did not like the buffet options. The flight was on a 2 year old 777. Boarding was well organised. Aircraft was clean and I liked the seat. There is some variability with the seats with some being quite sheltered from isle traffic and others less so. Good food and drink options, my beef main course was very good. Good entertainment. Professional cabin crew. A good flight.

We were flying on Swiss  from Chicago to Zurich. We are very dissatisfied with how Swiss Airlines employees handle their carry on baggage policy. It states on their website that the maximum size of a carry on bag is 55 cm (21.6 in) up to 8kg. Our bag is 21 inches including the wheels. When we were boarding, we were asked to check the size of the bag by fitting it into the measuring device. Our bag didn’t fit it to our big surprise. We measured airport device and it was only 20.5 inches long. We have a picture of the measurement that we can submit. When we pointed out extremely politely to Swiss Airlines representatives that the Swiss device is incorrect, the representatives became very rude and cancelled our boarding passes.

Dismiss Swiss would be my answer to the question how did you feel about Swiss Air? my husband and myself have been treated so badly by Swiss air staff.
