We flew out from London to Geneva on 2 July 2019. we should have returned on 16 July but unfortunately due to my husband being taken into hospital on 4th July for treatment i had to rearrange holiday return to 13 July, no sympathy at all from customer service, for a single flight home for each of us it cost £456. Strange as our total fare originally cost £308.08, this included paying for baggage in hold and choosing our seats (which we did not get on the trip back). All we had at Geneva airport from the staff at baggage area was abuse except for the help the kind lady on the information desk who rearranged yet another later flight home due to misinformation given to us by a member of their staff. By the way this third set of tickets were back to £348.30 - after contacting customer service on return, the best they can offer as compensation is a voucher for £200 to be used on another Swiss flight by July 2021. This is useless to us as being 75 and 72 respectively, we will be lucky to be able for various reasons including cost to go again. I am so sad that I had to write this as I have always been pleased with this company.

San Francisco to Zurich. Flight went ok. On the bad side, we sat behind a baby. It cried for half the flight and I couldn’t sleep that well. On the good side, the flight entertainment was nice and the cabin crew was really nice. I would recommend this airline.

Frankfurt to Bangkok via Zurich return. Swiss is in general a good airline, but my experience during tris trip was mixed. Short flights from Frankfurt to Zurich and return were uneventful. The crew worked hard to serve every passenger a drink on these short flights. The flight from Zurich to Bangkok was average. I had a window seat and the seat pitch felt super narrow. When the passenger in front of you reclined the seat, it was nearly impossible to move. I wanted to turn on my shoes and it was impossible. The cabin crew was neither friendly nor unfriendly and didn’t care much. When I was trapped in the window seat and asked for a drink, I got a short answer: "Sorry bar is closed“. Later I noted that there was a self-service bar next to the lavatory with water and juice, but there were no snacks. When the seat belt signs were turned on during turbulences, some passengers went around. Not one of the crew cared, there were also no announcements to sit down and fasten seat belts. Announcements from the cockpit were minimal, the flight arrived with 30 minutes delay, but there was no announcement or excuse. On the positive side: meals were very good on all flights and IFE was also good. The return flight from BKK to ZRH was much better: crew was very good, there were two snacks between the two meals (ice cream and sandwich) and the self-service bar was full of different snacks. Another negative aspect of my journey was that I received my luggage wet after transfer in Zurich. Did they leave my luggage out in the rain the whole time?

Zurich to Singapore. Would like to thank Flight Attendant Kai for going above and beyond in trying to locate my ring that came off during the night. Luckily it appeared from where it was hiding after landing at Singapore. Hopefully our thanks get passed on to Kai for his efforts.

Valencia to Hannover via Zurich. The worst service ever. The woman in the check in counter was very rude. She refuses to just open my passport's plastic. I talked to the their customer service, which helped me to check in at another counter. They only serve sorbet for my route to Zurich. Poor quality of food.

Tytul_opinii: "Another superb set of experiences with Swiss"
Tresc_opinii: Budapest to New York JFK via Zürich. Another superb set of experiences with Swiss - from the hospitality of the cabin crew to the food and drinks served to the cleanliness of the aircraft to the safety and punctuality of the flight. On the first segment an ample breakfast was served with repeated offers of bread and drinks. On the trans-Atlantic section, the main meal had a variety of choices. I skipped the food service prior to landing. The amenity kit came in a different container compared to the one given on the flight out. I availed of some duty free shopping. The film selection could be more extensive. The seat is not as comfortable as I would have expected. You need to stretch your arm to touch the TV screen to change channels. The cabin seemed a tad too warm. Smooth flight. Plug points to charge phones and computers. Bathroom kept clean - limited, if any, amenities there. Arrived refreshed, with hot towels provided.
Trasa: Budapest to New York JFK via Zürich

Tresc_opinii: Gdansk to Split via Zurich. It was my first flight with Swiss Airlines. In my opinion good staff service on ground and during the flight. Quite easy check in on line. I can recommend this carrier. I can say everything as in a Swiss watch. However their the partnership lines Edelweiss Air is not the same standard of quality but nobody is perfect.

Stockholm to Stuttgart via Zürich. Very bad handling of delayed/re-booked flight. Minutes before boarding the flight I got a notification that I was re-booked on another one - the next day. Big surprise. So why? The Stockholm-Zürich flight had a delay, so I would not have been able to reach the connecting flight Zürich-Stuttgart. So for so bad, but happened before, can be solved. But instead of letting us go to Zürich, sleep there, take an early flight next day, they just left us hanging in Stockholm. Wouldn't be that bad, as it's a nice city, but we were already at the gate, ready for boarding. There was no way getting through on the service line (three tries, ten minute waiting, no response). Ground staff from SAS couldn't get anything changed for us, although they really tried. Swiss solution now was to let us stay at the Stockholm airport, get a flight the next day via Hamburg and be at home at 1.30pm Monday, instead of 11.30pm Sunday. This is horrible. That's a 14h delay on an easy flight, without any communication to Swiss directly. This means we gonna spend half Monday on airport, instead of working, family or whatever. Haven't had this before with Swiss, but was very negatively surprised on how they handle such things. The service in that is not worth the value at all that you pay for their flight. Ground service is nice, on-board service as well. Their people are great and service is very good. But the management of such a situation is absolutely horrible. Would have expected that from a third class cheap airline, but from Swiss... well that, was bad.

New York to Budapest via Zurich. A glitch free pair of on-time flights with efficient and attentive in-flight service. The cabin layout in the Airbus 330 was open and airy in a 1-2-1 configuration. The window seat I had was not comfortable — it was hard. When I made it flat to sleep, it felt narrow. The blanket/duvet could have been larger. The pillow was overly small. My sleep was fitful. The TV screen was activated by touches but you had to stretch from your seat. No secure space to keep your passport, phone, wallet, glasses and the like. In summary, the hard product is inferior. On boarding, water, juice and champagne was offered followed by a hot towel. A menu booklet in several languages presented the dinner options which looked very complete and included fish, beef, chicken and a vegetarian choice. A selection of liquors was listed. There was a separate card listing choices for breakfast that needed to be be filled out - in effect, the flight attendants collected our orders. The breakfast was presented in a tidy manner. The order was correct - it was a continental breakfast. Hot towel provided before landing. The second flight of about 80 minutes to Budapest was excellent. A lunch of a cheese and ham salad with warm bread roll and full beverage service was provided. Before landing, the flight attendant passed a basket of Swiss chocolates. A sweet ending! All in all, the service was faultless but the seat and the seating environment in the Airbus 330-300 will discourage me from flying this aircraft on business class on Swiss.
Trasa: New York to Budapest via Zurich

Tresc_opinii: Geneva to Athens. Swiss has significantly deteriorated its service. This is the 5th consecutive time I’m having a 30min delay on the same route and the 10th across routes.

Hamburg to Zurich. We couldn’t book our seats beforehand. We tried everything but they told us that we couldn’t do anything. We had a flight from Hamburg to Zurich and then to Washington DC. They seated us in the very back of the airplane but they knew that we had a very short time in Zurich to catch our second flight. They couldn’t get our bags from Zurich to Dulles and we still have no answer from them. Our bags didn’t arrive even after over 24 hours. I won’t ever fly with Swiss again. I would give them a rating of 0 points if that would be possible.

New York JFK to Zurich. We have a flight tomorrow leaving from JFK at 6:10 PM. I received a text message at 10 PM stating my flight to Zurich is cancelled without stating anything additional. We have booked all of our flights through Swiss and therefore have a connecting flight to Naples and then Rome back to JFK. They had the audacity to hang up twice. No other solutions were offered. We even offered to drive to Philadelphia which is a 2 hour drive and even greater during rush hour but they said they are not able to. When asked about the flight being cancelled, their response was technical issues. No mention of refund was made during the phone conversation. Once I mentioned the refund, they then wanted to refer me to another department, kept me on hold for 30+ minutes and then automatic hang up. Is this a duping strategy. I have hotels booked for 7 days. I have connecting flights booked. I have airport transfers arranged. I also paid for my baggage. I even have my phone conversation recorded. I don't understand how an airline has no answers.

Sao Paulo to Zurich. My first flight with Swiss was definitely a surprise. Outstanding service both before and during the flight (apart from the long queue at the bag drop desks shared with Lufthansa). The plane was new and with a very pleasant interior (IFE was quite good as well, bathrooms were super clean and with amenities, you don't usually find in economy class). The crew was warm and definitely went the extra mile in making us feel welcome on board. Food was filling and well balanced (drinks served in proper bottles and cans) and the galley was full of high-quality snacks for the whole length of the flight. Definitely, an airline to recommend and, in my humble opinion, that should get more credit.

London to Geneva. Flying in business class I was expecting a hot meal, which used to be very nice on Swiss flights. Unfortunately they have stopped it and now business class passengers can  get a sandwich or anything else from the menu that is presented for charge to economy passengers. This is a disgrace for a full service airline charging for its supposedly premium service. Unfortunately I will fly with them again as they normally are cheaper then BA on LHR GVA route, but they can forget me in the business class.

Zurich to Brussels, worst nightmare ever. Flight LX788 cancelled. No information why. Had to rebook with 400 other passengers. 2 desks open. No movement for multiple hours. Rebooked to 1 day later at 21.00. Where to stay? No information. Rented a car and drove back home. Luggage still lost. Never again Swiss.

Geneva to Singapore via Zurich. As this was a long haul flight to Singapore from Zurich, two meals were served. Though the food for the first meal was tolerable, the second one was mind boggling to say the least. I expected some level of quality even from the economy segment. When the complete set for breakfast was served, I checked the menu that was handed out to see if what was served was exactly what was printed. On my tray were a sealed container containing an omelette, a bread roll and sealed utensils. No food tray. The breakfast menu stated: Omelette with mushrooms + etc, bread roll, butter, jam, yoghurt and seasonal fruit salad. As to how it was served made me chuckle, and at the end, was in disbelief. They did not ask if I wanted a drink. She walked off and another stewardess dropped a sealed set of utensils. At that point I figured it was time to eat (?) - but lo and behold, a steward followed suit handing bread rolls to everyone and it was just dumped on top of my food container. I took a photo of both the menu and the breakfast set, and compared this to the breakfast that Singapore Airlines provide for long haul flights. Service with a smile was non-existent on my Swiss flight. . More power to you and unfortunately for me and my family, we have pre-booked several flights with Swiss Air. Shame.

Zurich to Singapore. The lady at the bag drop off counter in Zurich was rude. I went over to drop off my bag and she just stares at me until I asked "Do you need my boarding pass" and she simply nodded and rolled her eyes. After she was done, she just handed over the boarding pass without saying a single word. So rude. I have never met airline or airport staff this rude before. So unexpected of Swiss.

Zurich to Seville via Munich. Terrible experience with Swiss. On my initial flight booking the last leg was cancelled and Swiss did not automatically rebook me. I noticed this by coincidence in my profile. I then called them to rebook the missing segment which they did. However the just rebooked the segment but forgot to reissue the ticket which after several days resulted in an automatic cancellation by their system. When I wanted to check in on day before departure a message popped up saying that the booking had been cancelled. When I called Swiss again the initial flight had meanwhile been sold out and I spent two hours on the phone with them until an early morning alternative was found which was not convenient for me at all but which I had to accept due to lack of alternatives. It did not stop here however. After two hours it turned out that the ticket had again not been re-issued and I had to call them again at 2 a.m. in the morning. Worst experience ever with an airline.

Bangkok to Zurich. I had eagerly anticipated this flight with Swiss because of their reputation. The mechanics of the flight went well. Check-in was quick and efficient, we departed and arrived punctually, and the plane was clean and neat. But Swiss uniquely uses a 1-2-2, 2-2-1 configuration. Seat Guru colors the first row of business class as green, but I don't see why. The so-called throne seats are certainly superior, but I didn't think they would be worth the premium that Swiss charges to select one. I was wrong. Yes, Swiss charges business class passengers to select seats. The paired seats at the windows are narrow, not particularly comfortable, and lacking in room to place your electronics without them falling on the floor or between the seats. Swiss also charges business class passengers to use WiFi. I would expect this on Spirit or Southwest, but not long haul on a 4 star airline. And then there was the meal. I chose the beef cheek, which came in a very tasty sauce, but two thirds of the meat was fat and gristle. In sum, this flight was a disappointment. I was considerably happier with seats, food, and service on my China Eastern domestic flight. Go figure.

Tytul_opinii: "did not start in a relaxed way"
Tresc_opinii: Amsterdam to Bangkok via Zurich. Pay special attention when you book a flight with Swiss where you have to make a transfer in Zurich. Swiss offers a ticket for Amsterdam to Bangkok with a connection time of 1 hour and 25 minutes, which they cannot live up to practically. This company is always at least 1 hour late, whereby the race to the gate is blown. Before my trip I followed the flight lx729 (ams to Zurich) for two weeks and was delayed 1 hour to 2 hours every day and coincidentally the day I flew also longer than 1 hour delay. Although the connecting flight had waited, I still made it. Furthermore, the food, the plane and the service is good. But because of the stress of whether I would make the connecting flight or not, my trip did not start in a relaxed way, so I will no longer take a flight with transfer less than 2 hours with Swiss.  Let goed op wanneer je een vlucht boekt met Swiss air waarbij je een overstap moet maken in Zürich. Swiss air bied een ticket aan voor Amsterdam naar Bangkok met een connectie tijd van 1 uur en 25min, wat zij praktisch gezien niet kunnen waarmaken. Deze maatschappij is altijd minimaal 1uur te laat waarbij het rennen naar de gate is geblazen. Ik heb voor mijn reis twee weken lang de vlucht lx729(ams naar Zürich) gevolgd en had elke dag 1 uur tot 2uur vertraging en toevallig de dag dat ik vloog ook langer dan 1uur vertraging. Hoewel de aansluitende vlucht wel had gewacht heb ik deze toch gehaald. Verder is het eten, het vliegtuig en de service goed. Maar door de stress of ik de aansluitende vlucht zou halen of niet begon mijn trip niet bepaald relax, waardoor ik een vlucht met overstap korter dan 2uur met Swiss air niet meer zal nemen.
Hong Kong to Zurich. Nice legroom for emergency exit row 23, but the seat is extremely narrow even for a slim Asian man. Food is terrible and cabin crew didn't give me a smile.

Zurich to Rome. Flight was delayed both times and even was cancelled on the return trip due to "unexpected flight safety shortcomings" which is maybe a way of saying we don't have enough passengers on that flight to make it profitable and thus decided to cancel that flight and move passengers to the next flight! They didn't even bother to inform me that the flight was cancelled up front and I had to find out when trying to check in.

Zurich to Rome return. Very good experience on both flights. Zurich airport is a fantastic hub with good train connections, a lot of available seats and free WIFI for two hours. Airside center has a great atmosphere with a lot of bars, restaurants and shops (but expensive). Check in took only a minute in Zurich and in Rome. On both flights full bar service and a free snack were included. Swiss chocolate at the end oft he flight is a nice touch. Cabin was in good condition, seats were comfortable, only the lavatories in newer A320 are very small. Flight back from Rome was delayed by 30 minutes due to snow in Zurich, the crew could have given more information about that. Nevertheless we had two great flights with Swiss.

Sao Paulo to Barcelona via Zurich. Perfectly clean cabin, amazing food, I loved the chocolate at the end of the service, the Swiss wine was great as well. During the short flight from Zurich To Barcelona the cheese sandwich was great as well. The staff was very attentive and smiley. Very clear English and even Portuguese some of them. Very professional. To be honest I can say is the best airline I flew with.
Trasa: Sao Paulo to Barcelona via Zurich

Tresc_opinii: London to Zurich via Lugano with Swiss Intl Air Lines. I am sorely disappointed by the poor customer service of this airline. My flight from London was delayed and I missed my connecting flight to Lugano. No help or advice was offered on the airline and I had to make my way to the flight desk at Zurich terminal which had a queue that would have taken an eternity to make my enquiry. I had no update on my phone and no one was around to help. I decided to make my way to the train station instead and take the train. Once I had informed Swiss air they confirmed a compensation for the train ticket and the last stretch of the flight that I had missed. They said it would take 22 working days but I am still waiting past that deadline. I have made numerous enquiries and sent e-mails only to be told they are waiting for bank confirmation. I'm absolutely appalled and disappointed by this poor customer service!

Zurich to Bangkok. Flight booking was very easy and comfortable. After that 24 hours before the flight we were able to do the check-in. I actually forgot, but happily SWISS had an automated check-in and sent us the boarding passes per E-Mail with an Apple "Wallet" attachment. Very convenient. Bag-drop was also very nice. After that we went into the Lounge which was very cool with a balcony to see directly to the starting and landing planes. Besides that, they had good food, a lot of drinks to choose from (alcoholic and non alcoholic). The flight itself was also very pleasing, service was very good, the new airplane is designed very well. Seats have massage feature and offer lots of space. One downside is the Entertainment system which doesn't offer the newest and best movies. Still lots to choose from. Food was very pleasing and the menu was in all needed languages (incl. Thai!) which was very convenient for my thai-speaking mother. We always got what we needed and wanted. Staff always stayed very friendly and forthcoming.

Bangkok to Zurich. The online check-in system was very firm, my ticket did not include free baggage. So I could either pay an extra 60 CHF or just check in at the airport. Of course, I did the latter, and of course - then 22 hours later - no aisle was free. The check-in staff as well as the staff at the gate and the flight attendants refused to relocate, although I was reluctant to leave my left upper arm free for a few minutes due to a recent accident. But the staff did not care. Of course, I could have reserved a seat at the time of booking, but usually you will find in the early online check in a free aisle seat. But not at SWISS, because they are not able to offer a functioning Online Check In! Fortunately, in the end had a seat neighbor understanding, otherwise would have become the agonizing 12 hours. I will never fly Swiss anymore!  Das Online-Check In-System behauptete steif und fest, mein Ticket würde kein Freigepäck beinhalten! Also konnte ich entweder zusätzliche 60 CHF bezahlen oder eben erst am Flughafen einchecken. Natürlich tat ich letzteres, und natürlich war dann - also 22 Stunden später - kein Gangplatz mehr frei. Das Check In-Personal ebenso wie das Personal am Gate und die Flugbegleiter weigerten sich, jemanden umzuplatzieren, obwohl ich wegen einem kürzlichen Unfall darauf angewiesen war, den linken Oberarm immer wieder für einige Minuten frei hängen lassen zu können. Dem Personal war das aber völlig egal. Natürlich hätte ich bei der Buchung einen Sitzplatz reservieren können, aber normalerweise findet man beim frühzeitigen Online Check In einen freien Gangplatz. Nur nicht bei der SWISS, weil die nicht fähig ist, eine funktionierendes Online Check In anzubieten! Zum Glück hatte am Ende ein Sitznachbar Verständnis, sonst wären das qualvolle 12 Stunden geworden. Danke SWISS; ich fliege nie mehr mit euch!

Zurich to Manila via Hong Kong. SWISS sells connections that it does not intend to meet from the outset. Despite the short transfer time in Hong Kong, the SWISS waited for cargo rather than transporting their passengers on time! Mind you, the departure delay had nothing to do with weather or security or congestion at the airport; SWISS simply found it more appealing to earn a few extra franks by carrying any cargo than to get their passengers to their destination on time. Advertise with short transfer times, cash in there and then leave the passengers in the rain, which seems to be the business model of this rogue company. The transfer passengers were not rebooked on the next connecting flight but flew on until the early morning. The actually checked-through luggage we were allowed to check out and check in again (1 hour on the luggage belt waited!), And in between we had to wait hours on the transfer airport. A meager food coupon, which has just served for half a snack. In the end I arrived  one night later than planned. SWISS refuses to pay for the hotel bed, which I was unable to use because of additional business and the resulting night-long delay! No apology of any kind, and the complaint will be answered with customer's mockery! Never again SWISS! PS. One year ago I flew with Cathay; at the request of another passenger, I was in the plane to two (!) rows of seats on an absolutely equivalent seat, and the Cathay has thanked by itself and without any impulse on my part with a $ 80 voucher.  Die SWISS verkauft Verbindungen, welche sie von Anfang an nicht einzuhalten gedenkt. Trotz der knappen Umsteigezeit in Hong Kong wartete die SWISS lieber Fracht ab als ihre Passagiere rechtzeitig zu befördern! Wohlgemerkt, die Abgangsverspätung hatte nichts mit Wetter oder Sicherheit oder Stau auf dem Flughafen zu tun; die SWISS fand es einfach attraktiver, mit der Mitnahme irgendwelcher Fracht ein paar zusätzliche Fanken zu verdienen, als ihre Passagiere rechtzeitig ans Ziel zu bringen. Mit kurzen Umsteigezeiten werben, dafür Geld kassieren und die Passagiere dann im Regen stehen lassen, das scheint das Geschäftsmodell dieser Gaunerfirma zu sein. Die Umsteigepassagiere wurden auch nicht auf den nächsten Anschlussflug umgebucht sondern flogen erst am frühen Morgen weiter.  Das eigentlich durchgecheckte Gepäck durften wir selbst aus- und wieder einchecken (1 Stunde am Gepäckband gewartet!), und dazwischen mussten wir uns X Stunden auf dem Umsteige-Flughafen langweilen. Einen mickrigen Essensgutschein, der gerade für einen halben Snack gereicht hat, gab's erst auf massives Insistieren hin. Am Ende kam ich eine Nacht später am Ziel an als geplant. Die SWISS weigert sich, das Hotelbett zu bezahlen, das ich wegen ihrer krummen Zusatzgeschäfte und der daraus erfolgten nächtelangen Verspätung nicht benutzen konnte! Von sich aus keinerlei Entschuldigung, und die Reklamation wird mit Verhöhnungen der Kunden beantwortet! Nie wieder SWISS! PS. Vor einem Jahr flog ich mit Cathay; auf Wunsch eines anderen Fluggastes wurde ich im Flieger um zwei(!) Sitzreihen auf einen absolut gleichwertigen Sitz gezügelt, und die Cathay hat sich von sich aus und ohne jeden Anstoss meinerseits mit einem 80$-Gutschein bedankt...
Trasa: Zurich to Manila via Hong Kong

Tresc_opinii: Tokyo to Zurich. For a 11 hour flight we were greatly disappointed with the comfort of the aircraft. The seats were hard and stiff. When the passenger in front of you would lower their seat the top of the seat would literally be so close making it impossible to reach under the seat or use the folding table comfortably or even to stand up and walk of your seat. The seats were so close together that half of the time passenger next to me would lean on over my seat. During the trip I felt pressed down on all sides and didn’t have a lot of room to relax and I’m a very tiny person. The food was good and the movie options was nice but would not fly this airline again.

I took a morning flight from Zurich to Tel Aviv, a modern Boeing 777 with personal video on every seat, comfortable. The planed departed on time and everything made me a good impression at the beginning. They didn't use the air conditioner at the beginning when people go into the plane and despite the cold weather outside is really hot and suffocating inside. During the flight I ask for a tea, the flight attendant told me Its going to take a lot of time because they are serving cold drinks, at the end she did not bring the Tea. We were sitting with the meals after we finished for more than 45 minutes. At the end I took two finished meals with myself to the galley and one of the flight attendants said to return to the sitting place with the meals and wait for the recollection of the meals. My daughter had a problem with her video system, the flight attendant told me she will solve the problem but she did not solve anything and my daughter could not use the system.

As my daughter is getting ready for a language immersion program this summer, travelling for her first time internationally, on her own I made a change to her itinerary with United, as we used United to book her flights of which part are with Swiss Air. To confirm seats Swiss charges a fee, which was paid for all (4) Swiss legs of the trip. The UA change eliminated one of the legs to reduce her number of stop overs. United helped us with this change, when contacting Swiss to ask to refund the $50 for the assigned seat, the agent 1st said that that was out of policy and refused to allow me to speak to a supervisor.  I am stuck paying $50 for a seat on a flight which we are no longer using that is almost 3 months out? As I have been booking flights for my entire family to spend time in Europe, the booking experience and this event with Swiss is by far the worst of the experiences I Have been encountering. It's not about $50, it's about doing the right thing for the consumer.

Brussels to Bangkok via Zurich. Overall a good flight, with good, clean aircraft and friendly, courteous and professional service. The flight was delayed, by 30 minutes, from Brussels due to 'late incoming aircraft' (the classic excuse from airlines). This made transfer a rush at Zurich and Swiss did nothing to help. The entertainment on-board was good, with a bunch of recent films and series available to keep us entertained. The only issue was the time it took the crew to serve the meals. It took them, literally, more than 2 hours to serve dinner. If it was a restaurant, we would have left. however, as we had good entertainment, it was not that bad. Other than that, a good flight.

Stuttgart to São Paulo via Zurich. I know it's my fault to have 5 kg more luggage than allowed however I am extremely unsatisfied with the cost for 5 kg extra - 150 euros for 5 kg extra. I decided to pay. I could agreed with 50 euros, but 150 euros is a huge exploration.
Trasa: Stuttgart to São Paulo via Zurich

Tresc_opinii: London to Moscow via Zurich. Poor customer service. Booked the flight back in Feb for trip to Russia. 20 days before the flight, I have been notified there is a change of schedule just in email, as the original plan has been cancelled. The new schedule does not fit into my plan so have to cancel it, waste the money on hotels, local bookings etc While I do understand these things happen for airline, when contact Swiss, I have been told it will take them 4 weeks to process the refund in the form of voucher. Excuse me, are you serious! You change the flight and took the money immediately when booking, then when refund it takes 4 weeks to give me your voucher!

Tel Aviv to Zurich. Baggage didn't arrive. They say they will send it later. I don't have a coat now, and it is snowing outside. No compensation, no support. Tried to contact their costumer support many times, no answer, no help.

Zurich to Sao Paulo. Just a marvelous time, from the smile at check-in, departure on time, delicious  new menu with very original dishes, great wines, great seats (14D), plus a large choice of movies, in many languages. A constant attention form the crew, including toilet cleanliness. LX crew are always more smiley. As I suspected rows 14 and 15 are much quieter than others. Mystery of B777-300 acoustics.

Zurich to Barcelona with Swiss Airlines! The pilot removed a drunk passenger and then we were rerouted due to air controller strike in France. None of that was their fault. However, my connecting flight was leaving at 3.20pm. I was supposed to have a 2 hr layover but since we were late I only had 20 min to get to my gate. I asked the flight attendants if I could be let off first to make my connection. They said ‘no’ and I missed my flight and had to cancel that entire leg of my trip. I wasn’t asking for a lot. I’ve seen that done dozens of times. Swiss Air just didn’t care. Can’t accommodate customers with the simplest of requests. I will never fly again.

Moscow to Miami via Zurich. It's higher than normal -good. The flight starts at Moscow Domodedovo  Airport, most common airport for foreign airlines in Russia. It is not worst airport, but not my favorite (it's Sheremetyevo SVO). Airport has some lounges, and couple of Star Alliance lounges - Lufthansa, Austrian and Swiss, if you fly Swiss, you can only use their lounge. The lounge is really small, few places to seat, and nothing special. A320 has European Business Class, so it's Economy, but the middle seat is empty. I dislike that type of Business Class, but the service onboard a little corrected a situation. The crew was very friendly and nice, food was great and they also have Swiss chocolate for any class onboard. If you need a blanket or a pillow you need to ask the crew. The flight was great, than we had a 2-hours stopover in Zurich, the airport is really great as a Swiss Business Class Lounge, after 2 hours, we board A330, the plane was 6,5 years old. And business class on this type of aircraft was also good, but he seats are too close to each other, it is little bit uncomfortable to access to aisle but it's cosy. The seats converts to the full-flat bed and it's comfortable to sleep on. Crew was good, but not more. Food was very delicious, and they also provide some Swiss chocolate and Swiss ice cream - Movenpick which is one of the best in my opinion. Swiss  provide big fluffy pillow and big blanket which is great, and standard amenity kit. I can recommend flying Swiss!

Munich to Zurich. Never again Swiss! This was one of the worst flights ever I made. First, they changed the gate 4 times. Then the aircraft had technical problems. It was a hot summer day and they didn't have switched on the air-conditioning system. I think it was at least 30 degrees. I asked for some water but they just said, that they wouldn't provide anything on this short flight. Finally, we left Munich with 1h30 delay and I was all sweaty. The only good thing was the new plane on this flight.

Tel Aviv to London via Zurich. I have just flown 4 aircrafts Tel Aviv to London and back. The 2 longer flights were excellent we had a Female Pilot. Service was excellent, so was food and beverages and entertainment had a lot of new films to choose from. There was plenty of seat room and the toilets were clean. The short haul flights were pleasant. A cheese sandwich and beverage was quite acceptable for a flight under 90 minutes. Since I found this flight to London I wont fly any other way The transfer was smooth and with no stress.
Trasa: Tel Aviv to London via Zurich

Tresc_opinii: Zurich to Singapore. I would like to record my sincere thanks especially to 2 of your flight stewardesses. I was taken ill before flying. When I boarded the plane, I alerted one of the stewardesses that I might require help during the flight. She was kind and patient as she listened to me. She informed a senior crew member and they both took very good care of me during my flight. They made my 12-hour flight home bearable. They showed genuine concern and care towards me despite the flight being full. These 2 ladies went beyond the extra mile when they also ensured that I was alright while waiting for my luggage. I was touched by this kind gesture.

Bangkok to London via Zurich. Check in was efficient, priority security was same, boarding was chaotic. First sector cabin crew were excellent. I had a throne seat in the small front business cabin which was excellent, apart from the recline controls being under my elbow causing accidental movements (putting the menu card over them resolves the problem). The seat has very good storage and was comfortable. Headphones were not noise cancelling (probably to differentiate First Class) and my Bose would not fit the socket. Second sector was fine, very attentive cabin crew. All on time.

London to Zurich with Swiss, connecting to Bangkok on Thai Airways. Check in man at LHR just tersely said computer won't check you in because you do not have a Thai visa (out 11th Dec back 12 Feb). I explained I would be in transit in Bangkok (6 hours) to Hanoi and would get a Thai transit visa on arrival. He would not accept that. I showed him my onward ticket with Vietnam Airlines, 6 hour layover. He grudgingly said he would have to go and speak to someone. After a while he came back grumbling. By then I had dug out my Vietnam visa. He would have to go and speak to someone again. He came back and grumpily said he could check me in. There was clearly an override button on the computer he just did not want to use it. No smile or apology for inconvenience. Flight to Zurich was ok but nothing special in terms of seat, breakfast or crew. ZRH to BKK was Thai Airways codeshare flight. Immigration in Bangkok and transfer was a breeze.

Paris to Zurich in 2017. Last flight with a delay in excess of 3 hours. Swiss rejected all claims pursuant to applicable regulations, hoping client will drop the case.  Once on board the Bombardier C Series seats are tightly fitted and poorly sprung. Personnel, on board and in terminal, do what they can with what they are given, but clearly sub-par versus past and competition, despite overall higher price for same leg.

Zurich to Berlin. This flight was taken as as the second leg of the SIN-ZRH-TXL flight operated by Swiss as a code share partner of Singapore Airlines. As with most European airlines, Business class seats within Europe are no different from that of economy, the only difference being that the centre seat is blocked. As it was a morning flight, a simple breakfast of muesli, cold cuts and cheese was served. The maître de cabine in charge of business class was pleasant and efficient. There was no inflight entertainment or wifi. For a flight of 80 minutes, one cannot expect more.

London Heathrow to Zurich. Poor airline. Booked them because of their reputation. However all I was proceeded with was attitude from check in staff and airline crew that can’t manage the aircraft. This was the first part of a long haul trip. The check in counter was refusing to check me in as I didn’t have a visa to enter Vietnam. However, as I had a return date with the airline and under 15 days it’s not necessary for a UK resident to obtain a visa before arrival. After 20mins of tooing and froing, a member of customer care could see there was an isssue. And put this quite frankly nasty person in her place, she blamed it on the computer! The crew were poor, they allowed a cattle like boarding experience. No one had control, and I don’t care if your a business man or not! If you are in economy treat everyone with respect. The crew allowed chaos to ensue. Only saving grace was a free soft drink and croissant. I would not recommend.
Berlin to Zurich. Decent airline. Boarding was fast however the sandwich on the short haul wasn't delicious. Ground service in Zurich is good.

I am a frequent flyer and fly around Europe using different airlines. My experience with Swiss is always one of the best ones. Since I have been flying with them years ago, they never gave me a chance to complain about anything. Decent aircrafts even though some of them are old ones, very friendly and attentive staff and really good service. My experience is mainly based on short haul flights within Europe. The only downside for some may be higher pricing, as they are slightly expensive than other airlines but then better service to compensate.
London Heathrow to Zurich. Horrific flight due to minuscule legroom. Must squeeze as much profit out of every inch of space, but Swiss have taken it too far Won’t fly with them again!

Vienna to Zurich. Seems to be, that booking seats with Swiss is useless. Two flights, both flight I reserved 9th row, not sun side seat. First flight, Swiss change me to 9th row sunny side. the second flight they change me from row 9 to row 36.

San Francisco to Zurich. Nice staff, decent meals, but seats incredibly narrow, they have obviously added several rows to economy to earn as much as possible. For a 10 hour flight, incredibly cramped and uncomfortable. To give an example, had to go into the aisle just to get something from under the seat. Fly someone else!

Zurich to Boston. Having flown my share of economy long haul flights, Swiss business class has never disappointed. The E Lounge in Zurich for intl flights is one of the best I know, with a chef cooking on demand and some very nice work booth were I could make undisturbed calls. It also features a nice spa/shower area, which I didn't use this time. On this Boston trip we had their A340 which is a little dated (including the IFE), but has a nice little advantage for solo travelers like me over their B777 seat configuration, the single "K" seats on the right side, available for non-HON members with a lot of privacy. The only really weird thing in this cabin are the 2 bathrooms for which you have to pass the galley, which is inconvenient for the flight attendant that are busy working there, constantly having to deal with passengers sneaking through. All in all, service was great and very friendly, food excellent, I only wish FAs wouldn't entirely disappear for 3h after the main meal on a day flight. But I don't have a real problem with that, I need to stretch my legs anyway from time to time, so I just use the opportunity to pick up a beverage from the galley. I especially liked that I was served nearly the entire flight by the same FA who immediately picked up on my beverage preferences. I also like the consistency, I never had a bad experience with Swiss long haul business, and while there is always room for improvement (like a more up to date IFE), I can recommend it.

Zürich to Amsterdam. Traveled on Dec. 24 with Swiss compliant hand baggage. Though we were among the first 20 passengers boarding the aircraft, the flight attendant at the gate stopped us and requested to send our luggage instead. Other passengers were also stopped randomly, actually not so many. The very last passenger was ridiculously allowed to carry on board his big hand baggage, despite the overhead compartments were already full. The boarding procedure was poor and we accumulated a delay of about 20 minutes on departure. The crew was really unfriendly and demotivated. Once we arrived at destination one of the 2 luggage was damaged. (AVIAPARTNER was very responsive and efficient dealing with the incident.) In conclusion we were on the train to the final destination with a delay of about 90 minutes,  still on time for the Xmas eve dinner. On Jan. 2nd I filed a complaint through the Swiss customer service web site and I am still waiting for their answer. The service level provided by Swiss on this occasion was comparable to a low cost airline.

Prague to Zurich. A ninety minute smooth flight with excellent on-board service and much to be desired ground service. Arrival and departure on time. A "handmade butter sandwich" and a beverage (I chose orange juice) were provided -- the sandwich was surprisingly tasty. Before landing, the flight attendant passed around a basket of chocolate squares -- a stylishly sweet touch. The seats were sufficiently comfortable in a 3 by 3 layout. No personal entertainment equipment on seat back. On the ground, the experience was amazingly unbelievable. I wanted to check in a carry-on suitcase but the clerk at the counter was unable to collect the baggage fee. While a queue formed behind us, the clerk fiddled with an electronic machine to process my credit card before pronouncing that the system was down. Can you believe this? A commercial organization unable to collect revenue! I was directed to a separate booth to pay the fee there and on reaching the place there was no one there. Had to wait several minutes before someone arrived and it took several more minutes for the clerk to take the money -- she had to make phone calls to transmit the credit card information - issue a receipt which I took back to the check in counter -- mercifully was allowed to "skip the line" and my suitcase was checked in. Fortunately it arrived with our flight. This juxtaposition between operational efficiency in air and glitches on the ground was quite perplexing - I was glad I had some time before my flight otherwise I would have become panic struck.

Zurich to Munich. Flew with a new bombardier CS100 (rebranded as an A220) for the first time on a short haul business flight from Zurich to Munich. suffered serious delay waiting on the airside before departure. Service onboard was ok nothing special.

Athens to Malaga via  Zurich. Plane seats are uncomfortable, inflight service limited to a small snack and the flight attendants are polite but unfriendly. The ground staff in Zurich are unprofessional and impolite. They created problems at departure gate for the hand luggage weight or size, but only for some passengers, some were allowed to enter with 2 or three pieces of luggage and some were challenged for having 10 kgs of luggage instead of 8!

Tytul_opinii: Swiss Intl Air Lines customer review
Tresc_opinii: Fast and efficient as well as very friendly check in. Fast track for security is very convenient. Great lounge (modern, airy, friendly staff, good food). Boarding efficient, staff efficient and friendly but a bit distant. Seats are narrow as usual in Europe Business. Food is limited due to very short flight (30 minutes) but good quality. Swiss is still probably the best choice for this route.

Singapore to Zurich. Ground staff was rude and the Lounge was not convincing, but this is not to fault Swiss but SQ. They use a new aircraft for this route, a B777. The seat is very comfortable, for sitting and sleeping position, it has a function to soften the seat, very comfortable. If you have a bulk head seat also the space for the foot is large enough. I had a very good and long sleep thanks to this comfortable seat. I recommend to reserve a seat in the front cabin as it is very quiet there. The service was very good, friendly and attentive. The food was excellent.  Good wine choice. Overall a great experience - I wish every flight was as nice as this one!

Singapore to Zurich. Good service by friendly crew but ridiculously narrow and cramped seats. What a joke. Ordered a low-calorie meal: it was tasteless and the portion was crazy small for a 13-hour flight. On this route, SWISS is put to a huge shame by its code-share partner Singapore Airlines which offers a far better and much superior both product and service across all cabin classes.

Zurich to Chicago. Luggage on time, Nice crew,  flight attendants  speak fluent French! Clean aircraft, Videos are almost brand new and sound is very high quality. Small portions for food including tea and coffee (half cup). Narrow seats. Zurich airport is very expensive, Starbucks black coffee costs about 8 dollars. Overall, I enjoyed the trip and it was one of the best airlines I would recommend it.

Zurich to Singapore. Friendly cabin crew, super clean aircraft. The seat is ridiculously narrow and cramped though: how are passengers supposed to have a comfortable flight & sleep on these seats remains a mystery to me. Shame on SWISS Economy. Food was OK but portions small. Good selection of drinks. Landed on time. Would fly again but not in Economy long-haul.

I have been travelling Swiss weekly since January and as I had two opportunities to fly with them from Zurich to New York and then return from Chicago in first class I thought I’d make the most of it. The experience is five star for a number of reasons. Check-in was smooth and the amazing first class lounge was just a five minute walk away. You go through security in the lounge. To get on board you are taken by a chauffeur to the gate. On-board I was in seat 1A and was immediately met by a very friendly and attentive purser offering champagne. The seat was clean and comfortable. Once we took off the service and menu was exquisite. A great choice of drinks, one of the best menus I have ever had, and then after that experience a mattress is placed into your seat, you get into the luxury pyjamas, and have a great nights sleep. Once you get off the plane you are the whisked through US immigration at JFK. Gate to luggage was 32 minutes. A record. Swiss is brilliant and the return flight was just as good.

San Francisco to Zurich. Superb, as always. The service was impeccable, the meals delicious and elegantly delivered, the seat comfortable and the overall aura was calming and very Swiss. They never fail to impress and the combination of efficiency and service is unbeatable.

One of the main reasons to fly business class for me is to be able to work as continuously as possible. Lose less time at security and use the quiet lounge and internet access, in particular when the plane is delayed. Today Swiss refused me access to the Swiss business lounge because of construction. They gave me a voucher for a drink. I had planned to work at the airport while waiting for my plane and was stuck. They could not care less. They had the senator lounge open but would not let me access it. Swiss is not keeping up technologically and lives on its reputation of a once great company. But such a lack of consideration for its customers does not predict a great future.

Zürich to Amsterdam. Their staff is incredibly difficult to deal with and the ones I had the unfortunate pleasure to deal with were very rude. At check in I was told that I could have the bags that I had with me and that it would be no problem as I had a shoulder bag which was carry on size and a small backpack, once we arrived at the gate an employee pulled me aside and demanded I check my shoulder bag. I wouldn’t have had a problem with that request if I was told ahead of time and I could secure my bag with a lock but he just randomly selected me. When I said I would prefer not to check it because it was an expensive designer bag with no locks, he stated I had no choice and I could either check it or wouldn’t be allowed to board. I continually asked why this was the case and he would not give me an answer. The flight staff were okay though but ground personnel needs a lesson in customer service.

Zurich to Mumbai. Boarding was on time but Swiss should have done a better job of managing some customers who aren't given to respecting queues, even in the Business Class line. One fellow cut in in front of me and the Swiss agent saw him but did nothing. On-board Business Class service on Swiss is top-notch. The hard product is less than satisfactory. In particular, the flat-bed seat is nowhere close to the best in class. Overall a pleasant flight.
Zurich to Newark. Fantastic, exceeded expectations. Food was great, flight crew attentive. Bumpy flight made better by flight crew. Nonstop food and snacks. Highly recommend.

Miami to Zurich. This is my first time to fly with Swiss, and I flew with them because I was able to use my Star Alliance Miles. The flight was delayed by about 1 h and 30 min because of the late arrival of the incoming aircraft. The boarding was somewhat chaotic, but the passengers were mostly Germans, so it was self-organized and fast. The staff was attentive and the catering was OK for Economy, the IFE screens worked without problem, the flight was uneventful. The major concern is the space (lack of it). The aircraft configuration is 3x4x3 is really bad! You feel squeezed between the passengers, literally as a sardine in a can. I had a window seat, and this gave me a little bit of space. However, I would be considering flying with Swiss again, but I will try to avoid Swiss Boeing 777 in this configuration. This is simply unacceptable on a long-haul flights.

Newark to Moscow via Zurich / Vienna in August 218. I had a terrible experience with Swiss.  Our flights were delayed multiple times – not just at the original point of departure but also the connecting flight as well. Overall, the delay exceeded 10 hours. There were no meals or refreshments offered,  when a request for assistance has been raised it was denied at the airport counter. My requests for the issue to be addressed have been left unanswered or answered in an inappropriate manner. My attempts to contact the airline both online and over the phone have not yet received an adequate response.
Trasa: Newark to Moscow via Zurich / Vienna

Tresc_opinii: Florence to New York via Zurich. It was pleasant flights no problem during connecting in Zurich. Nice staff,friendly and giving attention to details. If I need to fly to Europe I will choose it again.
Trasa: Florence to New York via Zurich

Tresc_opinii: SFO-ZRH in Business Class. The Swiss ground service at SFO was a disappointment. It looks like Swiss has outsourced much of its ground operation and the lady who served us was dour, incompetent, and unenthusiastic. Flight took off on time. The Business hard product in the new Swiss 777s, while comfortable, is not in the top league. Unless you pay extra for one of the "throne" seats, which nets you extra privacy as well as a good amount of flat surface area on which to spread your personal items. The onboard Swiss service is top notch, as good as the best in its class. Less impressive is the wi-fi plan offered by Swiss with its quota-based charge. In summary, Swiss provides a good, but not spectacular, Business Class product. One nice touch was access to the new United Polaris Lounge at SFO, which is superb in every way. United has truly upped its game here.

Shanghai to Stockholm via Zurich. Avoid. Old outdated fleet, rude and non service minded cabin crew. Certainly not the level of comfort you'd expect flying business class. Two connected fights with the same experience. Stay away.

Berlin to Boston via Zurich. We had paid to reserve bulkhead seats for our flights. Due to an equipment change, this was not honored on our first (short) flight. Eventually, we got the seats that we had paid for on our return flight, but only after being shuttled through multiple desks and customer service agents, and providing documentation.

Manchester to Zürich. This was a night takeoff and the cabin crew did not dim the lights. Additionally, for takeoff and landing 2 crew checked set belts but ignored the fact that a number of passengers had their seats reclined.

Flew Swiss from Zurich to Barcelona. Bad compensation for totally overbooked flight. Almost no advantage compared to Vueling or easyJet. There is only little food and the quality is bad. The space is very limited and cooling/heating is not very good.

Swiss Intl Air Lines now discriminate if you fly to Geneva! From/to Zürich you get the standard food and all drinks included (as stated on their website). Fly to/from Geneva and you get water. All food and anything other than water you have to pay for, including tea or coffee. The cabin crew hate the policy as do the passengers. Insulting and discriminatory.

Zurich to Bangkok. Unfortunately for me the flight to Bangkok was very uncomfortable due to the very little leg room. Compared with the domestic flight with Bangkok Airways the leg room was here 15 cm more and quite comfortable. Certainly you can make a reservation to Swiss Air in advanced for seats with more legroom near the emergency exits but you need good luck to get it, also you have to pay ca. 110 CHF. I am very disappointed by Swiss.

Boston to Barcelona via Zürich. Poor experience overall. Not one of the 4 flights were on time. From Boston into Zürich, we were delayed by the crew. Even though we got into Zürich with 30 minutes to spare, they bumped us because it was inconvenient  for them to get our luggage switched. Then, that flight was delayed causing us nearly miss our flight. When we raised concerns, the customer service rep in Zürich tucked tail and pointed us to a 3rd party desk. Also, the plane from Boston to Zürich was very cramped and when reclined, there is zero space. Then, on the Zürich to Boston trip, we were again late because they waited for some 1st class passengers (where was that service for us) and we missed our bus transfer home. Thankfully there was one more for the night but we had to wait 2 hours. Just a very poor experience, bad service and a why should I care attitude. One high note, the crew from Zürich to Boston were awesome, very empathetic and apologized over and over. Too bad they do not run the customer service end of things

Barcelona to Berlin via Zürich. These were two very nice flights with a highly motivated and very friendly crew. The service was great, the food was delicious and the Swiss red wine excellent. The planes were in very good condition, especially the CS 300, almost new and very comfortable. Any time gladly again!

Zurich to Bangkok. This was not a pleasant flight. Lack of segregated boarding, low standard food and beverage offering, cramped cabin. They really pack them in in Swiss Business and it's 2nd class. Perfunctory cabin service, perhaps the biggest issue though is the seat. In a 2 year old plane how is it possible that a quarter of the seats do no have direct aisle access? In addition there is minimal storage for personal items and a pretty ordinary IFE selection.

Zurich to Chicago. Swiss used a A330-300 outbound named Neuchatel (HB-JHH, age 8.2 years). Very friendly and multilingual crew. One flight attendant spoke Spanish, English and German. She was excellent. Tasty meals (chicken and spaetzle). Amount of food could be increased as I left the plane feeling peckish. Legroom limited for a bigger person like me (height 6'2). When the seat in front was reclined, my knees could feel it. Age of the plane visible in not-so-responsive and rather smallish IFE-screens. Movie selection limited compared to other competitors. Cabin and toilets were clean. Captain sent a friendly hello from the flight deck which is appreciated. Return leg on pretty new B777-300ER. IFE-screens were huge for economy standards and more responsive. Crew again friendly and professional crew, although I felt they should have responded quicker to an elder couple that was struggling to find free overhead space. Legroom was better on this flight. Meals were inferior to outbound leg, bland chicken and rice. Cleanliness again on a good standard. Again the friendly hello from the Captain was appreciated. Conclusion: Overall I have to compliment Swiss. I will choose Swiss flights operated on the Boeing 777-300ER whenever available (they use both on certain days from Zurich to Chicago) due to bigger legroom and superior screens. However, the A330 offers one advantage, the 2-4-2 setup against the 3-4-3 of the B777 in Economy.

London to Tel Aviv via Zurich. The flight from London to Zurich was very good. The plane was new and modern, service was very good and the sandwich and drinks were of a good standard. The transfer was really easy for the Tel Aviv flight.  I ordered a vegetarian meal. The gnocci was of a very high standard with cherry tomatoes and was served very hot. The plane and toilets were very clean. Audio had plenty of movies to choose from. The whole flight was excellent and I am looking forward to travelling again Swiss. Of course the chocolate was the nice ending to my flights
Trasa: London to Tel Aviv via Zurich

Tresc_opinii: London to Zurich. My best short haul flight experience in Europe. Lunch time flight  to Switzerland out of T2 Heathrow Airport. Take off was slightly delayed but we arrived in time in Zurich. At the Gate we were greeted by a friendly captain and Crew Director and entered a very clean and airy cabin. The cold food was very good, the drinks - including an excellent Swiss white wine - were very good. The crew was very attentive and friendly. On top of this very good flight experience we got - in addition to the usual chocolate - a nice give away from Lucerne. (After a very average flight experience with BA Cityflyer two days earlier, Swiss showed a very different and perfect experience.

Flew Swiss from Krakow to Zürich. Aircraft was clean and comfortable. The behaviour of the staff on board was not good for economy class customers. When separating the business class and economy class customers deboarding the plane it could be done in a more pleasant way.

Paris to Delhi via Zurich. Both flights were wonderful. They both left on time and even arrived in advance in Zurich and Delhi. The aircraft were very clean and the food was very good and tasty but what made the flight so enjoyable was the flight attendants. They were very nice, fast and very helpful and always smiling. Thank you so much to the purser (10/10/2018) on the ZRH-DEL flight who was very professional and made our flight so enjoyable.

Shanghai to Zurich on a 14 year old A340-300. Economy seats are very uncomfortable. Maybe it's related to the equipment age and sloppy maintenance. Entertainment is not good with outdated technology - even my ipad features a larger display. For upfront seat reservation SWISS is asking for a considerable extra fee, however, does not care to deliver since it already happened several times now, that I did not get the seating condition I paid for. The available space with an IFE box being installed in the legroom is unacceptable for a 12 hours flight. Despite my numerous complaints the situation does not change, nor was the extra fee refunded. Seems to me SWISS does not mind to dupe their customers. In a nutshell not worth to be their passenger

Athens to Zurich connecting to Air Canada flight on to Vancouver. I'm not one to post negative reviews online, but my husband and I have tried to talk with representatives from Swiss Air 5+ times now, have sent an email in to their website at their request, and have yet to find a resolution to this incident. When we arrived at Athens to check in for our flight home, the representatives let us know that your system hadn't closed our flights there, and since they were open still we'd have to pay a penalty of $400 euro. We explained many times that we were on those flights and that it must be a system error on your company's behalf, but the representative said the only way to get home that day was to pay that extra fee. She even asked us for evidence that we were on the flights over, and I was able to provide one of the boarding passes, but this wasn't enough. The experience was insulting, frustrating, and honestly felt like extortion.

Belgrade to Brussels via Zurich. Flying with Swiss is very comfortable. From first flight from Belgrade to Zurich, the plane was late. Same aircraft was A220, and it is so comfortable. The snack and drinks was served and Swiss chocolate. Because of the late we almost missed our connection flight from Zurich to Brussel but we manage, but later we have to change the airplane, the reason was that the A3230 has some problems. We take off more than one hour late with new airplane. The flight was quiet and even that we come late to Brussels the Swiss make journey nice. I would fly with them again in future and thank you Swiss.

My first time flying with SWISS from Brussels Airport to Belgrade Airport via Zurich. On the first flight from Brussels to Zurich I flew with Helvetic Airways with Embraer 190. The flight was on time and the crew were great. They served little snack and drinks. Great plane and we landed on time. The second flight from Zurich to Belgrade was with Swiss and the plane was an A220. That was for me a surprise, the plane has great leg room and very comfortable flight. The crew also was great and served us with snack and drinks. The departure was late, the reason was traffic jam over Europe. I recomended the Swiss and Helvetic because thay are really proffesional. I would flight with them again in future.

Our flight London City to Zurich was cancelled. This can happen. But then, the way we were treated by Swiss employees cannot be described. They were either arrogant (in particular at the SWISS desk at LHR), ignorant and incompetent altogether. More than eight weeks later, despite many attempts to get more information, we still haven't heard from SWISS about our complaints, our requests to reimburse our hotel cost or anything. Very disappointing, very unprofessional and to put it in very simple words: miserable customer service.

I do have a personal crucial criteria to rate an airline, when it comes to a long haul trip and that is: how fast the crew can ramp up the service after boarding. I travel business class on night flights and all I want is just to chill down on the plane after a long working day and get me some rest for the next day. Swiss failed to meet my expectations regarding this point. After an important boarding delay I waited one hour to get my first drink offered. I guess Swiss can do much better than this. When you have such a bad start it is hard to be satisfied then. What I did enjoy after cooling down however was my private Business seat. It was a special offer by Swiss to have one seat as wide as two seats on an alternate 1x2x2 / 2x2x1 configuration. For this seat you have to pay more or be a senator of the Lufthansa group. The crew members were very kind.

London to Geneva. The plane was clean and the airline staff welcoming. We were "offered" a free hot drink and sweet savoury snack (I got a chocolate) to compensate for the delay but our flight was 2.5 hours late. After going through security at 5am, I received a text message that my flight was delayed by more than one hour and nothing more. Our flight left after the 8.55am flight. I am really surprised that in 2018 a 90 mins flight can be delayed by 150mins. Informally, we were told that the flight was delayed for maintenance to the fuelling system. If this was planned, we could have been noticed in advance and/or given a seat on another flight. This was a strikingly poor service, considering the price paid for this fight.

The service quality, cabin crew and food was as expected from a Star Alliance member. The flight was also on time and the ride pretty smooth. Unfortunately the cabin interior in economy class is pretty old and doesn't meet expectations at all. Seats are uncomfortable, the entertainment system and screen is garbage and you don't have a usb plug to charge your phone. I think this is ridiculous on a 12 hour long haul flight! I never had this, even with airlines like Delta or TAM. Very disappointing if you arrive in the early morning in Tokyo and your battery is down.

Tytul_opinii: "a very good and no fuss service"
Tresc_opinii: Outstanding Business Class Product. The Swiss flight from Bangkok to Zurich was easy, with comfort, in a very clean environment, and with no problems. Thanks to the experienced Captain, the touch down in Zurich - midst in a heavy storm - went very well and we landed safely. The Cabin Crew were mainly Swiss, rather experienced, friendly and efficient, the rest of the crew were Thai or German, friendly as well and rather young. All together a perfect mix for a very good and no fuss service. I choose the menu from the Peninsula Group Hongkong and was not disappointed: The keall was very good and looked very good. The entertainment system is rather limited but it had a very interesting mixture and all in sufficient quantity. The seat was very comfortable in any position (including bed).

Paris to Zürich. The check in in Paris was friendly and efficient (often in Paris check in staff is not friendly at all but this time I was positively surprised). The lounge is still the same, a bit old and dated, but also here for a change staff was relatively friendly. Unfortunately the staff on board was not overly friendly, hardly greeted the passengers. During the flight they were efficient but not friendly or charming, what a Pity. Food was good. Seating was the usual European business seat, same as in economy just middle seat empty. Overall ok but not great, most of the Service was like in economy - what a pity, because service could make the difference.

Zurich to Sao Paulo, a great experience. A friendly check in, fantastic lounge (the Swiss first class lounge in Zurich is one of the best I have experienced -  great food, great service, and great design. The flight was a treat, super friendly staff, excellent food and wine, great sleep thanks to very comfortable seats / beds, and the arrival is fast and efficient in Sao Paulo. I wish every flight was as good as this one (unfortunately some flights are much less impressive with Swiss).

Sao Paulo to Zürich. If everything goes well, it can be a nice experience, but as soon as there is an issue you will experience a service desert. A mistake was made on my arrival which I understand can happen. What is unacceptable is the way they dealt with it. First they wanted to tell me I made a mistake, then they told me to be more friendly otherwise they would not speak to me (I was not rude but just nervous), and finally they said everybody can make a mistake and I should not make such a fuss, instead of a small excuse this is the way they treat their premium customers. I realized they treat their staff very nicely, greet them etc, but ignore you as a frequent flyer and first class passenger. It is a pity, as it could be a good airline, but with this attitude they will lose customers. And the difference to premium carriers like Singapore, Emirates, Qatar etc is getting bigger.

Took my first flight with Swiss from London to Tel Aviv connecting via Zurich, last week. Having heard good things about the airline, I was keen to try them out and they didn’t disappoint. Have to say it really was one of the most enjoyable trips I’ve made in a good while, incredibly friendly crew, great food/drink along with brilliant seat comfort. I would highly recommend flying with Swiss and look forward to my next journey with them!
Trasa: London to Tel Aviv via Zurich

Tresc_opinii: Nice surprise for the flight from Zurich to Los Angeles and back, the Zurich lounge magnificent service simple but excellent. The same onboard the small cabins sober and very comfortable, quality food and excellent onboard service. Only their LA lounge leaves to be desired but it's not their main hub. FR: Belle surprise pour le vol Zurich Los Angeles et retour , le lounge Zurich magnifique service simple mais excellent et idem à bord les petites cabines sobres et très confortable , nouriture de qualité et le service à bord Excellent . Seul leur lounge de LA laisse à désiré mais ce n’est pas leur Hub principal

Malta to Zurich. Bad airline. Arrogant staff. Dried free sandwiches and no selection. I would rather pay for a sandwich with a low cost airline, have a large selection and a reasonable sandwich. Never again Swiss. Schlechte Airline. Arrogantes Personal. Vertrocknete gratis Sandwiches und keine Auswahl. Da bezahl ich lieber für ein Sandwich bei einer Lowcost Airlines, habe dafür eine grosse Auswahl und ein vernünftiges Sandwich. Nie wieder Swiss.

Overall short distance flights by Swiss are pretty solid. The Service is good, the usual Sandwich on the afternoon is solid for a Inflight meal. Lately Swiss flights have been quite often late - the one on the way from MCR to ZRH (which I flew many times already) is actually almost always late. But thats probably because of Manchester Airport. Seats in the new C Series are comfortable and the space is average. But the screens in the C-Series are actually smaller than my Handy display.

London to Hong Kong via Zurich. I would give it 0 out of 10 if there had been such an option! The flight LX327 was delayed for 2 hours and after another 2 hours of waiting on board, it was cancelled. Ground crews were extremely rude. No hotel accommodation offered but a hotel conference room with sleeping bag! Did not contact me to re-route. Rather, I have to call their customer service hotline (which is not a free phone number in the UK) to re-route my flight. Useless customer service. They claimed that there were no seats on the next day but obviously there were. They only agreed to rebook me with another airline of the Star Alliance, after me telling them there were seats on other flights on the next day! My baggage was delayed for five days. Then, they refused to compensate according to EU261/2004 at all! What a disgrace! Terrible Swiss hospitality. Never travel with Swiss!
Trasa: London to Hong Kong via Zurich

Tresc_opinii: Athens to Geneva via Zurich. The Check in procedure in Athens lasted 20 minutes. I was impressed by the kindness of the ground service. Even though i had paid for 1 luggage they offered to take my cabin baggage for free. Boarding started on time in both flights. They gave priority to families with small children, business class passengers and Star Alliance Gold passengers. By entering the plane you were offered a small chocolate. On both planes every 4 rows of seats there was an overhead screen, where the safety demo was shown. During the first flight it was also playing a promoting video of Swiss and there was also a map, which showed to us the exact position of the plane. In the second flight we only had a map as it only lasted 25 minutes. Shortly after take off which was on time the service started. Each passenger was given a small pie and could have as many drinks as wanted. There were 3 rounds for Drink service. About half and hour before landing we were given again the classic Swiss Int Airlines chocolate. In the second flight they gave us a bottle of water and again the chocolate. All in all the crew did a great job and they were very friendly and helpful. Totally recommend Swiss for your Flight.

Our gate for the flight Zurich to Amsterdam LX 734 at 17h35 was changed twice, making people walk with their bags from one side of the airport to the other, only for Swiss to announce that our flight was finally cancelled. They said it was due to weather conditions, but we figured out that a KLM flight to Amsterdam scheduled for the same time flew (with a 40min delay, but flew), which means that Swiss Air not telling passengers the truth. Swiss then redirected us to the transfer desk. Only 4 counters out of 12 were open to serve customers with cancelled flights. As a consequence I waited in a queue (standing, not sitting) for 7 hours - for Swiss to tell me that there was no flight before Saturday 18h00 via Vienna, making me arrive in Amsterdam at past 22:00. There are 11 direct flights daily between Zurich and Amsterdam - how come they suggested me this ridiculous option. This spoilt the entire weekend that I had scheduled and organized with family. I had to cancel the entire trip because it did not make sense to fly to Amsterdam for one day only. Also, after having waited at the counter I was told that in order to be refunded for my tickets I need to call Swiss. I have not tried yet but I know it will be useless - they will probably not even answer and refuse to help in any way. I have travelled a lot in my life and I travel frequently to the UK for work, but I have never ever seen something like that - Swiss does not care about its customers and does not respect our rights. As simple as that.

Montreal to Zurich on Swiss International. Following a quick check-in by a very pleasant ground agent I made my way to the lounge. Swiss uses Air Canada’s Maple Leaf lounge in Montreal. The lounge had decent selection of drinks but food was sparse given time of day. Boarding was orderly and quick. On board, the hard product was showing its age. The IFE screen was super small for business class and there were scuff marks on the surfaces. Had a great seat all to my own. The seat was hard and not all that comfortable in flat position. The amenity kit was very low quality and had just the basics in a metal Swissgear box that looked like a pencil case. The food was tasty but the service was all at once with all the courses piled on the tray. It felt like an upscale version of economy with steel cutlery. IFE had a decent selection of movies. The staff were the standout in what was a below average business class experience. Flight left slightly late but arrived on time.

Bangkok to Paris via Zurich. Disapointed The flight was fully booked and very noisy with many children. The flight attendants were not friendly, polite but not friendly, not warm. The cabin is nice and elegant, the seat very comfy. The meals were not great, the quantity was tiny. Hard to get a drink. The movies selection was poor and a bit dated. The business lounge in Zurich was very bad with almost nothing to eat and lounge staff unfriendly and very rude.

I was very impressed with the quality of service that the airline provided from Zurich to JFK. The aircraft is new and impeccably clean. We were served a snack and a drink after departure A few hours later with a choice of hot lunches and the portion and quality of food was good. The quality of food is very healthy. Every hour we were offered drinks. The WC was cleaned every hour and herbal soap, hand-cream and facial spray of essential oils were in the bathroom. The seats were very comfortable and especially the headrest. Pillow and blanket of high quality. Later, two hours before landing at JFK, we were offered hot towels, and served a hot sandwich and choices of drinks and Movenpick ice cream and Swiss chocolate. Great service and great people, and I would say above other European airlines that I have flown. The A330 provided a great ride back to NYC. I flew Lufthansa 747 going from JFK to AMS via Frankfurt and on the leg back, SAS to Zurich and Swiss from Zurich to NYC. They are all partners. But I wasn't happy that I could not check in online and received boarding passes for all the segments. I was lucky to have gotten a good seat once I checked in at Oslo SAS counter for the segment, Zurich to NYC. Also, my experience at the Zurich airport was above many in the region. I will do it again if I have to.

Prague to Frankfurt with Swiss Intl Air Lines. The aircraft was a brand new A220-300 (CS-300) and therefore in top condition. The departure and arrival were slightly delayed. The machine was in a clean condition and the flight attendants friendly. The catering and the drinks according to the circumstances and the small piece of chocolate always a pleasure. Overall, a good experience except for the seats, which were a bit too hard and at takeoff and landing and the aircraft in the rear area are much too loud mechanical sounds from, which are very disturbing.

Highly disappointed with my Swiss business class flight from Bangkok to Zurich. Their business class seats are probably the worst I have experienced as some of the seats offer zero privacy and personal space. The Swiss business cabin is weirdly designed with basically three main types of seats: Window/Aisle pair seats which are simply horrible as: - the person seating near the window has no access to the aisle - the seats are very narrow - zero personal space - zero privacy The personal space aspect simply shocked me. There was just a middle console between the aisles and window seat and there was no space to set your bag or shoes or anything actually. This was shocking and I asked the flight attendants to help me understand if I was missing something and she apologized that some seats indeed have no real space and I should just use the overhead bins. The seats offered zero privacy and we also very narrow due to the outdated design although this was a relatively newly delivered aircraft. I would say that from a seat perspective it was terrible. The middle pair seats are better from a personal storage space although they are weird: one is very narrow from a space perspective and offers zero privacy yet a bit more storage space compare to the window/aisle pair and the other middle seat one offered much more space and privacy. Then there are the “throne” seats which come only one in a row which seem great but they cost an extra Euros. So overall from a seat perspective I found it horrible seating in the right side of the plane.
